translated: Those who lack superknowledge, who abide in the glorious Vajrayāna, and who are proud of their knowledge of many treatises,

original: rnam rtog chos kyi snying dang mkhas pa nyid kyi dregs ldan 'grel bshad chen po dag / byed pa de ni glang chen long ba myos bzhin dgra yi rgyud ni rgyal ba'i slad //
analyzed: rnam rtog chos kyi snying dang mkhas pa nyid kyi dregs ldan 'grel bshad chen po dag / byed pa de ni glang chen long ba myos bzhin dgra yi rgyud ni rgyal ba'i slad //
translated: compose great commentaries with the essence of conceptual Dharma. They are like blind elephants, intoxicated, always causing their own lineage to decline, the enemy of the Conqueror.

original: gang gnas de yis rang gi rgyud ni nyams byed 'di ni rtag tu bdud kyi gnyen //
analyzed: gang gnas de yis rang gi rgyud ni nyams byed 'di ni rtag tu bdud kyi gnyen //

original: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan rgyal bdag gsung ni mi shes ngang tshul rtag long bas //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan rgyal bdag gsung ni mi shes ngang tshul rtag long bas //
translated: Those who are proud of their knowledge, always blind in their ignorance of the speech of the Conqueror,

original: theg mchog 'grel bshad byas te long ba gzhan dag lhung du bcug nas dmyal bar rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: theg mchog 'grel bshad byas te long ba gzhan dag lhung du bcug nas dmyal bar rab 'jug pa //
translated: compose commentaries on the supreme vehicle, and having caused other blind ones to fall, enter into hell.

original: 'gyod pa dang ni srog gcod la sogs mi dge'i lam la bud med bde bas sems drangs shing //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ni srog gcod la sogs mi dge'i lam la bud med bde bas sems drangs shing //

original: dpal ldan shes rab bde nyams rdo rje'i tshig bcom phyi yi longs spyod dag gis zil mnan pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan shes rab bde nyams rdo rje'i tshig bcom phyi yi longs spyod dag gis zil mnan pa'o //
translated: The glorious wisdom, the experience of bliss, the vajra words, the subjugation by the enjoyments of the outer enjoyments.

original: gang zhig ston pa nyid kyis lung bstan rgyal bdag bde ster rdo rje theg par mtha' dag ni //
analyzed: gang zhig ston pa nyid kyis lung bstan rgyal bdag bde ster rdo rje theg par mtha' dag ni //
translated: The one who is prophesied by the Teacher himself, the Victorious One, the giver of bliss, the vajra vehicle, all

original: 'grel bshad dag dang bsdu ba mdzad pa rdo rje mchog 'dzin bdag 'dra'i byang chub sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: 'grel bshad dag dang bsdu ba mdzad pa rdo rje mchog 'dzin bdag 'dra'i byang chub sems dpa' ste //
translated: The commentary and the compilation, the vajra holder of the supreme, like me, a bodhisattva.

original: de dag 'dir ni lha dang lag 'gro mi rnams smin pa'i don du sangs rgyas mthur smra la //
analyzed: de dag 'dir ni lha dang lag 'gro mi rnams smin pa'i don du sangs rgyas mthur smra la //
translated: Here they speak of the Buddha's power for the sake of ripening gods, nagas, and humans.

original: gang dag mngon shes lnga med de dag bdag cag rgyal dbang yin zhes bden pa min pa smra //
analyzed: gang dag mngon shes lnga med de dag bdag cag rgyal dbang yin zhes bden pa min pa smra //
translated: Those who do not have the five higher perceptions, they speak untruth, saying, We are the lords of the victorious ones.

original: ma 'ongs dus na rtag tu rtog ge la sogs bstan bcos la gtad sna tshogs blos //
analyzed: ma 'ongs dus na rtag tu rtog ge la sogs bstan bcos la gtad sna tshogs blos //
translated: In the future times, always attached to the treatises of logic and so on, with various minds,

original: sangs rgyas pa yang gzhan gyi rtog ge dang phrad dbang gis log pa 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa yang gzhan gyi rtog ge dang phrad dbang gis log pa 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: Even the Buddha’s doctrine will be perverted by the power of contact with the sophistries of others.

original: rtog ge la gtad de yis 'dod pa'i yul la lam ni ston par byed pa gang //
analyzed: rtog ge la gtad de yis 'dod pa'i yul la lam ni ston par byed pa gang //
translated: Those who are devoted to sophistry will teach a path that is the object of their own desires.

original: de dag nyid kyi blo ngan skyon ni 'joms byed 'grel bshad bdag gis bri bar bya //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi blo ngan skyon ni 'joms byed 'grel bshad bdag gis bri bar bya //
translated: I will write a commentary that will destroy the faults of their bad ideas.

original: chags bral med pa'i 'dod chags mtha' yas chu la zhe sdang sbrul dang chu srin dkrigs //
analyzed: chags bral med pa'i 'dod chags mtha' yas chu la zhe sdang sbrul dang chu srin dkrigs //
translated: The river of desire, which is without detachment, is full of the snakes and crocodiles of hatred.

original: gti mug klong ni rab mang 'gro 'ong nor dang dpal la brkam pa'i rba rlabs can //
analyzed: gti mug klong ni rab mang 'gro 'ong nor dang dpal la brkam pa'i rba rlabs can //
translated: The ocean of delusion is full of whirlpools that go and come, and of waves of greed for wealth and glory.

original: 'gyod sogs gsod pa la sogs las kyi rta gdong 'khor mo sgra drag srid pa yi //
analyzed: 'gyod sogs gsod pa la sogs las kyi rta gdong 'khor mo sgra drag srid pa yi //
translated: The ocean of existence has the faces of the horses of karma, such as regret and killing, and makes a loud sound.

original: chu gter la ni dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa'i 'grel bshad @109b rtag tu mnyan pa ste //
analyzed: chu gter la ni dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa'i 'grel bshad @109b rtag tu mnyan pa ste //
translated: The commentary of the glorious Vajrayāna is always to be heard on that ocean.

original: shes rab rlung gi dar gyis myur 'gro myang 'das pha rol don gnyer chen po rnams //
analyzed: shes rab rlung gi dar gyis myur 'gro myang 'das pha rol don gnyer chen po rnams //
translated: Those who strive for the goal of the other shore of nirvāṇa, who go quickly on the wind of wisdom,

original: dam pa'i bde bas myur du rgal bar byed slad de ni lam gyi 'dren ma dang // nyon mongs bdud tshogs 'joms pa mkhas pa'i yang dag ye shes yid bzhin nor bu ste //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde bas myur du rgal bar byed slad de ni lam gyi 'dren ma dang // nyon mongs bdud tshogs 'joms pa mkhas pa'i yang dag ye shes yid bzhin nor bu ste //
translated: It is the wish-fulfilling gem of the perfect wisdom of the wise, which conquers the hosts of demons of the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po nyid ster 'di ni kun du ston par byed pa'o //🔽gang zhig phung po la sogs sgrib pa rab bcom yul ni pra phab brgyad lta bu //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po nyid ster 'di ni kun du ston par byed pa'o // gang zhig phung po la sogs sgrib pa rab bcom yul ni pra phab brgyad lta bu //
translated: It is the bestower of the lordship of the three worlds.

original: kun mkhyen bde ster de nyid gcig pu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste //
analyzed: kun mkhyen bde ster de nyid gcig pu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste //
translated: It is the single omniscient bestower of bliss, the great seal of the vajra-holder, which has conquered the obscurations of the aggregates and so forth, like the eight prognostic images.

original: de bor sangs rgyas nyid slad nor la chags shing 'khyog po'i snying ldan brtags ma dag / gang gis sten byed rnam brtags blo can de yis de yang 'pho ba thob par byed //

translated: The wise one who relies on it, having examined it, will also attain the transference for the sake of buddhahood, having discarded that which is examined, which has a crooked heart attached to wealth.

original: 'dod chags nyams las sdig ste gang phyir shin tu sdug ma las ni zhe sdang skye //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyams las sdig ste gang phyir shin tu sdug ma las ni zhe sdang skye //
translated: From the degeneration of desire, there is sin, and from that, hatred arises towards a very dear one.

original: sdang las gti mug 'di las rang gi rdo rje lhung las sems ni rtag rmongs te //
analyzed: sdang las gti mug 'di las rang gi rdo rje lhung las sems ni rtag rmongs te //
translated: From hatred, from this delusion, the vajra falls, and the mind is always confused.🔽Engaging in other objects, such as food and drink, all that is not supreme,

original: mchog min ma lus bza' dang btung ba la sogs yul gzhan dag la rab tu 'jug / de yis sems la co dris bde ba nyams shing skye ba drug tu 'khor bar 'gyur //

original: kun mkhyen lam don gnyer ba rnams la sgra dang sgra min rnam dpyad chen po med //
analyzed: kun mkhyen lam don gnyer ba rnams la sgra dang sgra min rnam dpyad chen po med //
translated: For those striving for the path of omniscience, there is no great analysis of sound and non-sound.🔽Even with various bad local languages, they always enter the path of the great ones.

original: sna tshogs yul skad ngan pa yis kyang chen po rnams kyi lam la rtag tu 'jug / sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i sems kyi dbang gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gzhan la //

analyzed: lung ston dag la lha klus bkod pa'i sgra sogs rtsod pa don gnyer rnams kyi gzhan //

original: lam bzang rin chen 'di ni bag med kyi //
analyzed: lam bzang rin chen 'di ni bag med kyi //
translated: This jewel of a good path is not for the careless,

original: sems can gzhan pa dag la byin pa na //
analyzed: sems can gzhan pa dag la byin pa na //
translated: When you give to other sentient beings,

original: rang khyim dgon pa dag tu rab zhugs la //
analyzed: rang khyim dgon pa dag tu rab zhugs la //
translated: you enter your own house, which is a wilderness,

original: yul ngan chom rkun rnams kyis 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: yul ngan chom rkun rnams kyis 'phrog par byed //
translated: and the thieves of the bad realms steal it.

original: the tshom 'gyod pa dag dang gnyid dang ni //
analyzed: the tshom 'gyod pa dag dang gnyid dang ni //

original: le lo rgod pa'i chom rkun rnams kyis kyang //
analyzed: le lo rgod pa'i chom rkun rnams kyis kyang //

original: gnyen 'dun thibs po'i nang du zhugs pa yi //
analyzed: gnyen 'dun thibs po'i nang du zhugs pa yi //
translated: enter the thickets of your relatives

original: lam bzang rin chen dag ni 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: lam bzang rin chen dag ni 'phrog par byed //
translated: and steal the jewels of the good path.🔽Stealing life, stealing what is not given, and stealing others’ spouses,🔽lying, harsh words, and slander,🔽frivolous words, covetousness,

original: srog gcod ma byin gzhan gyi bud med dang // brdzun dang tshig rtsub dag dang phra ma dang // 'khyal par gyur pa'i tshig dang brnab sems dang // gnod sems lta ba ngan pa'i chom rkun dang // yod pa'i sdig dang nye ba'i sdig pa dang //
analyzed: srog gcod ma byin gzhan gyi bud med dang // brdzun dang tshig rtsub dag dang phra ma dang // 'khyal par gyur pa'i tshig dang brnab sems dang // gnod sems lta ba ngan pa'i chom rkun dang // yod pa'i sdig dang nye ba'i sdig pa dang //
translated: malice, and bad views are thieves.🔽The five thieves of existence and the five of nonexistence,

original: gsod 'khu dbang po mngon par zhen pa ste //
analyzed: gsod 'khu dbang po mngon par zhen pa ste //
translated: killing, backbiting, and clinging to the senses,

original: chom rkun lnga pa lnga po 'di dag gis //
analyzed: chom rkun lnga pa lnga po 'di dag gis //

original: rin po che ni rtag tu 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: rin po che ni rtag tu 'phrog par byed //

original: shin tu bza' dang btung ba sna tshogs dang // longs spyod du ma'i chom rkun de dag gis //
analyzed: shin tu bza' dang btung ba sna tshogs dang // longs spyod du ma'i chom rkun de dag gis //

original: brtson 'grus ldan du zin kyang bag med cing //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan du zin kyang bag med cing //
translated: Even if they are diligent, they are careless.

original: brgyal bar gyur pa nyid la 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: brgyal bar gyur pa nyid la 'phrog par byed //
translated: They are robbed by the thieves of sleep.

original: rang nyid kyis ni yongs su ma brtags par /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni yongs su ma brtags par /
translated: Without examining it themselves,

original: @111a * // rin thang chen por gyur pa yin ma yin //
analyzed: @111a * // rin thang chen por gyur pa yin ma yin //
translated: They do not know whether it is of great or little value.

original: shes par bya phyir g-yon can gzhan la ston //
analyzed: shes par bya phyir g-yon can gzhan la ston //
translated: In order to find out, they show it to a swindler,

original: de yi tshig gis rin chen 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: de yi tshig gis rin chen 'dor bar byed //
translated: And by his words they discard the jewel.

original: gang dag rin chen bzang po rig pa rnams //
analyzed: gang dag rin chen bzang po rig pa rnams //
translated: Those who know good jewels🔽Should be made to examine the great jewel.

original: rin chen chen po yongs su rtog tu gzhug / de dag rnams kyi rnam dag tshig gis ni //
analyzed: rin chen chen po yongs su rtog tu gzhug / de dag rnams kyi rnam dag tshig gis ni //
translated: By their pure words

original: rang gi rin chen rnam par shes par bya //
analyzed: rang gi rin chen rnam par shes par bya //
translated: They will know their own jewel.🔽The Buddha, the Bodhisattvas,🔽Their fathers, mothers, daughters, sisters,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems rnams dang // pha dang ma dang bu mo sring mo dang // bu dang spun zla 'dod pa'i chung ma yi //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems rnams dang // pha dang ma dang bu mo sring mo dang // bu dang spun zla 'dod pa'i chung ma yi //
translated: Sons, brothers, and beloved wives

original: gzugs rnams dag gis bdud ni bgegs byed do //
analyzed: gzugs rnams dag gis bdud ni bgegs byed do //
translated: Are forms that Mara uses to create obstacles.

original: de phyir bla ma dam pas gnang ba yi //🔽lam bzang rin chen dag ni slob ma yis //
analyzed: de phyir bla ma dam pas gnang ba yi // lam bzang rin chen dag ni slob ma yis //
translated: Therefore, the good disciple should give up🔽the relatives who are thieves of the good jewel of the path

original: chom rkun rtsa lag yongs su btang byas te //
analyzed: chom rkun rtsa lag yongs su btang byas te //
translated: given by the good guru,

original: 'bad pas shin tu legs par sba bar bya //
analyzed: 'bad pas shin tu legs par sba bar bya //
translated: and should guard it well with effort.

original: dpa' bo'i rim pa bdag byin brlab pa yi //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rim pa bdag byin brlab pa yi //
translated: The stage of the hero, the stage of self-consecration,

original: rim pa dag kyang thar pa'i lam ma yin //
analyzed: rim pa dag kyang thar pa'i lam ma yin //
translated: is not the path of liberation.

original: shin tu rnam dag rim pa gcig pu ni //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag rim pa gcig pu ni //
translated: The very pure, single stage

original: thar pa'i slad du sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan ;
analyzed: thar pa'i slad du sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan ;
translated: is taught by the buddhas for the sake of liberation.

original: / mtshams med lnga po dag ni byas pa rnams //
analyzed: / mtshams med lnga po dag ni byas pa rnams //
translated: Those who have committed the five heinous acts🔽are seized by the king of the gods

original: dbang don bde ba nyid ni gang zhig gis //
analyzed: dbang don bde ba nyid ni gang zhig gis //
translated: through the bliss of the reality of the meaning of the empowerment

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud dag la //🔽rgyal ba'i dbang pos yang dag gzung bar gyur //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud dag la // rgyal ba'i dbang pos yang dag gzung bar gyur //
translated: in the tantras of method and wisdom.

original: dpa' bo'i rim pa phyi rol la min te //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rim pa phyi rol la min te //
translated: The stage of the hero is not external;

original: lus la srog zad nyid la 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la srog zad nyid la 'di gsungs so //
translated: it is taught to be in the body, the exhaustion of life.

original: bdag byin brlab pa dag ni stong pa la //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab pa dag ni stong pa la //
translated: In the self-consecration, which is emptiness,

original: khams gsum po ni mthong bar gyur pa'i mtshan //
analyzed: khams gsum po ni mthong bar gyur pa'i mtshan //
translated: the signs of the three realms are seen.

original: 'khor ba snying po med de zad gyur pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba snying po med de zad gyur pa //
translated: Samsara is exhausted, having no essence.

original: de las skyes bu'i sangs rgyas nyid 'bras te //
analyzed: de las skyes bu'i sangs rgyas nyid 'bras te //
translated: The result of a person’s buddhahood arises from that,🔽like the ripening of the fruit of a plantain tree

analyzed: chu shing gi ni 'bras bu smin pa dang // chu shing nyams pas yang dag 'byung ba bzhin //

original: sdig pa dang ni shing srin sems can rnams //
analyzed: sdig pa dang ni shing srin sems can rnams //
translated: Sinners and the worms in wood

original: gang las byung ba de dag de nyams byed //
analyzed: gang las byung ba de dag de nyams byed //
translated: are produced from that which causes their decay.

original: de bzhin rnal 'byor dag gi sems de ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rnal 'byor dag gi sems de ni //
translated: In the same way, the mind of the yogi

original: sgyu ma rnam par nyams par byed pa yin //
analyzed: sgyu ma rnam par nyams par byed pa yin //
translated: is produced from the decay of illusion.🔽Nondual, unmoving, without a family,

original: gnyis med g-yo ba med dang rigs med dang // 'dod dang mchog tu mi 'gyur 'dod chags che //
analyzed: gnyis med g-yo ba med dang rigs med dang // 'dod dang mchog tu mi 'gyur 'dod chags che //
translated: desire, the supreme, unchanging, and great desire,🔽entity and nonentity, nonexistence,

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa med pa dang // ye shes dang ni sems dpa' kun du bzang //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa med pa dang // ye shes dang ni sems dpa' kun du bzang //
translated: pristine consciousness, and the bodhisattva Samantabhadra,🔽free of afflictions, with great afflictions,

original: nyon mongs med dang nyon mongs chen po dang // lhan skyes dpal ldan byang sems thig le 'dzin //
analyzed: nyon mongs med dang nyon mongs chen po dang // lhan skyes dpal ldan byang sems thig le 'dzin //
translated: coemergent, glorious, and holding the bindu of bodhicitta,🔽the glorious Kālacakra, the vajra,

analyzed: dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje dang // thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rnal 'byor ro //

original: snying rje dang ni stong nyid sku //
analyzed: snying rje dang ni stong nyid sku //
translated: Compassion and emptiness are the body,

original: dus ni kun rdzob @111b gzugs can ma //
analyzed: dus ni kun rdzob @111b gzugs can ma //
translated: and time is the form of the relative.

original: stong nyid 'khor lo zhes brjod de //
analyzed: stong nyid 'khor lo zhes brjod de //
translated: The wheel of emptiness is said to be

original: dus kyi 'khor lo gnyis med 'dod //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo gnyis med 'dod //
translated: the nondual wheel of time.

original: 'di yi dpal ni myur thob slad //
analyzed: 'di yi dpal ni myur thob slad //
translated: In order to quickly attain this glory,

original: rtag tu rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs //
analyzed: rtag tu rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs //
translated: the yoginīs’ feet should always be

original: rnal 'byor gang zhig sgom pa de'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gang zhig sgom pa de'i //
translated: meditated upon by the yogin.

original: bgegs ni rtag tu nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: bgegs ni rtag tu nyams par 'gyur //
translated: The obstacles of that yogin will always be destroyed.

original: dgra dang seng ge glang chen dbang po me dang ltos 'gro'i bdag dang chom rkun zhags pas 'ching //
analyzed: dgra dang seng ge glang chen dbang po me dang ltos 'gro'i bdag dang chom rkun zhags pas 'ching //
translated: Enemies, lions, powerful elephants, fire, the lord of death, thieves, and bondage by a noose,🔽turbulent oceans, piśācas, the fear of death, illness, harm to the senses,

original: chu gter 'khrug dang sha za 'chi ba'i 'jig byed nad dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe ba dang // dbul dang bud med dang bral mi bdag 'khrugs pa'i 'jigs dang rdo rje ltung dang nor nyams rnams //
analyzed: chu gter 'khrug dang sha za 'chi ba'i 'jig byed nad dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe ba dang // dbul dang bud med dang bral mi bdag 'khrugs pa'i 'jigs dang rdo rje ltung dang nor nyams rnams //
translated: poverty, separation from women, the fear of the king’s wrath, falling like a vajra, and loss of wealth—

analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni gsal bar dran byed de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur //
translated: all of these will completely vanish for one who clearly recalls the feet of the yoginīs.

original: glang chen shing rta rta dang rab tu mang ba'i mi mchog thams cad lus la go bgos shing //
analyzed: glang chen shing rta rta dang rab tu mang ba'i mi mchog thams cad lus la go bgos shing //

original: lag na mdung dang 'khor lo ral gri mda' gzhus dgra rnams kyis ni g-yul du 'joms byed pa //
analyzed: lag na mdung dang 'khor lo ral gri mda' gzhus dgra rnams kyis ni g-yul du 'joms byed pa //
translated: with spears, discuses, swords, and bows in their hands, destroy the enemies in battle.

original: 'chi ster drag po'i gzugs can phyogs dang mtshams son dgra de thams cad rang gi mtshon gyis ni //
analyzed: 'chi ster drag po'i gzugs can phyogs dang mtshams son dgra de thams cad rang gi mtshon gyis ni //
translated: All those enemies, who are the bringers of death, fierce-looking, in the directions and quarters, are destroyed by one's own weapons,

original: bcom ste rgyal ba'i grags pa gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dran byed pas kun nas 'thob //🔽kun nas seng ge'i sgra sgrogs shin tu rnam par 'gyur ba'i bzhin ldan mche ba rnon po gtsigs //🔽rnga ma g-yo zhing sder mo gug la brtan pas glang chen myos pa'i klad pa rab tu 'gems //
analyzed: bcom ste rgyal ba'i grags pa gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dran byed pas kun nas 'thob // kun nas seng ge'i sgra sgrogs shin tu rnam par 'gyur ba'i bzhin ldan mche ba rnon po gtsigs // rnga ma g-yo zhing sder mo gug la brtan pas glang chen myos pa'i klad pa rab tu 'gems //
translated: and one attains the fame of victory, O Yoginis, by remembering your feet.🔽With a face full of great transformation, roaring like a lion all around, sharp fangs bared,🔽shaking the tail, curved claws, firm, one crushes the head of an intoxicated elephant.

original: rab khros nyi ma 'char ka'i mig can ro 'dzin ral gri g-yo ba'i gsod 'dod ral pa can //
analyzed: rab khros nyi ma 'char ka'i mig can ro 'dzin ral gri g-yo ba'i gsod 'dod ral pa can //

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la ring du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la ring du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: He who remembers the feet of the Yoginis, which remove fear, will go far.

original: mdog sngo mig ni ser skya 'gram pa gnyis po myos pa'i chu bo rab tu mang bas gang //
analyzed: mdog sngo mig ni ser skya 'gram pa gnyis po myos pa'i chu bo rab tu mang bas gang //
translated: Blue-colored, with yellowish eyes, both cheeks filled with the abundant waters of intoxication,

original: rnam mang ljon pa mchog rnams rtsad nas 'byin zhing rab tu grugs byed 'brug bzhin sgra dag sgrogs //
analyzed: rnam mang ljon pa mchog rnams rtsad nas 'byin zhing rab tu grugs byed 'brug bzhin sgra dag sgrogs //
translated: he uproots the best of many trees, he burns, he roars like thunder.🔽With his hands he binds, with the tips of his teeth he opens, he is the best of elephants.

original: lag pas bcing ba byas nas so yi rtse mo dag gis 'byed byed rab mchog glang po'i bdag / gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yi lus ni gtong bar byed //
analyzed: lag pas bcing ba byas nas so yi rtse mo dag gis 'byed byed rab mchog glang po'i bdag / gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yi lus ni gtong bar byed //
translated: He who remembers the feet of the Yoginis, which remove fear, will give up his body.

original: kun nas me lce rab 'bar phyogs dang mtshams su du ba kun gyis mun pa chen po gtibs //
analyzed: kun nas me lce rab 'bar phyogs dang mtshams su du ba kun gyis mun pa chen po gtibs //
translated: All around, the flames blaze, in the directions and quarters, the smoke creates a great darkness.

original: grong dang dgon pa dus gcig sreg cing skar mda' ltung ba bzhin du me stag 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: grong dang dgon pa dus gcig sreg cing skar mda' ltung ba bzhin du me stag 'phro bar byed //
translated: He burns the villages and the forests at the same time, he shoots sparks like falling stars.

original: sems can rnams la dus kun @112a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dus kun @112a * //
translated: To all beings, at all times,🔽he is the one who burns, the one who creates darkness, the one who shoots sparks.

original: du ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed phyogs kun khyab par gyur pa'i me //
analyzed: du ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed phyogs kun khyab par gyur pa'i me //
translated: In which direction is the fire that terrifies the dead?

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la bsil ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la bsil ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The yogis remember the feet of the yoginis, which bring relief from fear.

original: khros shing mig sman sngon po'i mdog dang 'khyog por bgrod pa'i lus can drag po'i phat sgra sgrogs //
analyzed: khros shing mig sman sngon po'i mdog dang 'khyog por bgrod pa'i lus can drag po'i phat sgra sgrogs //
translated: The angry one, with a body the color of blue collyrium and crooked, utters the fierce sound of “phat.”

original: mche ba 'khyog po lce gnyis dang ldan 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed rlung gi shugs can rab tu gtum //
analyzed: mche ba 'khyog po lce gnyis dang ldan 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed rlung gi shugs can rab tu gtum //
translated: The fierce one, with two curved fangs and a tongue, is the wind that terrifies the dead, very fierce.

original: drag po'i mig dang gdengs ka gsal byas yang dag phrad pa za bar byed pa'i gdengs can dbang //
analyzed: drag po'i mig dang gdengs ka gsal byas yang dag phrad pa za bar byed pa'i gdengs can dbang //
translated: The fierce one, with eyes and a bright hood, is the king of the snakes, who eats when he meets the right person.

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur ;
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur ;
translated: The yogis remember the feet of the yoginis, which bring relief from fear.

original: / sdang ba'i sems ldan lag pa'i mthil na gzhu dang rna ba'i bar du mda' bkang mdung dang ni //
analyzed: / sdang ba'i sems ldan lag pa'i mthil na gzhu dang rna ba'i bar du mda' bkang mdung dang ni //
translated: The angry one, with a bow in the palm of his hand and an arrow to his ear, and a spear,

original: 'khor lo ral gri lag thogs phyogs dang mtshams su gnas pas dam pa'i lam gyis bkag nas //
analyzed: 'khor lo ral gri lag thogs phyogs dang mtshams su gnas pas dam pa'i lam gyis bkag nas //
translated: Armed with swords and discuses, they stand in the directions and the intermediate directions, blocking the path with the true path.

original: dgon par lam 'gron skye bo rgyu ba dang phrad 'joms byed drag po'i mig can chom rkun pa //
analyzed: dgon par lam 'gron skye bo rgyu ba dang phrad 'joms byed drag po'i mig can chom rkun pa //
translated: In the wilderness, the travelers on the path are met by the robbers with fierce eyes, who destroy and plunder.

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la ring ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la ring ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: But for the one who remembers the feet of the yoginis, they are far away.

original: lag pa dag ni zhags pas bcings shing rkang pa'i padma zung ni lcags sgrog dag gis gtams //
analyzed: lag pa dag ni zhags pas bcings shing rkang pa'i padma zung ni lcags sgrog dag gis gtams //
translated: The hands are bound with ropes, and the pair of lotus feet are fettered with chains.

original: dge ba'i chu dang bral bas lce dang mgrin pa mchu skams lus po skem zhing bkres pas gzir //
analyzed: dge ba'i chu dang bral bas lce dang mgrin pa mchu skams lus po skem zhing bkres pas gzir //
translated: Deprived of the water of virtue, the tongue, throat, and lips are dry, the body is emaciated, and one is tormented by hunger.

original: nyin mtshan dus su rje bo khros pa'i bka' yis kun du srung ma rnams kyis srung byed pa //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dus su rje bo khros pa'i bka' yis kun du srung ma rnams kyis srung byed pa //
translated: Day and night, at the time of the angry master's command, one is guarded by the guardians everywhere.

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yang de las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yang de las grol bar 'gyur //
translated: But for the one who remembers the feet of the yoginis, they are far away.

original: chu gter bzhon pa la zhon mtha' yas drag po'i rlung gis chu yi gter ni 'khrug byed cing //🔽kun du 'khor bar byed la chu gter chom rkun chu srin nya yi rigs kyis bkag gyur te //
analyzed: chu gter bzhon pa la zhon mtha' yas drag po'i rlung gis chu yi gter ni 'khrug byed cing // kun du 'khor bar byed la chu gter chom rkun chu srin nya yi rigs kyis bkag gyur te //
translated: The ocean is agitated by the violent wind, the steed of the god of love, and the water is churned up.🔽The ocean is blocked by the water-monsters, sharks and whales, and it is surrounded by the ocean-thieves.

original: me yi til mar gdug pas 'phangs pa me yi char chen kun nas rgyun du 'bab pa la //
analyzed: me yi til mar gdug pas 'phangs pa me yi char chen kun nas rgyun du 'bab pa la //
translated: The rain of fire falls down continuously, and the water is sprinkled with the poison of fire.

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yang de las pha rol 'gro //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de yang de las pha rol 'gro //
translated: The yoginīs, whose feet are the destroyers of fear, remember him, and he goes beyond that.

original: phat ces 'jigs rung sgra sgrogs kha nas me 'bar lag na gri gug dang ni thod pa thogs //
analyzed: phat ces 'jigs rung sgra sgrogs kha nas me 'bar lag na gri gug dang ni thod pa thogs //
translated: The terrible sound of “phat” is uttered from his mouth, fire blazes, and he holds a knife and a skull-cup in his hands.

original: ro langs gdug pa'i sems ldan phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor dag la yang dag gnas shing 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: ro langs gdug pa'i sems ldan phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor dag la yang dag gnas shing 'jigs par byed //
translated: The evil-minded zombies are situated in the maṇḍalas of the ten directions and frighten.

original: bkres pas gzir te sha dag za zhing mi khrag la dga' lus skams gos dang bral ba dag /
analyzed: bkres pas gzir te sha dag za zhing mi khrag la dga' lus skams gos dang bral ba dag /
translated: They eat flesh, are fond of human blood, have dry bodies, and are naked.

original: @112b gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la srung ba byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: @112b gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs dag 'jigs 'phrog dran pa de la srung ba byed par 'gyur //
translated: He who remembers the feet of the Yoginis will be protected.

original: nyin bzhin 'khun zhing sor mo'i rtse mo zlum po nyams te sna dang mchu dang rna ba nyams //
analyzed: nyin bzhin 'khun zhing sor mo'i rtse mo zlum po nyams te sna dang mchu dang rna ba nyams //
translated: Day after day, the tips of the fingers become emaciated, the nose, lips and ears are destroyed,

original: gdong dang mgrin pa rkang lag dag gi rma rnams las ni rnag rul mang po rab tu 'bab //
analyzed: gdong dang mgrin pa rkang lag dag gi rma rnams las ni rnag rul mang po rab tu 'bab //
translated: and from the wounds on the face, throat, hands and feet, much putrid matter flows.

original: rul pa'i dri nga'i mthu las gnyen bshes tshogs kyis shi ba'i lus bzhin yongs su btang gyur pa //
analyzed: rul pa'i dri nga'i mthu las gnyen bshes tshogs kyis shi ba'i lus bzhin yongs su btang gyur pa //
translated: By the power of the foul smell, the groups of relatives abandon him as if he were a dead body.

original: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs bzang dran byed nad kyis btang zhing 'dod dang ldan par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs bzang dran byed nad kyis btang zhing 'dod dang ldan par 'gyur //
translated: He who remembers the feet of the Yoginis is abandoned by the disease and becomes endowed with desire.

original: 'bar bcas mche rnon gdengs can 'phrog byed sha ra bha dang stag dang glang chen gdong ldan zhing ;
analyzed: 'bar bcas mche rnon gdengs can 'phrog byed sha ra bha dang stag dang glang chen gdong ldan zhing ;
translated: He who is bitten by the serpent of disease, which has a hood, sharp fangs, and is the robber of life, which has the face of a Sharabha, tiger, or elephant,

original: / lag na 'khor lo ral gri mda' dang rtse gsum lcags kyu rdo rje thogs pas phyogs kun du //
analyzed: / lag na 'khor lo ral gri mda' dang rtse gsum lcags kyu rdo rje thogs pas phyogs kun du //
translated: and which is in all directions with hands holding a discus, sword, arrow, trident, goad, and vajra,

original: byang chub bsam gtan gcig gzhol mchog bde la gnas sgrub pa po sdigs dbang po'i pho nya gang //
analyzed: byang chub bsam gtan gcig gzhol mchog bde la gnas sgrub pa po sdigs dbang po'i pho nya gang //
translated: The yoginīs, who are the messengers of the lord of wrath, who are devoted to the supreme bliss of the single-pointed concentration of enlightenment,

original: de dag rnal 'byor dbang phyug ma zhabs gang gi rang yid la byed de la nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rnal 'byor dbang phyug ma zhabs gang gi rang yid la byed de la nyams par 'gyur //
translated: are ruined by the one who attends to the feet of the yoginīs.

original: dbyar ni nags nas grong gi bar du 'dam rdzab kyis gang lam dag la yang khur khyer zhing //
analyzed: dbyar ni nags nas grong gi bar du 'dam rdzab kyis gang lam dag la yang khur khyer zhing //
translated: In the summer, the roads are filled with mud from the forest to the village, and one carries a load.

original: dgun ni gos dang bral bas kha ba'i lam du bgrod cing yul gzhan dag tu'ang 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: dgun ni gos dang bral bas kha ba'i lam du bgrod cing yul gzhan dag tu'ang 'gro bar byed //
translated: In the winter, one goes to another country, traveling on snowy roads, without clothes, and cold.

original: so ga chu med 'jigs bcas mya ngan lam du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs dbul po gang //
analyzed: so ga chu med 'jigs bcas mya ngan lam du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs dbul po gang //
translated: In the spring, one is tormented by the sun’s rays on a road of suffering, without water, and poor.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs bzang sgom byed sdug bsngal de dag gis btang 'dod dang ldan par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs bzang sgom byed sdug bsngal de dag gis btang 'dod dang ldan par 'gyur //
translated: The yoginīs, who meditate on the good feet of the yoginīs, are filled with the desire to give up those sufferings.

original: mchan khung mig dang rna ba sna dang kha lus brjod pa dag las mi bzad dri 'byung zhing //
analyzed: mchan khung mig dang rna ba sna dang kha lus brjod pa dag las mi bzad dri 'byung zhing //
translated: From the armpits, eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and body, unbearable smells arise.

original: bud med kun dang bral bas dus kun du ni dga' ba'i bde ba dang bral skal ngan te //
analyzed: bud med kun dang bral bas dus kun du ni dga' ba'i bde ba dang bral skal ngan te //
translated: By being separated from all women, one is always deprived of the pleasure of joy, unfortunate.

original: mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis rtag tu bud med sdang bar gyur pa gang la de dag kun //
analyzed: mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis rtag tu bud med sdang bar gyur pa gang la de dag kun //
translated: By the power of the result of non-virtue, one is always hostile to women, in whom all these are found.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni bde ba mchog sbyin bsgoms pas skal bzang kha dog gzugs can 'gyur //🔽'khus phyir g-yog 'khor gang la mi dbang 'khrugs te 'jigs pa'i gshin rje lta bur mtha' gcig tu //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni bde ba mchog sbyin bsgoms pas skal bzang kha dog gzugs can 'gyur // 'khus phyir g-yog 'khor gang la mi dbang 'khrugs te 'jigs pa'i gshin rje lta bur mtha' gcig tu //
translated: By meditating on the feet of the yoginis, which bestow the gift of supreme bliss, one becomes fortunate, having the form of color.

original: gsod pa la zhen 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sde rnams myur du yang dag skul byed pa //
analyzed: gsod pa la zhen 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sde rnams myur du yang dag skul byed pa //
translated: For the sake of those who are not masters, the retinue of servants is disturbed, as if by the terrifying Yama, who is intent on killing, and who quickly urges on the hordes that bring about the fear of death.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni 'jig rten gsum po kun gyi mgon dag rang yid la bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni 'jig rten gsum po kun gyi mgon dag rang yid la bsgoms pas //
translated: By meditating in one's mind on the feet of the yoginis, who are the protectors of the entire triple world,

original: de dag rnams kyi de yang rab tu zhi zhing 'dod pa thams cad sbyin pas mchog sbyin 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi de yang rab tu zhi zhing 'dod pa thams cad sbyin pas mchog sbyin 'gyur //
translated: their anger is pacified, and they bestow the supreme gift of all that is desired.

original: gang dag 'ga' zhig @113a * //
analyzed: gang dag 'ga' zhig @113a * //
translated: Those who, in some way,

original: tu ni mkha' las rdo rje rab ltung bud med 'grogs las rtag par yang //
analyzed: tu ni mkha' las rdo rje rab ltung bud med 'grogs las rtag par yang //
translated: The “tu” is the vajra falling from the sky, and the woman is always the companion.

original: skye dang skye ba gzhan slad 'chi dang brgyal dang chags bral slar yang byed pas rnal 'byor ma'i //
analyzed: skye dang skye ba gzhan slad 'chi dang brgyal dang chags bral slar yang byed pas rnal 'byor ma'i //
translated: In order to be born again and again, one must die, faint, and be separated from desire.

original: dpal ldan las dang ye shes mchog gi chu skyes la gnas rdo rje'i zhabs dag bsgoms pa yis ;
analyzed: dpal ldan las dang ye shes mchog gi chu skyes la gnas rdo rje'i zhabs dag bsgoms pa yis ;
translated: By meditating on the glorious lotus of supreme action and wisdom, the vajra feet are placed.

original: / de dag rnams kyi de yang rab zhi 'chi ba nyid 'gyur slar yang skye ba ldan pa min //
analyzed: / de dag rnams kyi de yang rab zhi 'chi ba nyid 'gyur slar yang skye ba ldan pa min //
translated: That of those is also pacified, and death itself becomes birth again.

original: gang dag nyin dang mtshan mor bud med 'grogs la rnam par chags pas nor kun nyams 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang dag nyin dang mtshan mor bud med 'grogs la rnam par chags pas nor kun nyams 'gyur zhing //
translated: Those who, day and night, are attached to women and lose all their wealth,

original: skye ba gzhan gyis bag chags bsgos pa'i sems las de ni slar yang mang po rab 'byung bas ;
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyis bag chags bsgos pa'i sems las de ni slar yang mang po rab 'byung bas ;
translated: that arises again and again from the mind tainted by the latent tendencies of other births.

original: / shes rab rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi mi mnyam mnyam pa'i zhal ni sna tshogs gzugs can gang //
analyzed: / shes rab rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi mi mnyam mnyam pa'i zhal ni sna tshogs gzugs can gang //
translated: The unequalled face of the yoginīs of wisdom is of various forms.

original: rgyal ba mchog gis mchod cing bstod pa bsgoms pas de ni nor kun nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog gis mchod cing bstod pa bsgoms pas de ni nor kun nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By meditating on the praise of the supreme Victor, one's wealth will not decline.

original: ser skya lug dang kun 'dar ma ste nyi zla sgra gcan lam gsum bgrod rnams rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: ser skya lug dang kun 'dar ma ste nyi zla sgra gcan lam gsum bgrod rnams rnal 'byor ma //
translated: Kapila, Eḍaka, and Aṇḍaka, the three paths of the sun, moon, and Rāhu, are yoginīs.

original: dngos dang dngos med rab nyams mnyam bgrod zhabs de dag ni de dag rnams kyi ye shes sku //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rab nyams mnyam bgrod zhabs de dag ni de dag rnams kyi ye shes sku //
translated: The one who traverses equally the real and the unreal, whose feet are those, is their gnosis body.

original: de yi lhan skyes bde ba'i go 'phang 'gyur med gcig 'di de dag de nyid gang gis dran //
analyzed: de yi lhan skyes bde ba'i go 'phang 'gyur med gcig 'di de dag de nyid gang gis dran //
translated: By that, the state of innate bliss is the one unchanging, which they remember as thatness.

original: de yi skye ba 'di la ma lus 'jigs 'phrog 'dir brjod 'bras bu myur du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi skye ba 'di la ma lus 'jigs 'phrog 'dir brjod 'bras bu myur du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: In this life, the one who takes away all fear, the result of this is quickly attained.

original: dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi gnas ni rdo rje nor bu'i khyim ste der 'jug lam //
analyzed: dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi gnas ni rdo rje nor bu'i khyim ste der 'jug lam //
translated: The abode of the glorious yoginīs is the vajra gem house, the path to enter there.

original: nyon mongs med cing bdud nyams sngon du rgyal bas gsungs pa'i bstod pa bdag gis 'dir brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs med cing bdud nyams sngon du rgyal bas gsungs pa'i bstod pa bdag gis 'dir brjod do //
translated: Free from afflictions, the one who conquers Māra, the praise spoken by the Victor, I have expressed here.

original: skyes bu gang dag bdud kyi grogs kyis rtag tu mi bden mun par song zhing lam nyams pa //
analyzed: skyes bu gang dag bdud kyi grogs kyis rtag tu mi bden mun par song zhing lam nyams pa //
translated: May those who are always in the darkness of untruth, who are on the wrong path, who are the friends of Mara,🔽having obtained this path, come near to the house of the Vajra Jewel.

original: de dag rnams kyis lam 'di thob nas rdo rje nor bu'i khyim dang ring min 'ong gyur cig / du ba la sogs lam gyis lhan skyes bde ba'i go 'phang bsgoms na de ni dus 'khor lo //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis lam 'di thob nas rdo rje nor bu'i khyim dang ring min 'ong gyur cig / du ba la sogs lam gyis lhan skyes bde ba'i go 'phang bsgoms na de ni dus 'khor lo //
translated: The Wheel of Time, which is cultivated by the path of smoke and so forth, is the state of innate bliss.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan gyi yan lag 'gro ba'i bla ma chos kyi 'khor lo 'di la gnas //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan gyi yan lag 'gro ba'i bla ma chos kyi 'khor lo 'di la gnas //
translated: The guru of migrators, who has the thirty-two major marks, abides in this wheel of Dharma.

original: lha rnams mgo yi gtsug gi nor bu'i 'od zer tshogs kyis zhabs kyi padma la gtugs shing //
analyzed: lha rnams mgo yi gtsug gi nor bu'i 'od zer tshogs kyis zhabs kyi padma la gtugs shing //
translated: The hosts of light rays from the crest jewels of the gods touch the lotus feet.

original: dam pa'i lam ni ston byed nyin mor byed pa bzhin du mun pa thams cad 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: dam pa'i lam ni ston byed nyin mor byed pa bzhin du mun pa thams cad 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: The sun, which shows the path of the holy, destroys all darkness.

original: lha klu mi dang lha min dbang po'i cod pan dag gis zhabs pad la gtugs gang //
analyzed: lha klu mi dang lha min dbang po'i cod pan dag gis zhabs pad la gtugs gang //
translated: The lotus feet are touched by the crowns of the lords of gods, nagas, humans, and demigods.

original: yang dag @113b ye shes nyin byed 'gro ba gsum gyi dpal ldan chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: yang dag @113b ye shes nyin byed 'gro ba gsum gyi dpal ldan chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
translated: The sun of perfect pristine consciousness, the glory of the three worlds, abides in the wheel of Dharma.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs ri dags rab gtum gsod byed dpal ldan sh'akya seng ge de'i //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs ri dags rab gtum gsod byed dpal ldan sh'akya seng ge de'i //
translated: The glorious Śākya lion, who slays the wild beasts of demons and afflictions,

original: rtag tu 'gro la brtse dang de yi shes rab kyis bskul 'grel bshad bdag gis bri //
analyzed: rtag tu 'gro la brtse dang de yi shes rab kyis bskul 'grel bshad bdag gis bri //
translated: I, inspired by his compassion and wisdom, will write this commentary for beings.

original: k'a yig las ni rgyu zhi ba //
analyzed: k'a yig las ni rgyu zhi ba //
translated: From the letter “kā” comes the pacification of causes.

original: la yig 'di la thim pa nyid //
analyzed: la yig 'di la thim pa nyid //
translated: The letter “la” dissolves into this.

original: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
analyzed: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
translated: The letter “ca” is the moving mind.

original: kra yig rim pa bcings las so //
analyzed: kra yig rim pa bcings las so //
translated: The letter “kra” is bound in stages.

original: dus ni 'gyur med bde ye shes //
analyzed: dus ni 'gyur med bde ye shes //
translated: Time is unchanging bliss-wisdom.

original: thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid de //
translated: It is the nature of method and compassion.

original: 'khor lo shes bya'i rnam 'gro dpal //
analyzed: 'khor lo shes bya'i rnam 'gro dpal //
translated: The wheel is the glory of the progression of objects of knowledge.

original: shes rab stong nyid bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab stong nyid bdag nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the nature of emptiness.

original: 'di ni dpal ldan dus 'khor lo ;
analyzed: 'di ni dpal ldan dus 'khor lo ;
translated: This is the glorious Kālacakra.

original: / rdo rje'i rnal 'byor thams cad nas //
analyzed: / rdo rje'i rnal 'byor thams cad nas //
translated: From all the vajra yogas,

original: bden pa gnyis la gnas pa 'di //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la gnas pa 'di //
translated: This abides in the two truths.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i rjod byed 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i rjod byed 'gyur //
translated: It becomes the expression of the tantra.

original: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan zhing //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan zhing //
translated: The Sugata prophesied

original: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur pa //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur pa //
translated: And Mañjuśrī inspired

original: 'jig rten mgon po bdag gis ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po bdag gis ni //
translated: The Lord of the World.

original: rgyud 'di'i 'grel bshad bri bar bya //
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i 'grel bshad bri bar bya //
translated: I will write a commentary on this tantra.

original: byis pa mkhas pa rmongs rnams la //
analyzed: byis pa mkhas pa rmongs rnams la //
translated: For the childish, the wise, and the deluded,

original: rgyud kyi gsang ba gsal byed de //
analyzed: rgyud kyi gsang ba gsal byed de //
translated: This tantra clarifies the secrets,

original: ma yis bu la phan pa bzhin //
analyzed: ma yis bu la phan pa bzhin //
translated: Like a mother benefiting her child.

original: lus can thams cad bde don du'o //
analyzed: lus can thams cad bde don du'o //
translated: For the sake of the happiness of all embodied beings,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i lam mchog ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i lam mchog ni //
translated: The supreme path of Vajrasattva,

original: gang gis rnal 'byor pas rig byed //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor pas rig byed //
translated: Which the yogi should know,

original: de phyir dri ma med pa'i 'od //
analyzed: de phyir dri ma med pa'i 'od //
translated: Therefore, this Stainless Light,

original: 'grel bshad 'di ni myur du bri //🔽bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba las bdud dang bgegs mtha' dag nyams par byed pa mchog gi 'dod pa'i lha dang dam pa'i
analyzed: 'grel bshad 'di ni myur du bri // bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba las bdud dang bgegs mtha' dag nyams par byed pa mchog gi 'dod pa'i lha dang dam pa'i
translated: This commentary, I will quickly write.

original: lam nges pa'i mdor bsdus pa chen po ste dang po'o /
analyzed: lam nges pa'i mdor bsdus pa chen po ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first great summary called The Supreme Wish-Fulfilling God and the Holy Path, the Destroyer of All Demons and Obstacles from the Stainless Light, the commentary on the root tantra of the Condensed Kalachakra Tantra in 12,000 verses.

original: // /'dir dang por re zhig rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs te brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa lung bstan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // /'dir dang por re zhig rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs te brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa lung bstan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, following the root tantra, one should explain the subject matter, the expression, the connection, and so forth, and the prophecy of the Condensed Tantra, and so forth.

original: phyi nas bsdus pa'i rgyud la dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: phyi nas bsdus pa'i rgyud la dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Later, the purpose and the purpose of the purpose of the Condensed Tantra, and so forth, should be explained.

original: 'di la dang por re zhig brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'di la dang por re zhig brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par gzigs nas /
translated: Here, first of all, having perceived the subject matter, the expression, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams la rang gi sems kyi bsam pas skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba bde ba chen po'i gnas @114a * //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams la rang gi sems kyi bsam pas skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba bde ba chen po'i gnas @114a * //
translated: for the disciples who are free from doubt, by the intention of his own mind, he bestows in this life the fruit of buddhahood, the supreme abode of great bliss,

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por rdo rje seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por rdo rje seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
translated: the supreme original buddha, seated on a vajra lion throne in the great mandala of Vajradhātu.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo'i rgyal po dang lha dang klu dang lha dang lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo'i rgyal po dang lha dang klu dang lha dang lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He is surrounded by hosts of buddhas, bodhisattvas, wrathful kings, gods, nāgas, and goddesses.

original: khams gsum pas zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pas zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa /
translated: He is the one to whom the lotus feet are bowed by those in the three realms.

original: khams gsum gyi 'khor los sgyur ba /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'khor los sgyur ba /
translated: He is the universal monarch of the three realms.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa /
translated: He is the supreme primordial buddha who is not of a class.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal dus kyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal dus kyi 'khor lo //
translated: He is the Blessed One, glorious Kālacakra.

original: zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pas /
analyzed: zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pas /
translated: He is the one who, when requested by Sucandra,

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa /
translated: taught the twelve thousand supreme primordial buddhas,

original: rigs med pa /
analyzed: rigs med pa /
translated: who are not of a class.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo //
translated: He is the king of tantras, the Kālacakra.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa /
translated: He is the one who is embraced by the name-mantra that is the manifest gnosis body of Vajradhara.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa /
translated: He is the one who is the manifest vajra words of all tantras.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa /
translated: He is the one who opens the jeweled casket of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa ;
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa ;
translated: It is based on the worldly and transcendent truths.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa rnam pa bzhi dang rdo rje rnam pa bzhis yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa rnam pa bzhi dang rdo rje rnam pa bzhis yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is purified by the four complete enlightenments and the four vajras.

original: sku bzhi dang rigs drug dang bden pa bcu gnyis dang de kho na nyid bcu drug dang stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa /
analyzed: sku bzhi dang rigs drug dang bden pa bcu gnyis dang de kho na nyid bcu drug dang stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa /
translated: It is the expressed and the expresser, which are the nature of the four kāyas, the six families, the twelve truths, the sixteen realities, the sixteen emptinesses, and the sixteen compassions.

original: dbang bskur ba 'jig rten pa'i bcu dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bcu gcig pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba 'jig rten pa'i bcu dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bcu gcig pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa /
translated: It is the very clear illumination of the worldly initiations, the ten, and the transcendent, the eleventh.

original: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya chen mo dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rab tu gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya chen mo dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rab tu gsal bar byed pa /
translated: It is the very clear illumination of the activities of the karma consort, the gnosis consort, the mahāmudrā consort, and the worldly and transcendent siddhis.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang mngon par dbang bskur ba dang ; sgrub thabs dang ye shes te le'u lnga'i bdag nyid dam brtag pa lnga'i bdag nyid ni mi la sogs pa'i sems can mtha' dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang mngon par dbang bskur ba dang ; sgrub thabs dang ye shes te le'u lnga'i bdag nyid dam brtag pa lnga'i bdag nyid ni mi la sogs pa'i sems can mtha' dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bstan to //
translated: The five chapters or five sections are taught for the sake of all sentient beings, such as humans, to attain perfect buddhahood.

original: de las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang / rgyud ston pa'i don du gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa gzhan rnams dang /
analyzed: de las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang / rgyud ston pa'i don du gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa gzhan rnams dang /
translated: Among them, Mañjuśrī is the compiler of the condensed tantra, I am the one who will explain the commentary for the sake of taming the brahmin sages in the future, and others such as Yamāntaka are for the sake of teaching the tantra.

original: shambha la'i yul la sogs pa grong khyer bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dam @114b pa'i lam thob pa la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to //
analyzed: shambha la'i yul la sogs pa grong khyer bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dam @114b pa'i lam thob pa la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata has predicted that all sentient beings living in the ninety-six billion cities, such as the land of Shambhala, will attain the path of the virtuous.

original: 'dir rdul phra rab 'dus pa sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'dir rdul phra rab 'dus pa sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: Here, the world-realms are preceded by the aggregation of atoms.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sngon du 'gro ba ni sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sngon du 'gro ba ni sems can rnams so //
translated: Sentient beings are preceded by the world-realms.

original: sems can sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The mundane and supramundane consecrations are preceded by sentient beings.

original: mngon par dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa goms pas 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa goms pas 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The mundane accomplishments up to the limit of existence in Akanishtha are preceded by consecration, accomplished by the practice of the accumulation of merit, the meditation of the mandala circle.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag dang skye ba snga ma'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje kun rdzob dang dmigs pa med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis rdul phra rab 'dus pa las 'das shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag dang skye ba snga ma'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje kun rdzob dang dmigs pa med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis rdul phra rab 'dus pa las 'das shing /
translated: The mundane siddhis are preceded by the strength of the accumulations of merit and direct knowledge, the strength of the imprints of emptiness and compassion from previous lives, and the strength of the imprints of the relative and the absence of reference points.🔽

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang bral ba phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos grub sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang bral ba phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos grub sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of mundane powers is the accomplishment of the gnosis of the great seal, which is beyond the aggregation of atoms by the power of the accumulations of merit and gnosis, and the imprints of emptiness and compassion in previous lives, and is free from conceptual meditation on maṇḍalas and so on.

original: de bas na dang por 'jig rten gyi khams kyi brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dang por 'jig rten gyi khams kyi brtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, first is the investigation of the world realm.

original: de nas nang gi brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas nang gi brtag pa'o //
translated: Then, the investigation of the inner.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba'i brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba'i brtag pa'o //
translated: Then, the investigation of empowerment.

original: de nas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i brtag pa'i //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i brtag pa'i //
translated: Then, the investigation of the accomplishment of mundane powers.

original: de nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes bsgrub pa'i brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes bsgrub pa'i brtag pa ste /
translated: Then, the investigation of the accomplishment of supreme, unchanging gnosis.

original: de ltar na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin rgyud kyi rgyal po ni brtag pa lnga'am le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin rgyud kyi rgyal po ni brtag pa lnga'am le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Thus, the king of tantras is the nature of five investigations or chapters, in just that order.

original: 'dir thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the topic is the vajra yoga that is the nature of method and wisdom, the primordial buddha, the transcendent conqueror Kālacakra, who is without a buddha lineage.

original: de yang le'u lnga po 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas te /
analyzed: de yang le'u lnga po 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas te /
translated: That is also the nature of the five chapters.

original: dang por re zhig 'jig rten gyi khams gyi le'u la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gnas bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor chen po phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dang por re zhig 'jig rten gyi khams gyi le'u la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gnas bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor chen po phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: First, in the chapter on the world systems, the nature of the teacher is presented in the lines beginning “The omniscient one” and so on, the nature of the place is presented in the lines beginning “In the center of the world realm,” and the nature of the perfect great retinue is presented in the lines beginning “The bodhisattvas.”

original: gsol ba 'debs pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdo rje'i rnal 'byor brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga la sogs pa dang sna tshogs 'byung ba dang dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba gsol ba 'debs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdo rje'i rnal 'byor brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga la sogs pa dang sna tshogs 'byung ba dang dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba gsol ba 'debs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the essence of the supplication, which is the five letters of great emptiness and so on, the origin of diversity, the maṇḍala, and the empowerment,

original: ston pa po'i lan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas @115a * //
analyzed: ston pa po'i lan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas @115a * //
translated: the essence of the reply of the teacher,🔽the essence of the origin and dissolution of the world systems, planets, stars, sentient beings, mantras, life, and so on,

original: pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang gza' dang rgyu skar dang sems can dang sngags dang srog la sogs pa 'byung ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang rgya mtsho dang gling dang ri'i grangs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang gza' dang rgyu skar dang sems can dang sngags dang srog la sogs pa 'byung ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang rgya mtsho dang gling dang ri'i grangs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the essence of the number of maṇḍalas of wind and so on, oceans, continents, and mountains,

original: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba chen po 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / shin tu phra ba'i dbugs la sogs pas nyin mo'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba chen po 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / shin tu phra ba'i dbugs la sogs pas nyin mo'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The nature of the thirty-one existences, the nature of the arising of a great cakravartin, the nature of the measure of the day through the very subtle breath, and so on,

original: 'jam dpal lung bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang byed pa'i skar rtsis kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbu ma'i rtsa'i dbugs rnams las gza'i rkang pa dang rgyu skar gyi rkang pa skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal lung bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang byed pa'i skar rtsis kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbu ma'i rtsa'i dbugs rnams las gza'i rkang pa dang rgyu skar gyi rkang pa skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the nature of the prophecy of Mañjuśrī, the nature of the astronomy of the tenets, and the nature of the arising of the lunar mansions and the lunar mansions of the planets from the breath of the central nāḍī,

original: khyim bcu gnyis kyi rnam pas sa 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbyangs 'char ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sgra gcan la sogs pa sa'i stobs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdzong 'joms pa dang bsrung ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bcu gnyis kyi rnam pas sa 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbyangs 'char ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sgra gcan la sogs pa sa'i stobs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdzong 'joms pa dang bsrung ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The twelve houses are the nature of the essence of the wheel of the earth, the nature of the essence of the rising melody, and so on, the nature of the essence of Rāhu, and so on, the nature of the essence of the power of the earth, the nature of the essence of the yantra of the destruction and protection of the fortress,🔽the nature of the essence of the wheel of the cakravartin in the twelve sectors, the nature of the essence of the destruction of the barbarian religion and the establishment of the Buddha’s religion, the nature of the essence of the path of the mundane and supramundane siddhis given to all sentient beings,

original: 'khor los sgyur bas dum bu bcu gnyis su 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / kla klo'i chos bcom nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu 'jog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sems can mtha' dag la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi lam sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur bas dum bu bcu gnyis su 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / kla klo'i chos bcom nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu 'jog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sems can mtha' dag la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi lam sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: and the nature of the essence of the path of the siddhis of the three kāyas.

original: 'jam dpal dang 'jig rten dbang phyug sngon dang phyi mar ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba chen po la sogs pa rigs ldan gyi mthar thug pa mi rnams mchog gi tshe'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u la'o /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dang 'jig rten dbang phyug sngon dang phyi mar ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba chen po la sogs pa rigs ldan gyi mthar thug pa mi rnams mchog gi tshe'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u la'o /
translated: The essence of the teacher as Manjushri and Lokeshvara in the past and future, and the essence of the supreme life of humans as the great chakravartin and so forth, up to the lineage holder, is the chapter on the world systems.

original: // / de nas nang gi le'u la dang por mngal 'dzin pa dang sdud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdul dang  khu ba dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: // / de nas nang gi le'u la dang por mngal 'dzin pa dang sdud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rdul dang  khu ba dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, in the inner chapter, first is the essence of abiding as the womb holder and the womb gatherer, the essence of abiding as the correct union of the bindu, the bodhicitta, and the alaya consciousness,

original: zla ba so so re re zhing mngal 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nya la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: zla ba so so re re zhing mngal 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nya la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the essence of abiding as the monthly development of the womb, the essence of abiding as the ten states of the fish and so on, the essence of abiding as the four kayas and the four vajras,🔽and the essence of abiding as the four wisdoms and the four bindus.

original: @115b rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa bzhis mngal 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang tshigs kyi gnas sum brgya drug cu dang khams drug dang ro drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug dang 'du byed drug
analyzed: @115b rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa bzhis mngal 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang tshigs kyi gnas sum brgya drug cu dang khams drug dang ro drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug dang 'du byed drug
translated: rasas, the six indriyas, the six visayas, the six karmendriyas, the six karmendriya visayas, the six consciousnesses, and the six formations.

original: dang tshor ba drug dang 'du shes drug dang gzugs drug dang ye shes drug dang 'khor lo drug dang dkyil 'khor drug steng dang 'og gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / lte ba'i chu skyes la sogs pa'i 'dab ma dang sna bug dag la g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor phung po lnga dang khams lnga 'bab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dang tshor ba drug dang 'du shes drug dang gzugs drug dang ye shes drug dang 'khor lo drug dang dkyil 'khor drug steng dang 'og gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / lte ba'i chu skyes la sogs pa'i 'dab ma dang sna bug dag la g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor phung po lnga dang khams lnga 'bab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The petals of the navel lotus, and so on, and the nostrils exist as the nature of the left and right maṇḍalas, the five aggregates, and the five elements.🔽The central nāḍī exists as the nature of the arising of the entire tantra.🔽The function of the prāṇa and so on exists as the nature of the vāyu.

original: dbu ma las rgyud mtha' dag 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / srog la sogs pa rlung gi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / khams rnams las lha'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i 'chi ltas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dbu ma las rgyud mtha' dag 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / srog la sogs pa rlung gi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / khams rnams las lha'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i 'chi ltas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The signs of the deities arising from the elements exist as the nature of the signs of death of the sun, moon, and fire.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pas 'gro ba drug tu skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rtsa la sogs pa gza'i rkang pa 'chad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbu mar zhugs pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba bslu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pas 'gro ba drug tu skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rtsa la sogs pa gza'i rkang pa 'chad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dbu mar zhugs pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba bslu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The inner chapter is the nature of abiding as the six migrations due to the ripening of karma, the nature of abiding as the feet of the gods, such as the nāḍīs, and so on, the nature of abiding as the deception of death through the signs of death by the joy of entering the central nāḍī, and so on.

original: phyi rol 'jig rten pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / lta ba thams cad rjes su dpag pas yongs su brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sems can sna tshogs kyi 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par chos rab tu gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi le'u la'o /
analyzed: phyi rol 'jig rten pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / lta ba thams cad rjes su dpag pas yongs su brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sems can sna tshogs kyi 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par chos rab tu gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi le'u la'o /
translated: The nature of abiding as the accomplishment of external worldly activities, the nature of abiding as the examination of all views through inference, and the nature of abiding as the presentation of the Dharma in accordance with the desires of various sentient beings.

original: // / de nas dbang gi le'u la dang por bla ma yongs su brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i slob ma yongs su brtags te bsdu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / las rab 'byam bsgrub pa la grong la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi cha dang sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
