translated: The chapter on the glorious guru is called “The Nature of the Satisfaction of All Poverty.”

original: // / de nas sgrub thabs kyi le'u la dang por bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa dang gdong dag pa dang rang gi snying kha'i zla ba'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: // / de nas sgrub thabs kyi le'u la dang por bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa dang gdong dag pa dang rang gi snying kha'i zla ba'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, in the chapter on the means of achievement, first there is the nature of the mandala of protection and so forth, the purification of the face, and the emanation of tathagatas from the seed syllables on the moon in one’s heart center.

original: bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba gsum dang bdag nyid dbul ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang lam brten pa dang stong pa nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba gsum dang bdag nyid dbul ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang lam brten pa dang stong pa nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then there is the nature of the unsurpassable offerings, the confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, going for refuge three times, offering oneself, generating the mind of enlightenment, relying on the path, and focusing on emptiness and so forth.

original: skyed pa'i rim pa la dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / phyi rol 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: skyed pa'i rim pa la dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / phyi rol 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The chapter on the means of achievement is the nature of the means of achievement of the supreme royal mandala, the supreme royal activity, the yoga of the bindu, the yoga of the subtle, and so on, the nature of the means of achieving external mundane powers,

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa dang rig byed kyi mtha' gsang ba'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes dang yan lag drug gi sbyor ba la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa dang rig byed kyi mtha' gsang ba'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes dang yan lag drug gi sbyor ba la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the nature of the means of achieving secret reality, the knowledge of the end of the Vedas, such as the sacrifice, and the practice of the six limbs, and so on, and the nature of the accumulation of merit, such as generosity.

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i sems @116b bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub thabs kyi le'u la'o /
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i sems @116b bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub thabs kyi le'u la'o /
translated: The nature of the meditation of the mind that is directly perceived and hidden is called the chapter on the means of achievement.

original: // / de nas ye shes kyi le'u la dang por lus kyi rus pa la sogs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs dang rigs drug gi lha'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: // / de nas ye shes kyi le'u la dang por lus kyi rus pa la sogs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs dang rigs drug gi lha'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The body, speech, mind, and the six families of deities are present as the essence.🔽The six families of mantras, such as a and so on, and ka and so on, are present as the essence.🔽The thirty-six tantras of method and wisdom are present as the essence.

original: aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa sngags kyi rigs drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / thabs dang shes rab dang bya ba dang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang sdom pa chen po dang 'khor los sgyur ba drug spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa sngags kyi rigs drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / thabs dang shes rab dang bya ba dang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang sdom pa chen po dang 'khor los sgyur ba drug spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The six emanations of method and wisdom, action, yoga, anuyoga, mahāyoga, and cakrasaṃvara, are present as the essence.

original: dbang bzhi pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos grub kyi sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsten pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dbang bzhi pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes kyi dngos grub kyi sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsten pa'i sgrub thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the essence of the method of relying on bodhicitta,🔽the essence of the method of accomplishing the great seal wisdom that is the nature of all objects of knowledge and consciousness,🔽the essence of the method of always performing all actions of body, speech, and mind,

original: shes pa dang shes bya rnam pa kun gyi bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bya ba thams cad rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /

translated: and the essence of the method of teaching the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsdu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams la ri rab kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsdu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams la ri rab kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the essence of dwelling together with the bodhisattva mahāsattvas equal to the atoms of Sumeru in the element of space,🔽the essence of the arising of the buddhafields,🔽the essence of the blessing of the buddhafields as vajra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdo rjer byin gyis brlab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis chos bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /

original: brjod bya rjod byed 'di dag phan tshun brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: brjod bya rjod byed 'di dag phan tshun brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: The mutual definition of the expressed and the expresser is the relation.

original: brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo le'u lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pa yin la rjod par byed pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo rjod par byed pa le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo le'u lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pa yin la rjod par byed pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo rjod par byed pa le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The expressed is the Bhagavat, the Wheel of Time, who abides in the nature of five chapters. The expresser is the five-chapter Wheel of Time, which expresses the Wheel of Time.

original: yang dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba yin la rjod par byed pa ni dang po'i sangs rgyas rjod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba yin la rjod par byed pa ni dang po'i sangs rgyas rjod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: Again, the first Buddha, the Bhagavat, is the expressed, and the expresser of the first Buddha is the expresser. The definition of the expressed and the expresser is the relation of the expressed and the expresser.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa las 'jig rten pa'i dbang sbyin pas bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa las 'jig rten pa'i dbang sbyin pas bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Then, the purpose of the rite of initiation into the mandala, which serves the purpose of the accumulation of merit through the bestowal of the worldly initiations, is the purpose.

original: shes rab chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bzhi pa sbyin pas rigs med pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste //
analyzed: shes rab chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bzhi pa sbyin pas rigs med pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the purpose of the purpose, which is to perform the purpose of the accumulations of merit and knowledge for the attainment of the mahamudra, the spiritual power of the transcendent perfection of wisdom, by means of the bestowal of the fourth initiation, the great wisdom that transcends the mundane.

original: brjod bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di dag nyid mngon par gzigs nas /
analyzed: brjod bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di dag nyid mngon par gzigs nas /
translated: Having perceived these characteristics of the subject matter and so forth,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams la rang gi sems kyi bsam pas zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams la rang gi sems kyi bsam pas zhes bya ba la //
translated: for the sake of those disciples who are free from certainty, by one's own mental intention.

original: nges pa ni nyan thos pa'i mchog gi sdom pa 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ste de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni nyan thos pa'i mchog gi sdom pa 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ste de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Certainty refers to the discipline of the supreme listener, the discipline of abstaining from the enjoyment of the five sense objects. Being free from that is being free from certainty.

original: de dag gi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Their own mental intention is the desire to enjoy the five sense objects.

original: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba chen po 'dod pa ni nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba chen po 'dod pa ni nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the desire for the great bliss of the two organs is the intention of one's own mind of those who are free from certainty.

original: rang gi sems kyi bsam pa 'dis skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di mi'i skye ba la sangs rgyas nyid kyi @117b 'bras bu rab tu ster ba rgyud kyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi bsam pa 'dis skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di mi'i skye ba la sangs rgyas nyid kyi @117b 'bras bu rab tu ster ba rgyud kyi rgyal po'o //
translated: This intention of one's own mind bestows the fruit of Buddhahood in this very life - the King of Tantras bestows the fruit of Buddhahood in this very human life.

original: lha la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga'i skye ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga'i skye ba la ni ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: las kyis ma yin par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyis ma yin par skyes pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dir lha la sogs pa rnams la yang mi'i skye ba thob nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lha la sogs pa rnams la yang mi'i skye ba thob nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, even for gods, etc., having obtained a human life, the fruit of Buddhahood will be bestowed.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //

original: rnam pa gzhan du las ngan pa dang ldan pa'i mi'i skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i des pa'o //

translated: Otherwise, in this human birth that is endowed with bad karma, the result of buddhahood is not given.

analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa rjes spyad na //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di ni bden te /

original: mi dge ba glo bur pa gzhan mi 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje chos 'byung gi khang par bdud bzhi dang bgegs kyi dgra 'jug pa'i sgo rnams la byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi sgo glegs bcug nas /

translated: In order to prevent the entry of other adventitious nonvirtues, the doors of entry of the four maras and the enemies of obstacles are blocked with the doors of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity and the doors of the factors of enlightenment in the house of the vajra dharmodaya.

original: de nyid du rdo rje sems dpa' phyag rgya chen po dang lhan cig tu bsgrubs te mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po rnams kyang skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes byas ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed kyi /

translated: Having accomplished Vajrasattva together with the great seal in that very place, even those who have committed the five acts with immediate retribution will obtain the result of buddhahood in this life.

translated: result of buddhahood in this life.

translated: commit sins would attain the result of buddhahood.

original: 'o na sngags kyi theg pa 'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sha bza' bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la de nyid kyang rtag tu srog bcad pa las 'byung ste srog bcad pa med par ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe sring ngo //
analyzed: 'o na sngags kyi theg pa 'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sha bza' bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la de nyid kyang rtag tu srog bcad pa las 'byung ste srog bcad pa med par ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe sring ngo //
translated: Well then, in this Mantra Vehicle the Blessed One taught that yogis should eat meat, and that comes from always killing living beings, and without killing living beings it is impossible to obtain meat at any time.

original: gal te za ba po med na gsod pa po yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te za ba po med na gsod pa po yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is no eater, there is no killer.

original: de'i phyir zab po dang gsod pa po dag srog gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab po dang gsod pa po dag srog gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the eater and the killer are the ones who kill living beings.

original: 'dir yang nyi ma so sor sngags pas dam tshig bzhi bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o zhe na /🔽de ni bden te rgyu gang gi phyir mtshan ma dang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba rgyu de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mtshan ma med pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa go ku la sogs pa bza' bar

translated: Here, the mantra practitioner should perform the four pledges every day, and that is the rule of the Tathāgata.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: That is true, but because of the reason that there is killing with signs and with blame, for that reason the Blessed One taught that yogis should eat meat without signs and without blame, such as beef.

original: 'dir yul gang na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis gang bza' ba ma yin pa dang gang btsong pa ma yin pa go ku la sogs pa rang gi las kyis shi ba dang g-yul du las ngan pa'am rang gi skyon gyis chom rkun la sogs pa bsad pa de
analyzed: 'dir yul gang na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis gang bza' ba ma yin pa dang gang btsong pa ma yin pa go ku la sogs pa rang gi las kyis shi ba dang g-yul du las ngan pa'am rang gi skyon gyis chom rkun la sogs pa bsad pa de
translated: Here, in any place, whatever is not eaten by worldly people, whatever is not sold, such as cow meat and so on, that which dies by its own action, and that which is killed by thieves and so on through bad action or its own fault in battle,🔽

original: dag thams cad rnal 'byor pas bza' bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: dag thams cad rnal 'byor pas bza' bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: Here, the Tathāgata taught that the yogī should eat all those who die by their own hand, such as cows, oxen, and so on, who are not eaten or sold by the world, and those killed by others, such as thieves and so on, who are killed by bad karma or their own faults in battle.

original: rdzas kyis nyos pa ni ma yin zhing pha mes la sogs pa dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba las bsad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyis nyos pa ni ma yin zhing pha mes la sogs pa dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba las bsad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: He should not buy meat with money, nor should he eat meat that is killed for the sake of ancestors and so on, or for the sake of sacrifices and so on.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sha bza'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sha bza'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas ma gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata did not teach, “Eat meat that has the three purities.”

original: yang gang zhig nyi ma so sor dam tshig bya ba de ni kha na ma thob med pa'i go ku la sogs pa lnga dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga'i ril bu nyungs kar gyi tshad tsam nyi ma so sor dam tshig bsten pa'i don du

translated: Also, one who has a daily commitment should, for the sake of observing the commitment daily, take the five without transgression, such as beef, and the pills of the five, Vairochana, etc., the size of a mustard seed.

original: bya'o // rtag par kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chang dang bud med ni bsgom pa'i slad du rmongs pa med pa'i chos kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bya'o // rtag par kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chang dang bud med ni bsgom pa'i slad du rmongs pa med pa'i chos kyis gsungs so //
translated: Always, without transgression, one should drink alcohol and have sex, in order to meditate, as taught by the Buddha without confusion.

analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste //

analyzed: lha dang rang 'jigs pha mes dang // 'dod grub don dang btsong phyir yang //

analyzed: gdul dka' sdig pa byed rnams kyis //
translated: the difficult to tame, the sinful,

analyzed: @118b gnod byed min pa'i sems can bsad //

analyzed: de yi sha de nyo ba dang // za 'dod kha na ma tho bcas //

analyzed: ma blangs snod du lhung gyur pa //

analyzed: de nyid kha na ma tho med //

analyzed: srog chags gcig gi sha dag ni //

analyzed: mang po rnams kyis zos pa mchog / srog chags du ma'i sha dag ni //

original: lha ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //

original: klu ni mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //

translated: The female deities are Vajradhatvi-shavari and so forth, Dharmadhatvi-shavari and so forth, Supratichara and so forth, Charachari and so forth, Gaurvi and so forth, and Shivakarna and so forth. Their assembly is their gathering.

translated: Surrounded by the hosts of gods and goddesses means surrounded by the hosts of gods and goddesses.

analyzed: khams gsum pas zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa de yis so //

original: khams gsum gyi 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa ni gang gi chos kyi 'khor lo khams gsum du cig ca  ra rab tu 'khor ba de ni khams gsum pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba ste khams gsum pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba de yis so //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa ni gang gi chos kyi 'khor lo khams gsum du cig ca  ra rab tu 'khor ba de ni khams gsum pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba ste khams gsum pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba de yis so //
translated: By the one who is the emperor of the three realms means by the one who is the emperor of the three realms, whose wheel of Dharma turns in the three realms.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes pa la mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas ni skad cig gcig dang rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba ni mchog yin
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes pa la mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas ni skad cig gcig dang rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba ni mchog yin
translated: The devoid of lineage is the one who is devoid of the lineage, which is the wisdom and method nature of the phenomena characterized by the apprehended and apprehender.🔽 The devoid of lineage is the one who is devoid of that lineage.

original: la / des dang por sangs rgyas pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas de yis so //
analyzed: la / des dang por sangs rgyas pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas de yis so //
translated: The supreme primordial buddha is the supreme one who first became a buddha.🔽 The devoid of lineage is the one who is devoid of the lineage, which is the wisdom and method nature of the phenomena characterized by the apprehended and apprehender.

original: rigs med pa zhes pa la rigs ni shes rab dang / thabs kyi bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos te rigs de gang gis spangs pa de ni rigs med pa ste rigs med pa de yis so //
analyzed: rigs med pa zhes pa la rigs ni shes rab dang / thabs kyi bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos te rigs de gang gis spangs pa de ni rigs med pa ste rigs med pa de yis so //
translated: The devoid of lineage is the one who is devoid of that lineage.

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo shes pa la bcom ldan ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa bcom @119b pa'i phyir bcom pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs te bcom pa de 'di la ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo shes pa la bcom ldan ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa bcom @119b pa'i phyir bcom pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs te bcom pa de 'di la ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan no //
translated: The Blessed One is called the destroyer because he has destroyed the demons and the afflictions, and because he is endowed with the aggregate of omniscient qualities such as lordship, etc.

original: dus ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid de des gang gi lus phung po dang khams la sogs pa sgrib pa med pa'i 'khor lor bskyed pa de ni dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dus ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid de des gang gi lus phung po dang khams la sogs pa sgrib pa med pa'i 'khor lor bskyed pa de ni dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Time is characterized by supreme unchanging great bliss. He who generates the body, aggregates, elements, etc. by that into the unobstructed wheel is the wheel of time.

original: gzhan yang yi ge so so re res te //
analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge so so re res te //
translated: Moreover, each individual syllable:

original: k'a yig gis ni rgyu zhi ba //
analyzed: k'a yig gis ni rgyu zhi ba //
translated: By the syllable ka, the cause is pacified.

original: la yig 'di la thim pa nyid //
analyzed: la yig 'di la thim pa nyid //
translated: By the syllable la, it dissolves into this.

original: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
analyzed: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
translated: By the syllable ca, the moving mind.

original: kra yig rim pa bcings las so //
analyzed: kra yig rim pa bcings las so //
translated: By the syllable kra, from the bound stages.

original: rim pa ni lus la sogs pa'i thig le rnams 'pho ba yin la de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bas bcings pa ni k'a la tsa kra ste bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de yis so //
analyzed: rim pa ni lus la sogs pa'i thig le rnams 'pho ba yin la de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bas bcings pa ni k'a la tsa kra ste bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de yis so //
translated: The one who binds those with connate bliss is the Bhagavān Kālacakra, the Wheel of Time.🔽Since he was requested by Sucandra,

original: zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pas zhes pa ni 'di ni zla ba yang yin la bzang po yang yin pa'i phyir zla ba bzang po ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyan pa por gyur pa rdo rje zla ba dri ma med pa'i
analyzed: zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pas zhes pa ni 'di ni zla ba yang yin la bzang po yang yin pa'i phyir zla ba bzang po ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyan pa por gyur pa rdo rje zla ba dri ma med pa'i
translated: he is Sucandra because he is both the moon and good. He is the stainless vajra moon, the listener of all tathāgatas.

original: 'od do // sems can thams cad kyi skad tha dad pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas chos gsungs pa rnams yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyan pa por gyur pa'i gsang ba'i bdag po ste gsang ba ni nyan thos dang rang
analyzed: 'od do // sems can thams cad kyi skad tha dad pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas chos gsungs pa rnams yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyan pa por gyur pa'i gsang ba'i bdag po ste gsang ba ni nyan thos dang rang
translated: Since he is the one who compiles the Dharmas taught by the tathāgatas with the different languages of all sentient beings, he is the secret lord, the listener of all tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag las mchog tu gyur pa rdo rje'i theg pa'o de'i yang dag par sdud par sdud pa po yin pas na bdag po ste gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag las mchog tu gyur pa rdo rje'i theg pa'o de'i yang dag par sdud par sdud pa po yin pas na bdag po ste gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: The Vajra Vehicle is the most excellent of all the vehicles of the Buddha. Since he is the compiler of that, he is the lord, the Lord of Secrets.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol du ni 'jig rten gyi bden pas gsang ba'i sgras gnod sbyin rnams te de dag gi bdag po ni gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol du ni 'jig rten gyi bden pas gsang ba'i sgras gnod sbyin rnams te de dag gi bdag po ni gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: In the same way, externally, the word secret refers to the yakshas, who are the lords of the world.

original: ro ldan na gnas pa ni phyi rol du ro'i sgras srog nyams pa shi ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: ro ldan na gnas pa ni phyi rol du ro'i sgras srog nyams pa shi ba'i tshogs so //
translated: In the charnel ground, externally, the word charnel ground refers to a collection of the dead, those whose life force has been destroyed.

original: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro ldan te dur khrod kyi sa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro ldan te dur khrod kyi sa'o //
translated: Since he has that, he is the one who has a charnel ground, the land of the charnel ground.

original: de na gnod sbyin chen po sems can rnams la rnam par mtho 'tsham zhing bgegs du ma byed pa po dag yod la de dag gsod par byed pa po ni ro ldan na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de na gnod sbyin chen po sems can rnams la rnam par mtho 'tsham zhing bgegs du ma byed pa po dag yod la de dag gsod par byed pa po ni ro ldan na gnas pa ste /
translated: There are great yakshas who harm sentient beings and create many obstacles. The one who kills them is the one who has a charnel ground.

original: nags kyi ri dags kyi bdag po zhes pa bzhin du ro ldan na gnas pa gnod sbyin chen po rnams kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: nags kyi ri dags kyi bdag po zhes pa bzhin du ro ldan na gnas pa gnod sbyin chen po rnams kyi bdag po'o //
translated: Like the lord of the forest deer, the one who has a charnel ground is the lord of the great yakshas who have a charnel ground.

original: nang du ni ro zhes pa dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa sum stong drug brgyas dman pa'i nyi @120a * //
analyzed: nang du ni ro zhes pa dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa sum stong drug brgyas dman pa'i nyi @120a * //
translated: Internally, corpse refers to the thirty-six hundred movements of the breath.

original: khri gcig stong drug brgya rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: khri gcig stong drug brgya rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: Internally, the syllable “ro” is the cessation of the sixteen hundred and ninety-five breaths.

original: de 'di la yod pa ni chos kyi sprin gyis ste de la gnas pa ni ro ldan na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ni chos kyi sprin gyis ste de la gnas pa ni ro ldan na gnas pa'o //
translated: The one who has this is the Cloud of Dharma. The one who abides in this is the one who abides in the state of ro.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang snyoms 'jug gi sgrib pa'i gnod sbyin rnams gsod par byed pa ni gnod sbyin gyi bdag po ste ;
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang snyoms 'jug gi sgrib pa'i gnod sbyin rnams gsod par byed pa ni gnod sbyin gyi bdag po ste ;
translated: The one who slays the yakshas of the obstructions of Mara, afflictions, objects of knowledge, and meditative absorption is the lord of the yakshas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi seng ge'i sgra dang sems can so so'i sgra dag gis bstan pa'i chos rnams rab tu ston par byed pa po sprul pa'i sku phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pa de yis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi seng ge'i sgra dang sems can so so'i sgra dag gis bstan pa'i chos rnams rab tu ston par byed pa po sprul pa'i sku phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab par gyur pa de yis so //
translated: The one who teaches the Dharma of the scriptures with the lion’s roar of the Tathagata and the individual voices of sentient beings is the emanation body Vajrapani, who is requested by Sucandra.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni brjod bya mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rjod par byed pa'i phyir te brjod bya 'di rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni brjod bya mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas rjod par byed pa'i phyir te brjod bya 'di rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The expression “supreme original buddha” is used because it expresses the supreme original buddha, which is the subject matter. It is the supreme original buddha because it exists in the nature of the one who expresses this subject matter.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod bya dus kyi 'khor lo rjod par byed pa'i phyir dus kyi 'khor lo'i rjod byed do //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod bya dus kyi 'khor lo rjod par byed pa'i phyir dus kyi 'khor lo'i rjod byed do //
translated: The Wheel of Time is the expression of the Wheel of Time, which is the subject matter.

original: stong phrag bcu gnyis pa zhes pa ni stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gsum gyi yi ge'i tshogs te yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis pa rjes su bsngags pa stong phrag bcu gnyis yod pa ni stong phrag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu gnyis pa zhes pa ni stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gsum gyi yi ge'i tshogs te yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis pa rjes su bsngags pa stong phrag bcu gnyis yod pa ni stong phrag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The expression “twelve thousand” refers to the collection of thirty-two thousand syllables, which is made up of three hundred thousand syllables, with the exception of eighty-four thousand syllables, and twelve thousand praises of the thirty-two syllables.

original: rigs med pa zhes pa ni brjod bya rigs med pa rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs med pa zhes pa ni brjod bya rigs med pa rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “lacking a spiritual affinity” is used because it expresses the lack of a spiritual affinity, which is the subject matter.

original: 'dir rigs ni shes rab kyi phyogs dang thabs kyi phyogs te phyogs spangs pa gang gi phyir rigs de med pa'i rgyud de ni rigs med pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ces rgyal bas gnyis su med par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir rigs ni shes rab kyi phyogs dang thabs kyi phyogs te phyogs spangs pa gang gi phyir rigs de med pa'i rgyud de ni rigs med pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ces rgyal bas gnyis su med par gsungs so //
translated: Here, the family is the side of wisdom and the side of means. Since it is the abandonment of the side, that continuum which is without that family is the continuum of yoga, which has the nature of wisdom and means, and is called “without family.” The Victor has said that it is nondual.

original: brjod par bya ba thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la /🔽thabs dang shes rab kyi phyogs tha dang  na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la / thabs dang shes rab kyi phyogs tha dang  na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this king of tantras, which has the nature of means and wisdom as the subject matter,🔽if there is a division into the side of means and the side of wisdom, then the subject matter that has the nature of means and wisdom will not exist.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba med na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba med na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the subject matter that has the nature of means and wisdom does not exist, nondual wisdom will not exist.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med na sangs rgyas nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med na sangs rgyas nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If nondual wisdom does not exist, buddhahood will not exist.

original: sangs rgyas nyid med na 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid med na 'khor ba'o //
translated: If buddhahood does not exist, there is saṃsāra.

original: 'dir rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa med par thabs kyi ming can gyi rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la thabs dang shes rab @120b kyi bdag nyid gnyis su med pa dang rnal 'byor brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa med par thabs kyi ming can gyi rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la thabs dang shes rab @120b kyi bdag nyid gnyis su med pa dang rnal 'byor brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the yoga tantra, which is called the method, would not have the nature of method and wisdom as its subject matter, nor would it have the characteristic of expressing the expressed.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sgra ni thabs kyi don rjod par byed pa'am shes rab kyi don rjod par byed pa yang ma yin te rnal 'byor gyi sgra ni thabs dang shes rab kyi don rjod par byed pa'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sgra ni thabs kyi don rjod par byed pa'am shes rab kyi don rjod par byed pa yang ma yin te rnal 'byor gyi sgra ni thabs dang shes rab kyi don rjod par byed pa'i //
translated: The word yoga does not express the meaning of method or the meaning of wisdom, but the word yoga expresses the meaning of method and wisdom.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rnal 'byor thabs kyi lus dang ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thabs kyi lus dang ni //
translated: Yoga is not just the body of method

original: shes rab gcig pu dag gis min //
analyzed: shes rab gcig pu dag gis min //
translated: Or just wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The union of method and wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor gsungs zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor gsungs zhes so //
translated: Is taught by the Tathāgata as yoga.

original: de'i phyir rgyud gang la thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba yod pa'i rgyud de ni don dam par shes rab kyi rgyud kyang ma yin la thabs kyi rgyud kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud gang la thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba yod pa'i rgyud de ni don dam par shes rab kyi rgyud kyang ma yin la thabs kyi rgyud kyang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a tantra that has a subject matter with the nature of method and wisdom is not a wisdom tantra or a method tantra ultimately.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas phung po dang khams rnam par dag pa las thabs dang shes rab shes kyi phyogs su dbang po rtul po'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas phung po dang khams rnam par dag pa las thabs dang shes rab shes kyi phyogs su dbang po rtul po'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so
translated: In the conventional reality of the world, the Tathāgata taught the method and wisdom aspects from the perspective of the faculties of duller trainees, classifying them as method and wisdom tantras, respectively, based on the purification of the aggregates and constituents through the mirror-like primordial wisdom and so forth.

original: // de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i ming can la yang ngo //
analyzed: // de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i ming can la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to the tantras called yoginī tantras.

original: 'dir 'di la rnal 'byor gyi ngang tshul yod pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di la rnal 'byor gyi ngang tshul yod pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: Here, a yogin is one who has the nature of yoga.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, a yoginī is a female yogin.

original: de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa nyid las rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa nyid las rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are also called yoginī tantras and yogin tantras, respectively, because they depend on the other.

original: des na don dam pa'i bden pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rigs med pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i bden pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rigs med pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate truth is the tantra of yoga, which has the nature of method and wisdom, and is the Wheel of Time, which is not a family.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa zhes pa ni dang po'i sangs rgyas mngon par brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa zhes pa ni dang po'i sangs rgyas mngon par brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of the wisdom body of the vajra holder is the recitation of the name of the manifest, which is the first buddha, because it is the recitation of the name itself.

original: 'dir ji ltar mtshan yang dag par brjod pa  'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa dang gsung bar 'gyur ba dang gsung ba de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar mtshan yang dag par brjod pa  'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa dang gsung bar 'gyur ba dang gsung ba de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas kyang ngo //
translated: Here, just as the recitation of the name is taught by the tathagatas of the past, future, and present, and will be taught and is being taught, in the same way, it is the first buddha.

original: dang po'i sgras ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang po'i sgras ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don to //
translated: The word first means without beginning or end.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus su thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa dang ston par 'gyur ba dang ston pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad dang sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig gis @121a * //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus su thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa dang ston par 'gyur ba dang ston pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad dang sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig gis @121a * //
translated: It was taught by the buddhas of the past, will be taught by the buddhas of the future, and is being taught by the buddhas of the present.

original: gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It was not taught by the single tathāgatas Dīpaṃkara and Śākyamuni.

original: 'dir phyag na rdo rjes /
analyzed: 'dir phyag na rdo rjes /
translated: Here Vajrapāṇi says:

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: It was taught by the buddhas of the past,

original: ma 'ongs rnams kyang gsung 'gyur la //
analyzed: ma 'ongs rnams kyang gsung 'gyur la //
translated: will be taught by the buddhas of the future,

original: da ltar byung ba rdzogs sangs rgyas //🔽yang yang gsung ba gang yin dang // rgyud chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'dir ;
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rdzogs sangs rgyas // yang yang gsung ba gang yin dang // rgyud chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'dir ;
translated: and is being taught by the perfect buddhas of the present.🔽It is the great tantra of the net of illusion,🔽which is the mantra vehicle taught

original: / rdo rje 'chang chen gsang sngags 'chang //
analyzed: / rdo rje 'chang chen gsang sngags 'chang //
translated: by the great Vajradhara,

original: dpag med dgyes pa rnam dag gis //
analyzed: dpag med dgyes pa rnam dag gis //
translated: the pure one who is beyond measure and is delighted.

original: gang yang yang dag glur blangs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang yang dag glur blangs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is also what is sung again and again.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig 'di'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sngags kyi theg pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig 'di'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sngags kyi theg pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is for the sake of these words of supplication in the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī that all the tathāgatas taught the mantra vehicle.

original: 'dir 'dus pa las de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad nas sh'akya thub pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis kyang sngags kyi theg pa ma gsungs so zhes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshe de'i dus na zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa las de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad nas sh'akya thub pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis kyang sngags kyi theg pa ma gsungs so zhes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshe de'i dus na zhes pa ste /
translated: Here, in the Guhyasamaja, it is said that from Dipankara up to Shakyamuni, no Tathagata taught the Mantra Vehicle.

original: 'phags pa'i yul du chos ston pa'i dus na rigs bzhi'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan zhing skal pa med pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i yul du 'khor rnams la ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul du chos ston pa'i dus na rigs bzhi'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan zhing skal pa med pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i yul du 'khor rnams la ma bstan te /
translated: At that time, when the Dharma was being taught in the Noble Land, due to the minds of beings with the pride of the four castes and lacking good fortune, it was not taught to the assembly in the Noble Land.

original: dus gzhan du yul gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor la yang ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du yul gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor la yang ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it was not taught at another time to the assembly in other worldly realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad theg pa gsum ston par byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad theg pa gsum ston par byed pa po yin no //
translated: For this reason, the Tathagata is the teacher of the three vehicles.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, he would not be omniscient.

original: rdo rje'i theg pa ston par byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i theg pa ston par byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not the one who teaches the Vajra Vehicle.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad theg pa gsum ston par byed pa po dang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad theg pa gsum ston par byed pa po dang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par byed pa po yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, all the Tathagatas are the teachers of the three vehicles and the teachers of the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pas 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who has actualized the wisdom body of the Vajra Holder is embraced by the recitation of the true names.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa zhes pa ni rdo rje theg pa 'dir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas te bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes de
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa zhes pa ni rdo rje theg pa 'dir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas te bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes de
translated: The actualized vajra words of all the kings of tantras is that in this Vajra Vehicle, by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, all the kings of tantras are hidden in vajra words, and that fourth one is also like that,

original: bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was spoken by the Tathagata.

original: bzhi pa ni gsum pa ma yin te bzhi pa @121b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gsum pa ma yin te bzhi pa @121b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth is not the third, because it is said to be the fourth.

original: de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is just so.

original: shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the wisdom-knowledge initiation is the fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas pa yin no //
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavat, it is hidden in vajra words.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la rdo rje'i tshig rab tu gsal ba ma yin zhing bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rtogs par bya ba yin te rgyud ni rgyud gzhan dag gis rtogs par bya zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la rdo rje'i tshig rab tu gsal ba ma yin zhing bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rtogs par bya ba yin te rgyud ni rgyud gzhan dag gis rtogs par bya zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not clearly stated in all the kings of tantras as vajra words, but is to be understood by the stages of the lineage of gurus, because the Tathagata said, The tantra is to be understood by other tantras.

original: sngags kyi tshul 'di la rdo rje'i tshig rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul 'di la rdo rje'i tshig rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: In this way of mantra, there are two kinds of vajra words: one is the conventional of the world, and the second is the ultimate.

original: de dag las 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi rdo rje'i tshig ni gsod pa la sogs pa'i las la dam tshig grub pa ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi rdo rje'i tshig ni gsod pa la sogs pa'i las la dam tshig grub pa ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: Of those, the vajra words of the conventional of the world are the bestowal of the commitments of the actions of killing and so forth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i rdo rje'i tshig ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i rdo rje'i tshig ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin te /
translated: The vajra words of the ultimate truth are that the fourth is just so.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: It bestows the fruit of the spiritual power of the Great Seal.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di la rdo rje'i tshig de dag nyid rab tu gsal bar bstan pa dang bshad pa dang rab tu bshad pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di la rdo rje'i tshig de dag nyid rab tu gsal bar bstan pa dang bshad pa dang rab tu bshad pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: In this first Buddha, the Blessed One has clarified those very vajra statements by means of teaching, explaining, and fully explaining.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa la phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa mtshan ma'i lam rab tu gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa la phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa mtshan ma'i lam rab tu gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: In order to accomplish that very [Great Seal], he has clarified the path of the signs such as smoke, the meditation on the Great Seal.

original: stong par rtse gcig yid byas te //
analyzed: stong par rtse gcig yid byas te //
translated: With a one-pointed mind on emptiness,

original: nyi ma gcig ni yongs su brtag ces pas so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rdo rje'i tshig phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa'i lam du ba la sogs pa rab tu gsal ba yin gyi bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin la bla ma'i bkas byin gyis
analyzed: nyi ma gcig ni yongs su brtag ces pas so // bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rdo rje'i tshig phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa'i lam du ba la sogs pa rab tu gsal ba yin gyi bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin la bla ma'i bkas byin gyis
translated: one should investigate a single day.

original: brlabs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brlabs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, in the Supreme First Buddha, the vajra statements of the path of the meditation on the Great Seal such as smoke are clarified, not coming through a lineage of gurus, and not blessed by the words of the guru.

original: lam 'di la yang nyin dang mtshan mor yid ches pa yod de nyi ma gcig ni yongs su brtag ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam 'di la yang nyin dang mtshan mor yid ches pa yod de nyi ma gcig ni yongs su brtag ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this path, there is confidence in day and night, because the Bhagavān has said, “One day is to be thoroughly investigated.”

original: 'dir du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma  phor nas gzhan sngags la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs nyi ma gcig gis rnal 'byor pas yongs su brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma  phor nas gzhan sngags la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs nyi ma gcig gis rnal 'byor pas yongs su brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, the yogī should not thoroughly investigate with one day the means of accomplishing other things, such as mantras, that are based on the signs of smoke, and so on.

original: mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum ste dang po'i mtshan ma dang / bar ma'i mtshan ma dang / tha ma'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum ste dang po'i mtshan ma dang / bar ma'i mtshan ma dang / tha ma'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The signs are also of three kinds: the sign of the beginning, the sign of the middle, and the sign of the end.

original: dang po'i mtshan ma ni du ba la sogs pa'i lam dang @122a * //
analyzed: dang po'i mtshan ma ni du ba la sogs pa'i lam dang @122a * //
translated: The sign of the beginning is the path of smoke, and so on.🔽The sign of the middle is the sign of the arising of the form of the deity.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug gis sku rdzogs pa'i 'gyur ba med pa'i skad cig thob pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug gis sku rdzogs pa'i 'gyur ba med pa'i skad cig thob pa'o //
translated: The sign of the end is the attainment of the unchanging instant of the complete body by means of the six-branched yoga.

original: bar ma'i mtshan ma ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis sa dang po thob pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma'i mtshan ma ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis sa dang po thob pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
translated: The signs of the middling are the attainment of the first stage by one hundred and eighty moments of supreme unchanging bliss, the five superknowledges, the correct seeing of things not seen, and the attainment of mundane powers.

original: tha ma'i mtshan ma ni sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'chang nyid de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis sa bcu gnyis pa thob nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i mtshan ma ni sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'chang nyid de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis sa bcu gnyis pa thob nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
translated: The signs of the least are buddhahood and Vajradharahood, the attainment of the twelfth stage by twenty-one thousand moments of supreme unchanging bliss, and the attainment of the power of the great seal.

original: rdo rje'i tshig la sogs pa mtshan ma sngon du 'gro ba can 'di dag rab tu gsal bar rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig la sogs pa mtshan ma sngon du 'gro ba can 'di dag rab tu gsal bar rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: These signs, beginning with the vajra words, are clearly taught in the Supreme King of Tantras, the Original Buddha, by the Blessed One.

original: de'i phyir rgyud ni rgyud gzhan tshol ba rnams la rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud ni rgyud gzhan tshol ba rnams la rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the tantra is the actual vajra-word of all the kings of tantras for those who seek other tantras.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa zhes pa la sangs rgyas rin chen ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba yin la za ma tog ni rdo rje dang padma ste sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa zhes pa la sangs rgyas rin chen ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba yin la za ma tog ni rdo rje dang padma ste sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog go //
translated: The opening of the casket of the jewel of the Buddha means that the jewel of the Buddha is supreme unchanging bliss, and the casket is the vajra and lotus, which is the casket of the jewel of the Buddha.

original: de nyid rgyud kyi rgyal po gang gis kha 'byed pa de ni sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyud kyi rgyal po gang gis kha 'byed pa de ni sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog kha 'byed pa'o //
translated: That which opens it with the king of tantras is the opening of the casket of the jewel of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la rten pa zhes pa la 'jig rten pa'i bden pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa skyed pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la rten pa zhes pa la 'jig rten pa'i bden pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa skyed pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The basis of mundane and supramundane truth means that mundane truth is the accomplishment of mundane powers by the stage of generation, the conceptual meditation of the maṇḍala wheel.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rdzogs pa'i rim pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rdzogs pa'i rim pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The supramundane truth is the great seal, which is accomplished by the signless and nonconceptual mind through the stage of completion.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rnam par mi rtog pa ste rnam pa thams cad du zhal dang phyag dang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rnam par mi rtog pa ste rnam pa thams cad du zhal dang phyag dang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The stage of completion is the nonconceptual innate, which is free from all conceptualization of faces, arms, color, and shape.

original: bden pa 'di dag la rten pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa ste lam gnyis ka ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa 'di dag la rten pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa ste lam gnyis ka ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of these truths is the mundane and supramundane truth, because it teaches both paths.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhi dang rdo rje bzhis yongs su dag pa zhes pa ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / rnam pa lngas @122b mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhi dang rdo rje bzhis yongs su dag pa zhes pa ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / rnam pa lngas @122b mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang /
translated: The four complete and perfect enlightenments and the four vajras are the complete and perfect enlightenment in one instant, the complete and perfect enlightenment in five aspects, the complete and perfect enlightenment in twenty aspects, and the complete and perfect enlightenment in the net of illusions.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste 'di rnams kyis yongs su dag pa ni mngal skyes bskyed pa'i rim pa dang du ba la sogs pa sku rdzogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste 'di rnams kyis yongs su dag pa ni mngal skyes bskyed pa'i rim pa dang du ba la sogs pa sku rdzogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The complete and perfect enlightenment in one instant is the complete and perfect enlightenment in the womb-born generation stage and the complete and perfect enlightenment in the smoke and so forth, the completion stage of the perfected body.

original: de ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are four complete and perfect enlightenments.

original: sku bzhi dang rigs drug dang bden pa bcu gnyis dang de kho na nyid bcu drug dang stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang dang las dang ye shes dang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi
analyzed: sku bzhi dang rigs drug dang bden pa bcu gnyis dang de kho na nyid bcu drug dang stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang dang las dang ye shes dang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi
translated: The four bodies, the six families, the twelve truths, the sixteen realities, the sixteen emptinesses, the sixteen compassions, and the mundane and supramundane initiations, activities, wisdoms, and the spiritual powers of the great seal

original: lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa zhes pa la /
translated: are very clearly illuminated in the Illuminating Lamp.

original: sku bzhi ni dag pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa rnams mngal skyes rnams kyi bzhi pa dang / shin tu gnyid log pa dang / rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid can te de dag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sku bzhi ni dag pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa rnams mngal skyes rnams kyi bzhi pa dang / shin tu gnyid log pa dang / rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid can te de dag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The four bodies are the pure, the truth, the enjoyment, and the emanation bodies, the fourth of which is for those born from wombs, and which have the characteristics of the states of deep sleep, dreams, and waking, and which are free from the obscurations of the buddhas.

original: rigs drug ni mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ye shes kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa nam mkha'i khams dang / 'du byed rlung gi khams dang // tshor ba me'i khams dang / 'du shes chu'i khams dang ; gzugs sa'i khams te mngal skyes rnams kyi rigs drug sgrib pa dang bcas pa yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //🔽bden pa bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: rigs drug ni mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ye shes kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa nam mkha'i khams dang / 'du byed rlung gi khams dang // tshor ba me'i khams dang / 'du shes chu'i khams dang ; gzugs sa'i khams te mngal skyes rnams kyi rigs drug sgrib pa dang bcas pa yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o // bden pa bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: The six constituents are the constituent of gnosis, which is unchanging bliss; the constituent of space, which is consciousness; the constituent of wind, which is mental formations; the constituent of fire, which is feeling; the constituent of water, which is recognition; and the constituent of earth, which is form. The six constituents of those born from a womb are accompanied by obscurations, but those of buddhas are free from obscurations.

original: rga shi ste mngal skyes rnams kyi bden pa bcu gnyis ni sgrib pa ngang bcas pa yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rga shi ste mngal skyes rnams kyi bden pa bcu gnyis ni sgrib pa ngang bcas pa yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination are ignorance, formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death. The twelve links of dependent origination of those born from a womb are accompanied by obscurations, but those of buddhas are free from obscurations.

original: 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi srog gi dbye bas srog gi rlung rgyu ba'i phyir mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi srog gi dbye bas srog gi rlung rgyu ba'i phyir mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because the life-force wind moves through the divisions of the life-force of the twelve transits, those born from a womb have obscurations.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because the twelve branches are blocked, the buddhas are free from obscurations.

original: de kho na nyid bcu drug ni sprul pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i gsung dang / sprul pa'i thugs @123a * //🔽dang ; sprul pa'i ye shes dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi sku dang / chos kyi gsung dang / chos kyi thugs dang ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid bcu drug ni sprul pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i gsung dang / sprul pa'i thugs @123a * // dang ; sprul pa'i ye shes dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi sku dang / chos kyi gsung dang / chos kyi thugs dang ;
translated: The sixteen realities are the nirmāṇakāya, the nirmāṇakāya speech, the nirmāṇakāya mind,🔽the nirmāṇakāya gnosis, the saṃbhogakāya, the saṃbhogakāya speech, the saṃbhogakāya mind,🔽the saṃbhogakāya gnosis, the dharmakāya, the dharmakāya speech, the dharmakāya mind,

original: chos kyi ye shes dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i gsung dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thugs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: chos kyi ye shes dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i gsung dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thugs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: the dharmakāya gnosis, the innate body, the innate speech, the innate mind,🔽and the innate gnosis.

original: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas de kho na nyid bcu drug mngal skyes rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa yin te bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas de kho na nyid bcu drug mngal skyes rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa yin te bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of the sixteen joys is for those born from the womb, and is associated with obscuration, because of the loss of half-tithle of the sixteen joys.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bral ba yin te bcu drug phyed phyed theg le 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sgrib pa dang bral ba yin te bcu drug phyed phyed theg le 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The reality of the sixteen joys is for the Buddhas, and is free from obscuration, because of the retention of half-tithle of the sixteen joys.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces pa ni nag po'i phyogs /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces pa ni nag po'i phyogs /
translated: The sixteen emptinesses are the dark lunar fortnights,

original: dang nyi ma dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: dang nyi ma dang shes rab bo //
translated: the sun, and wisdom.

original: snying rje bcu drug ces pa ni dkar po'i phyogs dang zla ba dang thabs so //
analyzed: snying rje bcu drug ces pa ni dkar po'i phyogs dang zla ba dang thabs so //
translated: The sixteen compassions are the bright lunar fortnights, the moon, and method.

original: stong pa nyid la dbye ba gsum ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dbye ba gsum ste /
translated: There are three divisions of the emptinesses:

original: stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid de nag po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //🔽chen po stong pa nyid ni khams lnga stong pa nyid de drug pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid ni dbang po lnga stong pa nyid de bcu gcig pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid de nag po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga'o // chen po stong pa nyid ni khams lnga stong pa nyid de drug pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o // don dam pa stong pa nyid ni dbang po lnga stong pa nyid de bcu gcig pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //
translated: The emptiness of the five elements is the next five days.🔽The emptiness of the five sense faculties is the next five days.

original: de nas gnam stong gi mthar thug pa tshes bcva lnga ni stong pa nyid bcva lnga'o ;
analyzed: de nas gnam stong gi mthar thug pa tshes bcva lnga ni stong pa nyid bcva lnga'o ;
translated: Then, the fifteen days of the dark fortnight are the fifteen emptinesses.

original: / gnam stong gi mtha' dang dkar po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa'i dang po'i dbus su bcu drug pa rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: / gnam stong gi mtha' dang dkar po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa'i dang po'i dbus su bcu drug pa rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: The sixteenth emptiness, the emptiness of all aspects, is in the middle of the first day of the bright fortnight, which begins at the end of the dark fortnight.

original: de bzhin du snying rje rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Similarly, there are three kinds of compassion:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: that which has sentient beings as its object, that which has the teaching as its object, and that which has no object.

original: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni dkar po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa  chos lnga'o //
analyzed: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni dkar po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa  chos lnga'o //
translated: The first five days of the bright fortnight are the compassion that has sentient beings as its object.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni drug pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni drug pa la sogs pa tshes lnga'o //
translated: The focus on phenomena is the five days beginning with the sixth.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni bcu gcig pa la sogs pa  chos lnga ste nya'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni bcu gcig pa la sogs pa  chos lnga ste nya'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The focus on the absence of phenomena is the five days beginning with the eleventh, ending with the fifteenth.

original: nya'i mtha' dang nag po'i tshes gcig 'jug @123b pa dang po'i dbus su snying rje bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: nya'i mtha' dang nag po'i tshes gcig 'jug @123b pa dang po'i dbus su snying rje bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth day of compassion is in the middle of the first entry into the dark lunar fortnight.

original: 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste de'i rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste de'i rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: These are the same, the sixteen emptinesses and the sixteen compassions, which are the subject matter, and this is their expression.🔽The mundane and supramundane empowerments are as follows. The mundane ones are the water, crown, diadem,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa la re zhig 'jig rten pa ni chu dang ; cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dril bu dang / brtul zhugs chen po dang / ming dang / rjes su gnang ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa la re zhig 'jig rten pa ni chu dang ; cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dril bu dang / brtul zhugs chen po dang / ming dang / rjes su gnang ba dang /
translated: vajra and bell, great vow, name, permission,

original: bum pa dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes te mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi dbang bcu ni lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes dang khams dang phung po dang / skye mched dang las kyi dbang po la sogs pa yongs su dag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes te mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi dbang bcu ni lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes dang khams dang phung po dang / skye mched dang las kyi dbang po la sogs pa yongs su dag par bya ba'o //
translated: The ten mundane initiations are the vase, secret, and wisdom-knowledge initiations.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bcu gcig pa ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i nges pas phyag rgya chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid bla ma'i zhal las lus dang ngag la sogs pa sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis sbyong🔽bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bcu gcig pa ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i nges pas phyag rgya chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid bla ma'i zhal las lus dang ngag la sogs pa sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The eleven supramundane initiations are the same as the previous four, but with the certainty that “that is also like this,” and are purified by the guru’s instruction of the nature of the great seal of unchanging bliss, which is the nature of the pristine awareness of the fourth initiation, by means of the absence of obscurations in the body, speech, and so forth.

original: las dang ye shes dang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces pa la las kyi phyag rgya ni nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'o //
analyzed: las dang ye shes dang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces pa la las kyi phyag rgya ni nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'o //
translated: The “accomplishments of action, pristine awareness, and the great seal” are as follows: The action seal is one who has breasts and pubic hair.

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: The pristine-awareness seal is one imagined by one’s own mind.

original: phyag rgya chen mo ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The Great Seal is free from discursive thought, and is of the nature of a mirror-vision.

original: 'di rnams kyi dngos grub ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dngos grub ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Their powers are of three kinds:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The power of the Action Seal is in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The power of the Wisdom Seal is in the realm of form.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The power of the Great Seal is free from both existence and non-existence, and is endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: sku bzhi la sogs pa 'di dag gi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: sku bzhi la sogs pa 'di dag gi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Supreme Original Buddha is the illuminator of the mundane and supramundane paths of these four bodies and so forth.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang dbang dang sgrub thabs dang ye shes te le'u lnga'i bdag nyid dam brtag pa lnga'i bdag nyid mi la sogs pa'i sems can mtha' dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang dbang dang sgrub thabs dang ye shes te le'u lnga'i bdag nyid dam brtag pa lnga'i bdag nyid mi la sogs pa'i sems can mtha' dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir
translated: In this way, the five chapters of the world, the inner, the master, the means of achievement, and pristine consciousness, or the five investigations, are perfectly explained for the purpose of attaining the state of perfect, complete buddhahood by all sentient beings, such as humans, and so on.

original: yang dag par bstan to zhes pa ni @124a * //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan to zhes pa ni @124a * //
translated: This is said to be

original: yang dag pa'i rnam pas te rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam pas te rdo rje'i tshig tu sbas pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: the perfect aspect, not the hidden aspect of vajra words.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang / rgyud ston par byed pa la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang / rgyud ston par byed pa la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: In this supreme first buddha, the compiler of the tantra is Mañjuśrī, the commentator for the purpose of guiding the ṛṣis of Brahmā in the future is me, and the teacher of the tantra is Yamāntaka and so on.

original: shambha la'i yul la sogs pa grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad theg pa chen po'i lam thob pa la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to zhes pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa 'di
