analyzed: shambha la'i yul la sogs pa grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad theg pa chen po'i lam thob pa la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to zhes pa ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa 'di
translated: The Tathagata has prophesied that all sentient beings living in the ninety-six million towns of Shambhala and so forth will attain the Mahayana path.

original: las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to //
analyzed: las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan to //
translated: In this twelfth thousand of the Supreme Original Buddha, Manjushri was prophesied by the Tathagata to be the compiler of the Condensed Tantra.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su grong khyer ka l'a par gnas pa'i tshangs pa'i drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi 'grel bshad byed pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag kyang lung bstan la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su grong khyer ka l'a par gnas pa'i tshangs pa'i drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi 'grel bshad byed pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag kyang lung bstan la /
translated: In the future, for the sake of guiding the forty-five million Brahmic sages living in the city of Kalapa, the Lord of the World was prophesied to compose a commentary on the Condensed Tantra.

original: gzhan khro bo'i rgyal po dang byang chub sems dpa' nyi shu rtsa gsum po dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan khro bo'i rgyal po dang byang chub sems dpa' nyi shu rtsa gsum po dag kyang ngo //
translated: And the other twenty-three wrathful kings and bodhisattvas were also prophesied.

original: grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad sprul pa'i sku bsdus pa'i rgyud ston par byed pa pos theg pa chen po'i lam thob par byed pa la lung bstan to //
analyzed: grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad sprul pa'i sku bsdus pa'i rgyud ston par byed pa pos theg pa chen po'i lam thob par byed pa la lung bstan to //
translated: The one who teaches the Tantra of the Gathered Emanations to all the sentient beings living in the ninety-six million towns is the one who is prophesied to cause them to attain the Mahayana path.

original: theg pa chen po'i lam ni 'jam dpal gyis rdo rje'i rigs kyi bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba ste de 'thob par byed pa la ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam ni 'jam dpal gyis rdo rje'i rigs kyi bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba ste de 'thob par byed pa la ni /
translated: The Mahayana path is the empowerment of the Vajra family, the vase, secret, and wisdom-knowledge empowerments of Manjushri.

original: theg pa chen po'i lam thob par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam thob par byed pa la'o //
translated: It is for the purpose of attaining that.

original: bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba 'di las rigs thams cad rigs gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba 'di las rigs thams cad rigs gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From this empowerment of the vase, secret, and wisdom-knowledge, all the families become one family.

original: rigs de 'di la yod pa'i phyir rigs ldan no //
analyzed: rigs de 'di la yod pa'i phyir rigs ldan no //
translated: Because that family exists in him, he is a vajra holder.

original: de'i rigs ni rigs ldan gyi rigs te sngags pa mtha' dag rdo rje'i rigs kyi dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni rigs ldan gyi rigs te sngags pa mtha' dag rdo rje'i rigs kyi dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nges pa'i don to //
translated: His family is the family of the vajra holder, because all mantra practitioners are empowered into the Vajra family. This is the definitive meaning.

original: de ltar 'jam dpal grags pa ni rigs ldan du lung bstan cing /
analyzed: de ltar 'jam dpal grags pa ni rigs ldan du lung bstan cing /
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī Yaśas is prophesied as a kṣatriya.

original: grags pa 'di'i rigs la 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag rigs ldan gnyis par lung @124b bstan to //
analyzed: grags pa 'di'i rigs la 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag rigs ldan gnyis par lung @124b bstan to //
translated: The second kṣatriya prophesied is Lokeśvara.

original: de bzhin du rim pa ji lta bar gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pa ji lta bar gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the ten wrathful ones such as Yamāntaka and the thirteen bodhisattvas such as Kṣitigarbha are prophesied.

original: gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo'i rgyal po de dag gi bar bar du byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po rnams lung bstan pa //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo'i rgyal po de dag gi bar bar du byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po rnams lung bstan pa //
translated: The thirteen bodhisattvas are prophesied in between the wrathful kings such as Yamāntaka.

original: sprul pa'i skus grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pa /
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pa /
translated: They are kings in 9.6 million towns.

original: sems can mtha' dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rab tu ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: sems can mtha' dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rab tu ston par mdzad pa /
translated: They teach the Dharma of the tathāgatas to all sentient beings.

original: kla klo la sogs pa'i chos ngan pa 'joms par mdzad pa /
analyzed: kla klo la sogs pa'i chos ngan pa 'joms par mdzad pa /
translated: They destroy the evil Dharma of the barbarians and so on.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the thirty-two marks and eighty signs of a great being,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa dbang phyug gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa dbang phyug gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: and his qualities of lordship, such as the five superknowledges, are completely perfected.

original: de'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang chos ston pa la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams lung bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di las bsdus pa'i rgyud yang dag par sdud par byed pa la 'jam dpal dang 'grel bshad byed pa la bdag dang chos ston pa la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams lung bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in the prediction of the compilers of the Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha, Mañjuśrī, in the explanation of the commentary, the self, and in the teaching of the Dharma, Yamarī and so forth are predicted.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa mngon par gzigs nas
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las brjod bya dang rjod byed dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa mngon par gzigs nas
translated: Having seen the subject matter, the expression, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose in the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Kālacakra Tantra, the king of all tantras, which is a commentary on the root tantra in twelve thousand chapters,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa'i mdor bsdus te gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa'i mdor bsdus te gnyis pa'o /
translated: the Bhagavān taught the Tantra in brief in two parts.

original: // / da ni 'dir ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po'i 'brel pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni 'dir ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po'i 'brel pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, here the connection between the teacher and the supplicant should be stated.

original: gal te na snga ma dang phyi mar rgyud kyi 'grel bshad ma thos pa'i tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te na snga ma dang phyi mar rgyud kyi 'grel bshad ma thos pa'i tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If so, then earlier and later statements in the commentary on the tantra would be heard,

original: rdo rje'i theg pa 'di la ro ldan na gnas pa'i gnod sbyin gyi bdag po chen po byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / yang dag par sdud par byed pa po ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdo rje'i theg pa 'di la ro ldan na gnas pa'i gnod sbyin gyi bdag po chen po byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / yang dag par sdud par byed pa po ma yin nam /
translated: since the great lord of yakshas residing in the land of Lanka, the great bodhisattva Vajrapani, is not the supplicant and the compiler to the Tathagata in this Vajrayana?

original: ji ltar shambha la'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong gi bdag po nyid ma'i 'od kyi lha mo rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas byung ba rgyal po zla ba bzang po gsol ba 'debs pa por gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar shambha la'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong gi bdag po nyid ma'i 'od kyi lha mo rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas byung ba rgyal po zla ba bzang po gsol ba 'debs pa por gyur /
translated: Just as the lord of the city of Kalapa in the land of Shambhala, born from the womb of the goddess Vijayadevi of the light of the mother, King Sucandra, became the supplicant.

original: rgyud gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ma thos shing lung bstan pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po @125a * //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ma thos shing lung bstan pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po @125a * //
translated: In some other tantras, the mutual teacher and supplicant are not heard and not prophesied.

original: 'brel pa 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation is contradictory,

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we reply:

original: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa la mngal nas byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa por mi 'gyur ro zhes gang 'ga' zhig gis brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa la mngal nas byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa por mi 'gyur ro zhes gang 'ga' zhig gis brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, some may say that one who is born from a womb is not a supplicant to the Tathāgata in the vehicle of mantra.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang mngal nas byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang mngal nas byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because the Bhagavān himself was born from a womb.

original: sngags kyi theg pa 'di la gal te mngal nas byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa po dang sdud pa por mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa 'di la gal te mngal nas byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa po dang sdud pa por mi 'gyur na /
translated: If in this vehicle of mantra one who is born from a womb is not a supplicant and compiler,

original: de'i tshe sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang ma'i lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i lhums nas bltams pa sh'akya thub pa thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang ma'i lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i lhums nas bltams pa sh'akya thub pa thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa por mi 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the omniscient teacher Śākyamuni would not be born from the womb of Mahāmāyā, the queen of Śuddhodana, the lord of the Śākya clan.

original: mngal nas byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal nas byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He would not be born from a womb.

original: yang 'ga' zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig gis smras pa /
translated: Again, someone may say:

original: des sngar bdud bcom pa byas shing byang chub bskyed de de nas thams cad mkhyen pa chos ston par byed pa por gyur to //
analyzed: des sngar bdud bcom pa byas shing byang chub bskyed de de nas thams cad mkhyen pa chos ston par byed pa por gyur to //
translated: He has already defeated Mara, generated enlightenment, and then become the teacher of the omniscient Dharma.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes la yang mngal du 'jug pa med do zhes pa'i tshig las ni shin tu 'gal ba ste rang ma grub pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes la yang mngal du 'jug pa med do zhes pa'i tshig las ni shin tu 'gal ba ste rang ma grub pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the statement that after nirvana there is no entry into the womb is contradicted, because what is not established by itself cannot establish another.

original: 'dir dang por sangs rgyas nyid med na lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi nang nas gang gis kyang bdud 'joms par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dir dang por sangs rgyas nyid med na lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi nang nas gang gis kyang bdud 'joms par mi byed do //
translated: Here, if there were no Buddhahood at the beginning, no one from among gods, humans, or asuras would defeat Mara.

original: dang por mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: dang por mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par yang mi byed de /
translated: Nor would he generate enlightenment at the beginning,

original: sgrib pa thams cad med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he would not be free from all obscurations.

original: cig car yang mi byed de gang gi tshe bdud yod pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas nyid ma yin te sems sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car yang mi byed de gang gi tshe bdud yod pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas nyid ma yin te sems sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor would he do so simultaneously, because when Mara exists, he is not a Buddha, because his mind is obscured.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas nyid yin pa de'i tshe bdud med de sems sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa las gzhan pa ci yod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas nyid yin pa de'i tshe bdud med de sems sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa las gzhan pa ci yod /
translated: When one is a Buddha, then there is no Mara, because the mind is free from obscurations. What else is there besides that?

original: las kyis 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma gtogs pa bud med kyi mngal nas skyes pa gzhan ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu dang mdzod sbu sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su 'khyil pa dang mngon par shes pa drug
analyzed: las kyis 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma gtogs pa bud med kyi mngal nas skyes pa gzhan ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu dang mdzod sbu sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su 'khyil pa dang mngon par shes pa drug
translated: By karma, no one is born from a woman’s womb except the Lord Buddha, and no one has the thirty-two marks of a superman, the eighty minor marks, the thirty-two curls, the six superknowledges,

original: dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: and the four forms of fearlessness.

original: de'i phyir bdud ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i sems kyi bag chags kyi dri ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdud ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i sems kyi bag chags kyi dri ma'o //
translated: Therefore, what is called Mara is the stain of the habitual tendencies of the mind of cyclic existence of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral ba'i sems so //
translated: What is called Buddhahood is the mind free from the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan @125b 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan @125b 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: Thus, the Lord Buddha said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gsungs te de nyid ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gsungs te de nyid ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said to be naturally radiant, and that is free from the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir bdud ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i sems yin la sangs rgyas nyid ni dri ma med pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdud ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i sems yin la sangs rgyas nyid ni dri ma med pa'i sems yin no //
translated: Therefore, Māra is the defiled mind, and buddhahood is the undefiled mind.

original: 'dir phyi rol du sangs rgyas kyis bdud bcom pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam bzhin du sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du sangs rgyas kyis bdud bcom pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam bzhin du sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi snang ba yin no //
translated: Here, what is called the Buddha’s destruction of Māra is like a dream, the appearance in the minds of sentient beings.

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni le'u lnga par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni le'u lnga par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The mind of the Tathāgata will be explained extensively in chapter five.

original: 'dir sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor bar 'jug pa ni 'khor ba pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor bar 'jug pa ni 'khor ba pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, the entry of the buddhas and bodhisattvas into cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings is not to be expressed by those in cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag sems can gyi don la dmyal bar zhugs pa'i dus su gshin rje'i pho nya rnams dang gshin rje'i rgyal po rnams kyis bstod pa brjod pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag sems can gyi don la dmyal bar zhugs pa'i dus su gshin rje'i pho nya rnams dang gshin rje'i rgyal po rnams kyis bstod pa brjod pa /
translated: When the Lord of the World entered hell for the sake of sentient beings, the messengers of Yama and the kings of Yama praised him:

original: gang zhig srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams las grol yang sems can don du srid pa 'dzin //
analyzed: gang zhig srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams las grol yang sems can don du srid pa 'dzin //
translated: “Though liberated from the bonds of existence, for the sake of sentient beings, you take on existence.

original: de ni stong pa'i don dag ston mdzad dus las las kyi 'bras bu gtong ma yin //
analyzed: de ni stong pa'i don dag ston mdzad dus las las kyi 'bras bu gtong ma yin //
translated: You reveal the meaning of emptiness, but you do not abandon the fruits of karma.

original: sems kyi dri ma yang dag ye shes mes bsregs rtag tu yang dag brtse bas brlan //
analyzed: sems kyi dri ma yang dag ye shes mes bsregs rtag tu yang dag brtse bas brlan //
translated: The stains of the mind are burned by the fire of wisdom, and you are always moistened by true love.

original: mdzad spyod brtag min sems can don la dgyes pa'i sangs rgyas de la bdag cag 'dud ces pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad spyod brtag min sems can don la dgyes pa'i sangs rgyas de la bdag cag 'dud ces pa'o //
translated: We bow to that Buddha, whose conduct is not to be examined, who delights in the welfare of sentient beings.”

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi ngo bor sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngal du 'jug pa'am dmyal bar gshegs pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi ngo bor sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngal du 'jug pa'am dmyal bar gshegs pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par brtag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, the entry into the womb or the journey to hell of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas for the sake of sentient beings cannot be imagined by ordinary people.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bsgrubs pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug dbang bcu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sprul pa'i sku du ma dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i gdul bya rnams la byang chub
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bsgrubs pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug dbang bcu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sprul pa'i sku du ma dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i gdul bya rnams la byang chub
translated: A single bodhisattva who has attained the ten powers of the ten levels by accomplishing the ten perfections can, with many emanation bodies in a great trichiliocosm world system, teach the Dharma of the bodhisattvas to bodhisattva disciples.

original: sems dpa'i chos ston par byed de byang chub sems dpa' chen po de du ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa'i chos ston par byed de byang chub sems dpa' chen po de du ma ni ma yin no //
translated: But that great bodhisattva is not many.

original: de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i @126a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i @126a * //
translated: Similarly, by the power of previous aspirations, the accumulations of merit and wisdom are perfected and fearlessness and so on are attained.

original: dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i sku sgrib pa dang bral ba mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gis
analyzed: dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i sku sgrib pa dang bral ba mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gis
translated: with limitless, limitless emanation bodies free of obscurations,

original: / sems can mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gi skad mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gis gsol ba 'debs pa po sna tshogs kyis gsol ba btab pa na /
analyzed: / sems can mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gi skad mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa dag gis gsol ba 'debs pa po sna tshogs kyis gsol ba btab pa na /
translated: teaches the Dharma to those who supplicate him with limitless, limitless languages of limitless, limitless sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad la rab tu 'jug pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston par mdzad de thams cad mkhyen pa de du ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad la rab tu 'jug pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston par mdzad de thams cad mkhyen pa de du ma ni ma yin no //
translated: He teaches the mundane and supramundane Dharmas with the omniscient language that engages all the languages of all sentient beings. That omniscience is not multiple.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu chen po 'ga' zhig gis sgyu ma'i gzugs du ma sprul te des sprul pa'i gzugs de dag gis shing rnams rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed cing ri'i rtse mo yang skyod par byed la /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu chen po 'ga' zhig gis sgyu ma'i gzugs du ma sprul te des sprul pa'i gzugs de dag gis shing rnams rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed cing ri'i rtse mo yang skyod par byed la /
translated: For example, a certain great illusory being emanates many illusory forms, and those forms emanated by him uproot trees and shake the peaks of mountains.

original: lha chen po'i gzugs lta bu dang khyab 'jug lta bus lha sbyin la sogs pa 'ching bar byed de sgyu ma'i skyes bu chen po de du ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha chen po'i gzugs lta bu dang khyab 'jug lta bus lha sbyin la sogs pa 'ching bar byed de sgyu ma'i skyes bu chen po de du ma ni ma yin no //
translated: And like the form of a great god or like Vishnu, he binds Devadatta and so on. That great illusory being is not many.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i sku dag gis srid pa gsum du sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i sku dag gis srid pa gsum du sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the illusory emanation bodies of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas work for the welfare of sentient beings in the three worlds.

original: des na sems can thams cad la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngar sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu gyur pa mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang ba sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul dang ldan pa
analyzed: des na sems can thams cad la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngar sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu gyur pa mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang ba sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul dang ldan pa
translated: Therefore, in order to teach all sentient beings the mundane and supramundane dharmas, the Bhagavān Buddha, who was previously the lord of the twelfth stage, the wise one, the wielder of great magic, possessing great magical powers,

original: 'phags pa'i yul lu mbi nir  sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang ma'i lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i lhums nas bltams pa ni gzhon nu don grub yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul lu mbi nir  sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang ma'i lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i lhums nas bltams pa ni gzhon nu don grub yin la /
translated: was born in the land of the āryas in Lumbinī, from the womb of Mahāmāyā, the queen of Śuddhodana, the lord of the Śākya people. He was the youth Siddhārtha.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje yang shambha la'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong du nyi ma'i 'od kyi lha mo rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas 'khrungs pa zla ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje yang shambha la'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong du nyi ma'i 'od kyi lha mo rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas 'khrungs pa zla ba bzang po'o //
translated: The lord of the tenth stage Vajrapāṇi was born in the land of Shambhala in the city of Kalāpa, from the womb of the goddess of the sun’s light Vijayā. He was Sucandra.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa'i don du sa bcu gnyis mngon du mdzad nas sh'akya thub par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa'i don du sa bcu gnyis mngon du mdzad nas sh'akya thub par gyur to //
translated: The Lord Buddha, having manifested the twelve stages for the purpose of teaching the mundane and supramundane dharmas in the Buddha-field, became Sakyamuni.

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje ni @126b chu bo sh'i ta'i byang phyogs grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i gdul bya rnams rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thob🔽par bya ba'i phyir rgyal po zla ba bzang por gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje ni @126b chu bo sh'i ta'i byang phyogs grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i gdul bya rnams rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyal po zla ba bzang por gyur to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajrapani, in order that the disciples living in the ninety-six kotis of villages to the north of the river Sita might attain the path of perfect enlightenment by the King of Tantras, the Supreme First Buddha, became the king Sucandra.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'di gnyis sprul pa'i sku'am longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa por 'brel pa yin te snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'di gnyis sprul pa'i sku'am longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs pa por 'brel pa yin te snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two, the Buddha and the Bodhisattva, are connected as teacher and supplicant by means of the Emanation Body or the Body of Perfect Resource, because there is no contradiction between the former and the latter.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku rgyal po zla ba bzang po des sems can thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab po //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku rgyal po zla ba bzang po des sems can thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab po //
translated: The nirmāṇakāya of Vajrapāṇi, King Sucandra, made a request to the Tathāgata for the sake of all sentient beings accomplishing mundane and supramundane siddhis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chu bo sh'i ta'i byang phyogs shambha la la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa rnams kyi sems rnam par dag pa skal pa dang ldan pa nyid du gnas pa gzigs nas rdo rje'i tshig
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chu bo sh'i ta'i byang phyogs shambha la la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa rnams kyi sems rnam par dag pa skal pa dang ldan pa nyid du gnas pa gzigs nas rdo rje'i tshig
translated: The Tathāgata, seeing that the minds of those dwelling in the ninety-six million cities of the Śambhala country and so forth to the north of the Śītā River were pure and fortunate, revealed the twelve thousand vajra verses

original: kha ma phye ba med pa rdo rje'i tshig rab tu gsal bar byed pa mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa yang dag par bstan to //

translated: The king said, The words 'eating the skull,' 'eating cow meat,' 'eating buffalo meat,' 'eating the end of a rope,' 'taking a woman,' and so on, are mutually contradictory terms for the conduct of various objects.🔽When analyzed by those

translated: By that order of King Yaśas, all those brahmin sages who had definitely come out from the town of Kalāpa entered the forest on the tenth day.

analyzed: ji ltar tshangs pa'i drang srong 'di dag 'phags pa'i yul du song na grong bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad mi bzad pa'i @130a * //
translated: If these sages were to go to the noble land, all the sentient beings living in the ninety-six million towns would become filled with unbearable

original: sems dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: hostility.

original: 'dir rgyu gang zhig rdo rje'i theg par gsungs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi lam ma yin pa'i rgyu des drang srong thar pa don du gnyer ba 'di dag thams cad dpal rgyal po grags pa'i 'jigs pas rang gi gnas yongs su btang ste rang gi gnyen
analyzed: 'dir rgyu gang zhig rdo rje'i theg par gsungs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi lam ma yin pa'i rgyu des drang srong thar pa don du gnyer ba 'di dag thams cad dpal rgyal po grags pa'i 'jigs pas rang gi gnas yongs su btang ste rang gi gnyen
translated: Here, the reason is that the path of authentic wisdom taught in the Vajrayāna is not the path of these sages. For this reason, all these sages who seek liberation, fearing the glorious Yaśho-rāja, will abandon their homes and,🔽taking their relatives and friends, go to the noble land.

original: bshes bzung nas 'phags pa'i yul du song ngo zhes rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i skye bo rnams sems par byed cing skal pa ngan par 'gyur te zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos kyi snod la sems legs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Thus, the kṣatriyas and so on will think and become unfortunate because their minds are not well disposed toward the profound and vast Dharma.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas mi'i dbang po grags pas khyab 'jug dang tshangs pa dang drag po'i rigs thams cad rmongs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //🔽ting nge 'dzin de dang lha'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis drang srong de dag thams cad nags tshal de nyid du rmongs par gyur pa dang nags tshal de na gnas pa'i ri khrod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis drang srong thams cad bcings nas slar yang dkyil
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas mi'i dbang po grags pas khyab 'jug dang tshangs pa dang drag po'i rigs thams cad rmongs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so // ting nge 'dzin de dang lha'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis drang srong de dag thams cad nags tshal de nyid du rmongs par gyur pa dang nags tshal de na gnas pa'i ri khrod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis drang srong thams cad bcings nas slar yang dkyil
translated: Having thus known the thoughts of all sentient beings, the Lord of Men entered the meditative absorption called “the one that causes Viṣṇu, Brahmā, and all the Rudras to be confused.”

original: 'khor gyi khang pa nyid du khyer 'ongs te mi'i dbang po grags pa'i zhabs kyi drung du dor ba dang rab tu sad de mi'i dbang po grags pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa de nyid dang ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'khor gyi khang pa nyid du khyer 'ongs te mi'i dbang po grags pa'i zhabs kyi drung du dor ba dang rab tu sad de mi'i dbang po grags pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa de nyid dang ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal mthong bar gyur to //
translated: By the power of that meditative absorption and the blessing of the gods, all those sages became confused right there in the forest. Those who lived in the forest, such as the hermits, bound all the sages and brought them back to the maṇḍala house. They were thrown at the feet of the Lord of Men, Yaśas, and they awoke. The Lord of Men, Yaśas, saw the maṇḍala house and the Malyavana garden.

original: de mthong ba na ya mtshan thob na ae ma ho /
analyzed: de mthong ba na ya mtshan thob na ae ma ho /
translated: When they saw it, they were amazed and said, “E ma ho!

original: 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste bdag cag rab tu ma sad par nags tshal chen po nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa chen por sus khyer te 'ongs zhes pa'i tshig 'di smras so //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste bdag cag rab tu ma sad par nags tshal chen po nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa chen por sus khyer te 'ongs zhes pa'i tshig 'di smras so //
translated: This is wondrous. Who has carried us from the great forest to the great maṇḍala palace without our even noticing?”

original: tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi tshig de lta bu 'di rgyal po grags pa'i blon po sprul pa'i sku rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyis thos nas smras pa /🔽kye nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams ya mtshan par ma byed cig / rgyal po grags pa 'di ni phyogs gcig ma yin te khyed rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis byung ba'i byang chub sems
analyzed: tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi tshig de lta bu 'di rgyal po grags pa'i blon po sprul pa'i sku rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyis thos nas smras pa / kye nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams ya mtshan par ma byed cig / rgyal po grags pa 'di ni phyogs gcig ma yin te khyed rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis byung ba'i byang chub sems
translated: When Sāgara­buddhi, the emanation minister of King Yaśas, heard these words of the Brahmā sages, he said,

original: dpa' chen po zhig go //
analyzed: dpa' chen po zhig go //
translated: “O Sūryarathā and the other Brahmā sages, do not be amazed. This King Yaśas is not just anyone. He is a great bodhisattva who has appeared through the blessing of the Buddha in order to care for you all.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i zhabs la skyabs su song la rgyud kyi rgyal po dang po'i sangs rgyas la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i lam dbang bskur @130b bar gsol ba thob cig ces so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i zhabs la skyabs su song la rgyud kyi rgyal po dang po'i sangs rgyas la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i lam dbang bskur @130b bar gsol ba thob cig ces so //
translated: Therefore, go for refuge to his feet and request the empowerment to practice the path of accomplishing mundane and supramundane siddhis in the King of Tantras, the Original Buddha.”

original: de nas rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyi tshig de dang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams rab tu sad de tshig 'di smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyi tshig de dang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams rab tu sad de tshig 'di smras pa /
translated: Then, through the power of those words of Sāgara­mati and the blessings of the buddhas, Sūryaratha and the other brahmin sages were awakened and spoke these words:

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent!

original: rgya mtsho'i blo gros khyod kyi tshig gang gis bdag cag gi sems rab tu sad par gyur to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i blo gros khyod kyi tshig gang gis bdag cag gi sems rab tu sad par gyur to //
translated: Sāgara­mati, your words have awakened our minds.

original: de'i phyir nga ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ste sems can mtha' dag gis skye ba 'di nyid la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i skad du rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das
analyzed: de'i phyir nga ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ste sems can mtha' dag gis skye ba 'di nyid la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i skad du rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das
translated: Therefore, I have gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and will explain the tantra of Kālacakra, the king of all tantras, in order to cause all sentient beings to attain perfect buddhahood in this very lifetime.🔽

original: pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i lam dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i lam dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, I have gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and will request the empowerment into the path for accomplishing the mundane and supramundane feats of the king of tantras, the Kālacakra, in order that all sentient beings attain perfect, full enlightenment in this very lifetime.”

original: de skad smras nas drang srong de rnams kyis tshangs pa'i rigs kyi rgyal po nyi ma'i shing rta la bos te /
analyzed: de skad smras nas drang srong de rnams kyis tshangs pa'i rigs kyi rgyal po nyi ma'i shing rta la bos te /
translated: Having said that, those sages addressed the king of the Brahmā class, Sūryaratha:

original: kye nyi ma'i shing rta khyod ni rig byed la sogs pa'i bstan bcos kyi glegs bam gcig bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad kyi gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i thugs can no //
analyzed: kye nyi ma'i shing rta khyod ni rig byed la sogs pa'i bstan bcos kyi glegs bam gcig bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad kyi gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i thugs can no //
translated: “O Sūryaratha, you are the one who holds the text of the treatises such as the Vedas, which are the object of evaluation of all the treatises, both mundane and supramundane.

original: des na bdag cag gi gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig gis rgyal po grags pa la gsol ba gdab pa byos shig / bdag cag kyang mandala sngon du 'gro ba can gyis skyabs su song ste thams cad kyis gsol ba gdab par bgyi'o //

translated: We too, having gone for refuge with a preliminary maṇḍala offering, will all make a request.”

original: de nas tshangs pa'i drang srong gi tshig des nyi ma'i shing rtas rin chen gser gyi rang bzhin gyi me tog rnams kyis mandala byas nas mi'i dbang po grags pa'i zhabs kyi drung du rin po che'i me tog gi snyim pa gtor te /

translated: Then, with those words of the sage Brahmā, Sūryaratha made a maṇḍala with flowers of precious gold and cast a handful of precious flowers at the feet of Yaśas, lord of men.

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs shing thal mo sbyar ba dpral bar bkod de mi'i dbang po grags pa la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs shing thal mo sbyar ba dpral bar bkod de mi'i dbang po grags pa la gsol ba btab pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang du mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po rnams kyang skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas nyid thob par lung ston zhing bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'thob
translated: Blessed One, please teach the King of Tantras, the Original Buddha, in which you prophesy that even those who have committed the five heinous acts will attain buddhahood in this very lifetime, and in which you prophesy that they will attain the great seal, which is subsumed by the unchanging bliss of being the supreme vajra holder.

translated: Please teach the King of Tantras, the Original Buddha.🔽The transcendent conquerors taught the twelve thousand Original Buddha to King Sucandra. Please compile that very tantra, the king of tantras, the Original Buddha, into a concise version and teach it to the sages.

original: srong rnams la ston pas bstan du gsol zhes so //
analyzed: srong rnams la ston pas bstan du gsol zhes so //
translated: Thus, the transcendent conquerors taught the twelve thousand Original Buddha to King Sucandra. Please compile that very tantra, the king of tantras, the Original Buddha, into a concise version and teach it to the sages.

original: de nas nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab pa gsan nas tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi mos pa'i sems kyi dbang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis bsdus pa yang dag par sdud par mdzad pa po nyid kyis phreng ba 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab pa gsan nas tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi mos pa'i sems kyi dbang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis bsdus pa yang dag par sdud par mdzad pa po nyid kyis phreng ba 'dzin pa'i
translated: Then, having heard the request of Sūryartha, for the sake of the minds of the Brahma sages who are inclined to listen, the compiler himself, by the power of the Tathagata's blessing, compiled the entire text.

original: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa po la sogs pa'i yang dag par sdud par byed pa dag gis rgyud kyi rgyal po ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa po la sogs pa'i yang dag par sdud par byed pa dag gis rgyud kyi rgyal po ston par mdzad do //
translated: The compilers, such as Sarvanivaranavishkambhin, the teacher of all-knowingness, and so forth, taught the king of tantras.

original: sgra bzang po smra ba de dag rnams kyi sgra bzang po la zhen pa spang ba'i slad du don la rton  pa nyid la brten te tshigs su bcad pa kha cig tu zur chag gi sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa kha cig tu gcod mtshams nyams pa dang /
analyzed: sgra bzang po smra ba de dag rnams kyi sgra bzang po la zhen pa spang ba'i slad du don la rton  pa nyid la brten te tshigs su bcad pa kha cig tu zur chag gi sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa kha cig tu gcod mtshams nyams pa dang /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the beautiful sounds of those who speak beautifully, relying on the very meaning, some verses have irregular sounds, some verses have broken meters,

original: kha cig tu rnam dbye med pa'i tshig dang / kha cig tu dbyangs dang gsal byed phyis pa dang / tshigs bcad kha cig tu ring po la thung ngu dang thung ngu la yang ring po dang / kha cig tu lnga pa'i don la bdun pa dang /
analyzed: kha cig tu rnam dbye med pa'i tshig dang / kha cig tu dbyangs dang gsal byed phyis pa dang / tshigs bcad kha cig tu ring po la thung ngu dang thung ngu la yang ring po dang / kha cig tu lnga pa'i don la bdun pa dang /
translated: In some places, words without case endings, in some places, vowels and consonants are reversed, in some verses, long is short and short is long, in some places, the meaning of the fifth is the seventh,

original: bzhi pa'i don la drug pa dang / kha cig tu gzhan gyi tshig can gyi dbyings la bdag nyid kyi tshig can dang / bdag nyid kyi tshig can la gzhan gyi tshig can dang kha cig tu gcig gi tshig la mang po'i tshig dang ; mang po'i tshig la gcig gi tshig dang /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i don la drug pa dang / kha cig tu gzhan gyi tshig can gyi dbyings la bdag nyid kyi tshig can dang / bdag nyid kyi tshig can la gzhan gyi tshig can dang kha cig tu gcig gi tshig la mang po'i tshig dang ; mang po'i tshig la gcig gi tshig dang /
translated: the meaning of the fourth is the sixth, in some places, the realm of another's word is one's own word, one's own word is another's word, in some places, the word of one is the word of many, the word of many is the word of one,

original: kha cig tu pho'i rtags la ma ning gi rtags dang ma ning gi rtags la pho'i rtags dang / kha cig tu rkan las byung ba sha yig la so dang spyi bo las byung ba dang / kha cig tu spyi bo las byung ba la so dang rkan las byung ba dang /
analyzed: kha cig tu pho'i rtags la ma ning gi rtags dang ma ning gi rtags la pho'i rtags dang / kha cig tu rkan las byung ba sha yig la so dang spyi bo las byung ba dang / kha cig tu spyi bo las byung ba la so dang rkan las byung ba dang /
translated: in some places, the sign of a male is the sign of a neuter, the sign of a neuter is the sign of a male, in some places, the flesh syllable arising from the palate is arising from the teeth and crown, in some places, arising from the crown is arising from the teeth and palate,

original: kha cig tu so las byung ba la rkan dang spyi bo las byung ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu so las byung ba la rkan dang spyi bo las byung ba ste /
translated: In some cases, it is produced from the teeth, palate, and crown of the head.

original: de lta bu gzhan yang rgyud ston pa po'i man ngag gi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu gzhan yang rgyud ston pa po'i man ngag gi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, one should follow the instructions of the teacher who reveals the tantra.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavān has said in the Root Tantra:

analyzed: zla bzang sangs rgyas thams cad dang // bla ma rnams kyi slob ma yis //

original: @131b chung ma bu mo bu sdug dang // rtag tu 'dod pa'i dngos po 'bul //
analyzed: @131b chung ma bu mo bu sdug dang // rtag tu 'dod pa'i dngos po 'bul //
translated: should always offer the desired things to the mother, daughter, and beloved son.

original: dri ni sa la 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: dri ni sa la 'byung ba ste //
translated: The smell arises from the earth,

original: chu la gzugs dang me la ro //
analyzed: chu la gzugs dang me la ro //

original: rlung reg 'gyur ba med la sgra //
analyzed: rlung reg 'gyur ba med la sgra //

original: nam mkha' che la chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: nam mkha' che la chos kyi dbyings //

analyzed: dri dang spos sogs mar me dang // bza' dang btung sogs gos rnams kyis //
translated: food and drink, and so on, and clothes,

analyzed: rtag tu phyag rgya mchod byas te //
translated: always make offerings to the consort.

original: dam pa'i bu yis bla ma'i dbul //
analyzed: dam pa'i bu yis bla ma'i dbul //
translated: The good son should offer to the guru.

original: zhes gsungs te de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra zur chag gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas lung bklags pa las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra zur chag gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas lung bklags pa las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The yogi should understand such things and other broken words from reading the scriptures.

original: de bzhin du 'grel bshad la yang sgra bzang po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal nyams par bya ba'i slad du bdag gis don la rton pa nyid la brten te bri bar bya ste /🔽rnam pa gang dang gang gis rigs dang rig pa dang sgra bzang po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal zad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang des don la rton pa nyid la brten te yul gyi skad gzhan dang sgra'i bstan bcos kyi skad gzhan gyis sangs rgyas dang byang
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grel bshad la yang sgra bzang po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal nyams par bya ba'i slad du bdag gis don la rton pa nyid la brten te bri bar bya ste / rnam pa gang dang gang gis rigs dang rig pa dang sgra bzang po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal zad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang des don la rton pa nyid la brten te yul gyi skad gzhan dang sgra'i bstan bcos kyi skad gzhan gyis sangs rgyas dang byang
translated: Similarly, in the commentary, in order to destroy the pride of those who are conceited about their knowledge of good words, I will write relying on the very meaning itself.

original: chub sems dpa' rnams thar pa'i don du chos ston to //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams thar pa'i don du chos ston to //
translated: In whatever way one exhausts the pride of one's knowledge of good words and grammar, in that very way, relying on the very meaning itself, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas teach the Dharma for the sake of liberation using other local languages and other languages of treatises on grammar.

analyzed: yang dag par bsdus te rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po las byung ba sngon du lung bstan pa'i bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dam pa'i dngos po shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor khyod kyis kyang rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyon cig ces so

translated: In all the king of tantras, is it not the case that the Tathagata taught the place where the Bhagavat Vajradhara resides with the words thus have I heard and so forth?

original: ji ltar rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa dang bral bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bstan pa yin /🔽'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs @133a * //🔽pas bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa med pa'i phyir rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes ming dang tshig la rton pa la brten pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa dang bral bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bstan pa yin / 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs @133a * // pas bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa med pa'i phyir rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes ming dang tshig la rton pa la brten pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur te //
translated: Some may say, This King of Tantras was taught by the Buddha Bhagavān without the words 'thus have I heard,' and so forth, as the omniscient one and so forth.🔽 Because it lacks the words 'thus have I heard,' and so forth, this King of Tantras was not taught by the Buddha Bhagavān, relying on the words and syllables.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byis pa'i skye bo ming dang tshig la rton pa la brten pa dag gis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byis pa'i skye bo ming dang tshig la rton pa la brten pa dag gis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs
translated: Therefore, in this expression, some may say, In the future, childish beings who rely on words and syllables will say, 'The Bhagavān Vajradhara resided in this King of Tantras with the words 'thus have I heard,' and so forth.

original: pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs par gang brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs par gang brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: gang gi phyir chos ston pa po don la rton pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sdud par byed pa po rnams kyang yul sna tshogs kyi skad gzhan gyis yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir gal te 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa legs par sbyar ba'i tshig mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis bskyed pa nyi tshe bas de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par byed pa de lta na chos kyi phung po brgyad
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos ston pa po don la rton pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sdud par byed pa po rnams kyang yul sna tshogs kyi skad gzhan gyis yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro // 'dir gal te 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa legs par sbyar ba'i tshig mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis bskyed pa nyi tshe bas de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par byed pa de lta na chos kyi phung po brgyad
translated: because the teacher of the Dharma relies on the meaning, and the compilers also compile the Dharma in the language of various countries.

original: khri bzhi stong dus du mar yang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa dang / sdud pa pos kyang bri bar mi nus te nyi tshe ba legs par sbyar ba'i tshig gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khri bzhi stong dus du mar yang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa dang / sdud pa pos kyang bri bar mi nus te nyi tshe ba legs par sbyar ba'i tshig gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, if the limited words of the Sanskrit language, such as “thus have I heard,” are generated by the effort of the throat, palate, and so on, and the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma in that way, then the Tathāgata could not teach the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma in many eons, nor could the compilers write them down, because they are limited to the single language of Sanskrit.

original: 'dir sprul pa'i sku mtha' yas pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams kyi sgra dag gis cig car chos ston pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir sprul pa'i sku mtha' yas pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams kyi sgra dag gis cig car chos ston pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, because there are not infinite emanation bodies, there would be no teaching of Dharma simultaneously in infinite world systems by infinite emanations for infinite sentient beings with infinite languages.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: And because there would be no one to teach the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma, there would be no omniscience. But that is not so.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas tshad med pa dang chos tshad med pa dang dge 'dun tshad med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di'i phyir ston pa po thams cad mkhyen pa gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas tshad med pa dang chos tshad med pa dang dge 'dun tshad med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di'i phyir ston pa po thams cad mkhyen pa gcig ma yin no //
translated: Here, the Tathāgata has said that the Buddha is immeasurable, the Dharma is immeasurable, and the Saṅgha is immeasurable. Therefore, the teacher is not one omniscient being.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis don ston par byed pa gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis don ston par byed pa gcig ma yin no //
translated: The language of omniscience is not one that teaches the meaning in the languages of all sentient beings.

original: bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa gcig ma yin no //
translated: The place of dwelling is not one.

original: @133b de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa po nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gcig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: @133b de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa po nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gcig ma yin gyi /
translated: The assembly of disciples who request the Tathāgata to teach is not just one.

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi dbang gis thams cad mkhyen pa du ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad du ma dang bzhugs pa'i gnas du ma dang gsol ba 'debs pa po du ma dang chos bstan pa du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi dbang gis thams cad mkhyen pa du ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad du ma dang bzhugs pa'i gnas du ma dang gsol ba 'debs pa po du ma dang chos bstan pa du ma yin no //
translated: Here, due to the various inclinations of sentient beings, there are many omniscient ones, many languages of omniscient ones, many abodes, many requestors, and many teachings of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis bskyed pa lha'i skad gcig pus rgyud thams cad bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis bskyed pa lha'i skad gcig pus rgyud thams cad bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata does not teach all the continuums with just one divine language produced by the exertion of the throat, palate, and so on, such as Thus have I heard.

original: 'dir dang por re zhig nyan thos kyi tshul sde snod gsum la sogs pa ma ga dh'a'i skad kyis chos ston pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang por re zhig nyan thos kyi tshul sde snod gsum la sogs pa ma ga dh'a'i skad kyis chos ston pa ni 'di lta ste /
