analyzed: mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa'i rgyud //
translated: the tantra of the Hundred Thousand Verses on Exoteric Dharma,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog bde ci //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog bde ci //
translated: the supreme bliss of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la gsol ba gdab pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la gsol ba gdab pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, she teaches the supplication to the Hundred Thousand Verses on Exoteric Dharma.

original: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po gzhan rnams la yang gsol ba 'debs pa rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po gzhan rnams la yang gsol ba 'debs pa rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the yogi should know the supplications to the other kings of tantras.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtha' yas pa'i chos ston pa po nyid yin pa 'di'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtha' yas pa'i chos ston pa po nyid yin pa 'di'i phyir /
translated: Because the Bhagavat is the teacher of infinite Dharma,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brjed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brjed par mi bya'o //
translated: the Buddhists should not forget that thus have I heard, etc. teaches the abode of all the kings of tantras.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad kyi rang bzhin can thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba gcig pu 'dis yin na sangs rgyas kyang nyi tshe bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad kyi rang bzhin can thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba gcig pu 'dis yin na sangs rgyas kyang nyi tshe bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the case that all sentient beings had the nature of the Sanskrit language, and the Buddha spoke only this limited Sanskrit language without the omniscient language, then the Buddha would be limited.

original: @135b 'phags pa'i yul 'dir sgra smra ba po mu stegs pa mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams mthong nas /🔽ji ltar bram ze dang khyab 'jug pa dang zhi ba pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i lha tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams legs par sbyar ba smra ba po yin pa de bzhin du bdag cag gi 'dod pa'i lha sangs
analyzed: @135b 'phags pa'i yul 'dir sgra smra ba po mu stegs pa mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams mthong nas / ji ltar bram ze dang khyab 'jug pa dang zhi ba pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i lha tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams legs par sbyar ba smra ba po yin pa de bzhin du bdag cag gi 'dod pa'i lha sangs
translated: Seeing in this land of the āryas the tīrthikas who speak Sanskrit, who are skilled and have the pride of being āryas,🔽just as the gods Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Rudra, and so on, who are the desired gods of the brahmins, the followers of Viṣṇu, the followers of Śiva, and so on, speak Sanskrit, in the same way, our desired gods, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, speak Sanskrit.

original: rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par sbyar ba smra ba po yin no zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par sbyar ba smra ba po yin no zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi bsam pa ste /
translated: This is the thought of the childish Buddhists.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba 'dis ma yin te sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos ston par byed pa po dang yang dag par sdud par byed pa po
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba 'dis ma yin te sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos ston par byed pa po dang yang dag par sdud par byed pa po
translated: Here, all the buddhas and bodhisattvas teach the Dharma with the languages of all sentient beings, not with the limited language of Sanskrit, which is not the language of the omniscient ones.🔽They are the compilers of the Dharma.

original: yin no // de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lha'i skye ba dang 'brel pa nyi tshe bas ma yin te sems can sna tshogs kyi skad kyis chos ston pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lha'i skye ba dang 'brel pa nyi tshe bas ma yin te sems can sna tshogs kyi skad kyis chos ston pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas and bodhisattvas are not related to the limited birth of gods, but are teachers of the Dharma with the languages of various sentient beings.

original: sngags kyi tshul 'di la ae wam nyid ming ma yin te dngos po gcig la yang ming du ma'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul 'di la ae wam nyid ming ma yin te dngos po gcig la yang ming du ma'o //
translated: In this mantra system, e and vam are not names, but many names for a single entity.

original: ming mang po nyid kyi phyir ming gcig kho na gtso bo ma yin te ming thams cad kyis dngos po gcig go bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ming mang po nyid kyi phyir ming gcig kho na gtso bo ma yin te ming thams cad kyis dngos po gcig go bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there are many names, a single name is not the principal one, because all names make known a single entity.

original: / dper na bud med dang mi mo dang na chung ma rnams las bud med gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'i dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / dper na bud med dang mi mo dang na chung ma rnams las bud med gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'i dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, among women, girls, and young women, the word woman is not the principal name, because all of them are understood to have breasts and hair.

original: de bzhin du ae yig dang gsang ba dang padma dang chos 'byung dang nam mkha'i khams dang / bde ba chen po'i gnas dang / seng ge'i khri dang / bha ga dang / gsang ba'i ming rnams kyi nang nas ae yig gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ae yig dang gsang ba dang padma dang chos 'byung dang nam mkha'i khams dang / bde ba chen po'i gnas dang / seng ge'i khri dang / bha ga dang / gsang ba'i ming rnams kyi nang nas ae yig gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, among the names of the secret, lotus, source of phenomena, element of space, place of great bliss, lion throne, bhaga, and secret, the syllable E is not the principal name, because all of them are understood to be the emptiness of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du wam yig dang / bde ba chen po dad  chags pa chen po dang lhan cig skyes pa dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba dang / thig le dang de nyid dang ye shes dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi ming rnams kyi nang nas wam yig gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis phyag rgya chen po lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gyur ba med pa'i @136a * //🔽bde ba go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du wam yig dang / bde ba chen po dad  chags pa chen po dang lhan cig skyes pa dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba dang / thig le dang de nyid dang ye shes dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi ming rnams kyi nang nas wam yig gcig pu gtso bo'i ming ma yin te thams cad kyis phyag rgya chen po lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gyur ba med pa'i @136a * // bde ba go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the letter vaṃ, great bliss, great passion, coemergence, supreme unchanging, drop, reality, gnosis, and the names of the pure mind are not the names of the principal alone from among the letters vaṃ, but all of them indicate the coemergent bliss of mahāmudrā, which is unchanging.

original: de bzhin du ae yig dang wam yig dag gis rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du ae yig dang wam yig dag gis rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The letter e and the letter vaṃ indicate the reality of bodhicitta, which is the inseparability of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations and compassion that is not focused on any phenomenon.🔽The letter e indicates emptiness, and the letter vaṃ indicates compassion.

original: ae wam gi yi ge dang / rdo rje sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyi sems dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang / dang po'i sangs rgyas dang / shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dang / rnal 'byor dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid dang /
analyzed: ae wam gi yi ge dang / rdo rje sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyi sems dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang / dang po'i sangs rgyas dang / shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dang / rnal 'byor dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid dang /
translated: The yogin should understand the yoga of nondual wisdom and means, which is the nature of the non-Buddhist, by means of many names such as “evam,” “Vajrasattva,” “awakened mind,” “Kālacakra,” “primordial buddha,” “the nature of wisdom and means,” “yoga,” “the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness,”

original: gnyis su med pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dus pa dang / sdom pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dus pa dang / sdom pa ste /
translated: “nonduality,” “beginningless and endless,” “peace,” “union,” and “restraint.”

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming du ma rnams kyis rnal 'byor pas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming du ma rnams kyis rnal 'byor pas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The yogin should understand the yoga of nondual wisdom and means, which is the nature of the non-Buddhist, by means of many names such as “evam,” “Vajrasattva,” “awakened mind,” “Kālacakra,” “primordial buddha,” “the nature of wisdom and means,” “yoga,” “the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness,”🔽“nonduality,” “beginningless and endless,” “peace,” “union,” and “restraint.”

original: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po la rgyud kyi dang por ae yig dang wam yig bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis nges par bstan zhing sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis kyang rgyud kyi dang por bris pa gang yin pa
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po la rgyud kyi dang por ae yig dang wam yig bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis nges par bstan zhing sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis kyang rgyud kyi dang por bris pa gang yin pa
translated: Here, in the king of tantras such as the Guhyasamaja, the Bhagavat taught the letter E and the letter VAM at the beginning of the tantra by way of etymological definition, and they were also written at the beginning of the tantra by the compilers.

original: de ni lha rnams lha'i skad kyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i slad du'o //🔽de'i phyir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po la yi ge gnyis po 'di dbyi bar mi 'dod de yi ge gnyis po 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis rkan la sogs pas ma gsungs pa yang ma yin la sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis ma thos
analyzed: de ni lha rnams lha'i skad kyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i slad du'o // de'i phyir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po la yi ge gnyis po 'di dbyi bar mi 'dod de yi ge gnyis po 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis rkan la sogs pas ma gsungs pa yang ma yin la sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis ma thos
translated: That is for the sake of bringing the gods to full maturity with the gods' language.

original: par bris pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: par bris pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two letters are not to be deleted in the king of tantras such as the Guhyasamaja. It is not that the Bhagavat did not teach these two letters with the palate and so on, nor is it that the compilers did not hear them and write them down.

original: de'i phyir yi ge gnyis po 'di'i nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste dang por aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang gsang ba'i padma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge gnyis po 'di'i nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste dang por aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang gsang ba'i padma'o //
translated: Therefore, the definitive meaning of these two letters should be stated. First, the letter A is the space element and the secret lotus.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul lo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul lo //
translated: Then, the exclusion, the sun and the particle.

original: de'i 'og tu aa yig sgra gcan dang rnam par shes pa bde bas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu aa yig sgra gcan dang rnam par shes pa bde bas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Then, the letter A, Rahu and consciousness blessed by bliss.

original: de'i 'og tu rjes su nga ro zla ba dang khu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rjes su nga ro zla ba dang khu ba'o //
translated: Then, the vowel diacritic, the moon and semen.

original: aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang sgra gcan rnam shes 'di gnyis kyi bar du rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul ni au nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang sgra gcan rnam shes 'di gnyis kyi bar du rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul ni au nyid 'thob ste /
translated: Between these two, the letter A, the space element and Rahu, consciousness, the exclusion, the sun and the particle, is obtained as the letter U.

original: de'i phyir rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul au nyid thob par gyur pa na don dam pa'i bden pa las yon tan med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang rdul au nyid thob par gyur pa na don dam pa'i bden pa las yon tan med do //
translated: Therefore, when the exclusion, the sun and the particle, is obtained as the letter U, there is no quality in the ultimate truth.

original: yon tan med pa'i phyir ya na ra @136b bsgyur bar 'gyur te phyi ma'i aa yig sgra gcan dang rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig wa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan med pa'i phyir ya na ra @136b bsgyur bar 'gyur te phyi ma'i aa yig sgra gcan dang rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig wa nyid do //
translated: Because there is no quality, it becomes Y, and in combination with the subsequent letter A, Rahu and consciousness, it becomes the letter Va.

original: rjes su nga ro zla ba dang khu ba dang yang dag par sbyar te de'i phyir wam yig go //
analyzed: rjes su nga ro zla ba dang khu ba dang yang dag par sbyar te de'i phyir wam yig go //
translated: The vowel diacritic, the moon and semen, are combined with it, and therefore it is the letter Vam.

original: de bzhin du dang po'i aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang gsang ba'i padma ni bdun pa'i mtha' can te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i aa yig nam mkha'i khams dang gsang ba'i padma ni bdun pa'i mtha' can te /
translated: Likewise, the letter A of the first [syllable] is the space element and the secret lotus, which has a seventh [vowel].

original: aa yig pha rol gyi ai yig dang lhan cig yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: aa yig pha rol gyi ai yig dang lhan cig yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The letter A, together with the letter I of the next [syllable], becomes endowed with a quality.

original: de'i phyir ae yig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir ae yig go //
translated: Therefore, it is the letter E.

original: ae yig nam mkha'i khams rten 'di'i dbus su wam yig rnam par bcad pa dang / aa yig dang rjes su ro dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang zla ba dang rdul dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang khu ba'i bdag nyid rten pa yin par phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ae yig nam mkha'i khams rten 'di'i dbus su wam yig rnam par bcad pa dang / aa yig dang rjes su ro dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang zla ba dang rdul dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang khu ba'i bdag nyid rten pa yin par phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The letter E is the space element, the support. In the middle of this, the letter VAM is the supported, which is the nature of the syllable A, the moon, Rahu, the nectar, the semen, and the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān has said in the Root Tantra:

original: ae yig mkha' khams dbus su ni //
analyzed: ae yig mkha' khams dbus su ni //
translated: In the middle of the space element, the letter E,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bde ba len //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bde ba len //
translated: is the bliss of all the buddhas.

original: wam zhig rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ;
analyzed: wam zhig rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ;
translated: The letter VAM is this Vajrasattva,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor las //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor las //
translated: arisen from the yoga of body, speech, and mind.

original: thig le zla ba khu ba sku //
analyzed: thig le zla ba khu ba sku //
translated: The drop, the moon, the semen, is the body.

original: rnam par bcad pa rdul nyi gsung //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa rdul nyi gsung //
translated: The syllable raṃ is the speech of the sun.

original: aa yig mun can thugs rab brjod //
analyzed: aa yig mun can thugs rab brjod //
translated: The syllable aṃ is the mind of the moon.

original: mkha' khams ae la rnam par gnas //🔽sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: mkha' khams ae la rnam par gnas // sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The element of space is present in the syllable e.🔽By the yoga of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la //
translated: in the maṇḍala of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku gsung thugs dang chags pa yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs dang chags pa yis //
translated: by body, speech, and mind, and by passion,

original: srid gsum bdag nyid dag la gnas //
analyzed: srid gsum bdag nyid dag la gnas //
translated: one abides in the nature of the three existences.

original: zhes so // rgyu 'dis lha rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu 'dis lha rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas
translated: For the sake of ripening the gods and attaining perfect buddhahood, the Tathāgata taught in the kings of tantras such as the Guhyasamāja, beginning with “Thus have I heard,”

original: bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan pa gsungs so //
translated: the definite teaching of the place of the Buddha’s dwelling.

original: dngos po gang zhig dpal 'dus pa la sogs par ae wam zhes pa'i ming 'dis brjod pa'i dngos po de nyid mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams su gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig dpal 'dus pa la sogs par ae wam zhes pa'i ming 'dis brjod pa'i dngos po de nyid mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams su gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
translated: That very thing which is expressed by the name “e-vam” in the glorious Guhyasamaja and so forth is taught by the Tathagata in the kings of tantras such as the Lak-sottara Tantra by the words “secret” and so forth.

original: de yang bla ma'i man ngag las rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du dgongs pa'i skad kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bla ma'i man ngag las rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du dgongs pa'i skad kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood from the oral instructions of the guru and from the tantras and other tantras by means of the language of intention.

original: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs @137a * //🔽pa ; dgongs pa'i skad dang de bzhin min //
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs @137a * // pa ; dgongs pa'i skad dang de bzhin min //
translated: Here, the Bhagavat taught in the Root Tantra:🔽The language of intention and not that,

original: ji bzhin sgra dang de bzhin min //
analyzed: ji bzhin sgra dang de bzhin min //
translated: the literal and not that,

original: drang ba'i don dang nges don te //
analyzed: drang ba'i don dang nges don te //
translated: the provisional meaning and the definitive meaning,

original: rgyud ni mtha' drug mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyud ni mtha' drug mtshan nyid do //
translated: the tantra has the characteristics of the six parameters.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir ming gcig ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir ming gcig ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: Because of this teaching of the Bhagavat, a single name is not primary.

original: sngags kyi theg pa 'di la yid ches pa rnam pa gsum bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa 'di la yid ches pa rnam pa gsum bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat taught three kinds of confidence in this Mantra Vehicle:

original: dang por re zhig rgyud las yid ches pa dang / de nas bla ma las yid ches pa dang / de nas bdag nyid las yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: dang por re zhig rgyud las yid ches pa dang / de nas bla ma las yid ches pa dang / de nas bdag nyid las yid ches pa ste /
translated: First, one should have confidence in the tantra, then in the guru, and finally in oneself.

original: yid ches pa 'di gsum gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa 'di gsum gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of these three kinds of confidence, the path of the perfect Buddha becomes pure.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yid ches pa gsum med par lam gang bla mas slob ma la bstan pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te slob ma'i dad pa dman pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob kyi
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yid ches pa gsum med par lam gang bla mas slob ma la bstan pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te slob ma'i dad pa dman pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob kyi
translated: Otherwise, if the three kinds of confidence are absent, the path that the guru teaches to the disciple will not be the bestower of the fruit of perfect Buddhahood, because the disciple’s faith is weak.

original: bden pas 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pas 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The fruit will be mundane, based on the conventional truth.

original: 'dir rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba mdzad de rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i sems su byas nas nyi ma gcig mtshan ma yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba mdzad de rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i sems su byas nas nyi ma gcig mtshan ma yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Here, the Lord has made a promise in the tantra and in other tantras that if one makes the mind free from discursive thought and observes the signs for one day,

original: gal te rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga dang bla ma'i man ngag gis slob ma yid ches par ma gyur pa de lta na bcom ldan 'das brdzun gsung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste bla ma rgyud nas gsungs pa'i cho gas slob ma la lam ster ba por ma gyur pa de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba brdzun du mi 'gyur te bla mas lam yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir dang phyin ci log dang rnam par
analyzed: gal te rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga dang bla ma'i man ngag gis slob ma yid ches par ma gyur pa de lta na bcom ldan 'das brdzun gsung bar 'gyur ro // ci ste bla ma rgyud nas gsungs pa'i cho gas slob ma la lam ster ba por ma gyur pa de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba brdzun du mi 'gyur te bla mas lam yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir dang phyin ci log dang rnam par
translated: If the disciple does not become convinced by the rite taught in the tantras and by the guru’s instructions, then the Blessed Lord would be speaking falsely.

original: ma dag pa'i lam bsgom pa ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i lam bsgom pa ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But if the guru does not become the bestower of the path to the disciple by the rite taught in the tantras, then the Blessed Lord’s vow would be false, because the guru would not know the path and would teach the cultivation of a path that is erroneous and impure.

original: 'dir du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bor nas gzhan dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa'i mtshan ma nyi ma gcig yongs su brtag par bya ba ma yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'dir du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bor nas gzhan dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa'i mtshan ma nyi ma gcig yongs su brtag par bya ba ma yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so ;
translated: Here the Blessed Lord has said that, having discarded the signs such as smoke, one should not consider another sign, the maṇḍalacakra, for a single day.

original: /'dir rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyal po la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can zhal gsum pa brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: /'dir rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyal po la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can zhal gsum pa brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Here, in the king of tantras of the three families, the one with three faces, the nature of body, speech, and mind, is to be described.

original: rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid la sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid can zhal bzhi pa brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid la sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid can zhal bzhi pa brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: In the one of the nature of the four families, the one with four faces, the nature of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, is to be described.

original: rang @137b bzhin gyi rigs gcig dang lhan cig rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyud dang brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang @137b bzhin gyi rigs gcig dang lhan cig rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyud dang brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the single natural family, the tantra of the nature of the four families will be described.

original: de bzhin du rigs lnga'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyi gcig dang lhan cig rigs drug gi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs lnga'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyi gcig dang lhan cig rigs drug gi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, together with the single natural one of the nature of the five families, there will be the one of the nature of the six families.

original: 'dir rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud la rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang me dang rdul dang khu ba dang sems dang ye shes gcig tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud la rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang me dang rdul dang khu ba dang sems dang ye shes gcig tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, in the tantra of the nature of the four families, the one of the nature of the four families is to be described, the union of the sun, moon, Rāhu, fire, semen, ovum, mind, and gnosis as one.

original: 'dir mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gsal bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gsal bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, in the praise of discerning exalted wisdom in the recitation of the names, the three verses beginning with “thirty-three” and so forth clarify vajra yoga.

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
translated: The vajra sun is great illumination.

original: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
translated: The vajra moon is stainless light.

original: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
analyzed: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
translated: The first separation from desire is great desire.

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
translated: The blazing light of various colors.

original: rdo rje skyil krung rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The perfect buddha in vajra posture.

original: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa //
translated: The holder of the Dharma of the Buddha’s speech.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //

original: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
translated: The holder of the treasury of omniscient wisdom.

original: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang //
analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang //
translated: The king who holds various magical displays.

original: che bas sangs rgyas rigs sngags 'dzin //
analyzed: che bas sangs rgyas rigs sngags 'dzin //
translated: The great one who holds the Buddha’s mantra lineage.

original: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
translated: The vajra sharpness is the great sword.

original: 'gyur med mchog ste rnam par dag / ces so //
analyzed: 'gyur med mchog ste rnam par dag / ces so //
translated: The unchanging supreme is pure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa dang chos dang sngags dang dbyings  kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ste rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa dang chos dang sngags dang dbyings  kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: For this reason, the fourfold nature of the Bhagavat is to be stated, namely, Vajrasattva, the nature of the pure Dharmakaya, Mantra, and Dharmadhatu, the Bhagavat Kalacakra.

original: de ltar phung po dang khams kyi dbye bas rigs lnga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang khams kyi dbye bas rigs lnga'i bdag nyid de /

analyzed: de bzhin du sgyu 'phrul dra ba las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: And so in the Mayajala Tantra the Bhagavat has declared:

analyzed: gdong lnga zur phud lnga dang ldan //
translated: Five-faced, with five topknots,

analyzed: zur  phud lnga pa me tog thod // mgo zlum brtul zhugs chen po 'chang //
translated: Five topknots, flower skull,🔽Shaven head, great vow,

original: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
translated: Vow of pure conduct,

original: ces so // de bzhin du phung po dang / khams kyi dbye bas rigs drug gi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang / de bzhin du zhal gyi dbye bas rigs brgya'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtha'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa dang lhan cig me long lta @138a * //
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du phung po dang / khams kyi dbye bas rigs drug gi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang / de bzhin du zhal gyi dbye bas rigs brgya'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtha'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa dang lhan cig me long lta @138a * //
translated: Likewise, the six families, which are the nature of the divisions of the aggregates and constituents, are expressed by the Blessed One in the Mirror of the Mirror-Like Wisdom Praise in conjunction with the verses of the limit of the purity of the dharmadhātu.

original: bu'i ye shes la bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bu'i ye shes la bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The first verse of the Mirror of the Mirror-Like Wisdom Praise states:

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //
translated: The terrifying Vajrabhairava,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
translated: the terrifying six-faced king of wrathful ones,

original: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan //
translated: with six eyes, six arms, and strength,

original: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
analyzed: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
translated: the one with a skull and bared fangs.

original: ha l'a ha la gdong brgya pa //
analyzed: ha l'a ha la gdong brgya pa //
translated: The one with a hundred faces of Hālāhala,

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir /
translated: Thus, due to the Blessed One's statement,

original: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ni zhal gsum pa dang / zhal bzhi pa dang / zhal lnga pa dang / zhal drug pa dang / zhal brgya par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ni zhal gsum pa dang / zhal bzhi pa dang / zhal lnga pa dang / zhal drug pa dang / zhal brgya par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the one who is to be described in the tantras and other tantras is the three-faced, the four-faced, the five-faced, the six-faced, and the hundred-faced.

original: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs par gnas gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis ae yig gis gsungs pa'i gnas de nyid mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs par gsang ba la sogs pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs par gnas gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis ae yig gis gsungs pa'i gnas de nyid mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs par gsang ba la sogs pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Here, in the Guhyasamāja and so forth, the place that the Blessed One spoke of with the letter e, that very place he spoke of in the Lakṣābhidhānā and so forth with the words “secret” and so forth.

original: brjod par bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' gang zhig wam yig gis gsungs pa de nyid bde chen po'i sgras gsungs so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' gang zhig wam yig gis gsungs pa de nyid bde chen po'i sgras gsungs so //
translated: The one to be described, Vajrasattva, who is spoken of with the letter vaṃ, he is spoken of with the word “great bliss.”

original: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rigs drug gi bdag nyid can mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rig bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rigs drug gi bdag nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rigs bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rigs drug gi bdag nyid can mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rig bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rigs drug gi bdag nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: In this way, by the sequence of speaking, the supreme original buddha, who is the nature of the four families and the nature of the six families, is to be described as the nature of the four knowledges and the nature of the six families.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The Blessed One's teaching, with twenty-three syllables beginning with omniscient, is the great bliss vajra of the mind of enlightenment, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'dir seng ge'i khri'i sgras nam mkha'i khams rnam pa thams cad pa ste seng ge'i khri de la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir seng ge'i khri'i sgras nam mkha'i khams rnam pa thams cad pa ste seng ge'i khri de la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Here, the lion throne is the all-encompassing realm of space, and he abides on that lion throne.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Buddha refers to Vajrasattva.

original: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Yoga refers to the supreme unchanging great meaning.

original: rnal 'byor 'di mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhis yang dag par brjod pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhis yang dag par brjod pa /
translated: This yoga is expressed in fourteen verses in the praise of the great mandala of the vajra realm in the recitation of the true nature.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the Blessed Buddha

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: arises from the perfect Buddha A.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: A is the supreme of all syllables, the sacred syllable of great meaning.

original: srog chen po ni skye ba med //
analyzed: srog chen po ni skye ba med //
translated: The great life is unborn.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: Abandoning verbal expression,🔽it is the supreme cause of all expressions,

original: brjod pa kun @138b kyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: brjod pa kun @138b kyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: illuminating all words.

original: ces pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: And so on, up to:

original: mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
analyzed: mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
translated: The Lord is the great, supreme family,🔽the guru, the supreme great mantra,

original: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
translated: abiding in the way of the Great Vehicle,🔽the supreme way of the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces pa'i mthar thug pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la brjod par bya ba 'di chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par brjod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces pa'i mthar thug pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad la brjod par bya ba 'di chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par brjod do //
translated: Thus, this topic to be expressed in all the kings of tantras is perfectly expressed by the Bhagavān according to the mental capacities of sentient beings of lesser, middling, and great capacities.

original: de bzhin du stong pa ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa yi ge bcu bzhis rigs drug gis bdag nyid brjod par bya ba de nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la bstod pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas yang
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa yi ge bcu bzhis rigs drug gis bdag nyid brjod par bya ba de nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la bstod pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas yang
translated: Likewise, the fourteen syllables “emptiness, wisdom” and so on express the six families and the two verses in the praise of the wisdom of accomplishing the rite of the name mantra🔽

original: dag par bsdus te gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dag par bsdus te gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Likewise, the fourteen syllables “emptiness, wisdom” and so on express the nature of the six families, and this is also summarized in two verses in the Praise to the Wisdom of Accomplishment of the Ritual of the Recitation of the Names of Mañjuśrī:

original: gsang sngags don kun bskyed pa po //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun bskyed pa po //
translated: The generator of all the meanings of mantra,

original: thig le chen po yi ge med //
analyzed: thig le chen po yi ge med //
translated: the great drop, without syllables,

original: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
translated: the great emptiness, with five syllables,

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces so //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces so //
translated: the empty drop, with six syllables.

original: des na ming mtha' yas pa dag gis chos ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bstan pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: des na ming mtha' yas pa dag gis chos ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bstan pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it teaches the Dharma with limitless names, this king of tantras, taught by the words “Thus have I heard,” and so on, is the speech of the tathāgatas.

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The statement beginning with secret and ending with omniscience should not be expressed by Buddhists as not spoken by the Tathagata.

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' la skyon 'dzin na rtsa ba'i ltung ba drug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' la skyon 'dzin na rtsa ba'i ltung ba drug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one finds fault with one's own tenets and the tenets of others, it becomes the sixth root downfall.

original: de'i phyir rgyud gzhan la snga ma dang phyi mar 'brel pa shes nas yon tan dang skyon rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud gzhan la snga ma dang phyi mar 'brel pa shes nas yon tan dang skyon rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, having understood the connection between the former and latter [parts] of another tantra, one should understand the good qualities and faults.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na gdug pa'i slob dpon de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po las phyi rol du gyur pa yul dang dbang po'i nye bar longs spyod pa la chags shing brdzun du smra ba rnams ma mthong ba'i skyon bzung ba las mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na gdug pa'i slob dpon de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po las phyi rol du gyur pa yul dang dbang po'i nye bar longs spyod pa la chags shing brdzun du smra ba rnams ma mthong ba'i skyon bzung ba las mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur
translated: Otherwise, that evil master, who has gone outside the essence of the Tathagata, attached to the enjoyment of objects and sense faculties, and speaks falsely, will go to Avici Hell due to the fault of not seeing [the faults of others].

original: ro // de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa lung dang rigs pa dam pas snga ma dang phyi ma mi 'gal bar thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis @139a * //
analyzed: ro // de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa lung dang rigs pa dam pas snga ma dang phyi ma mi 'gal bar thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis @139a * //
translated: Thus, by the excellent scriptures and reasonings, the former and latter [statements] are not contradictory.🔽

original: yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan to //
