original: dus kyi 'khor lo'i ston pa po //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo'i ston pa po //
translated: to the Teacher of the Wheel of Time.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi ston pa mchog gi thugs rje can rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa sgrib pa thams cad las nges
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi ston pa mchog gi thugs rje can rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa sgrib pa thams cad las nges
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient Buddha Bhagavan, the Teacher of all worldly and transcendent dharmas, the supreme compassionate Teacher of gods, demigods, and humans, who is naturally loving without cause, and is definitely liberated from all obscurations,

original: par grol ba'o //🔽des na @141a * //
analyzed: par grol ba'o // des na @141a * //
translated: is the one who should be pleased.🔽Therefore, Vishnu, Shiva, and so forth,

original: khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: should also please the Teacher, the Omniscient Buddha Bhagavan.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i skad kyis cig car 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do /🔽gang gi phyir lha'i skye ba gcig pu nyi tshe bar skyes pa'i phyir dang legs par sbyar ba gcig pu nyi tshe ba smra ba'i phyir de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad des mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la rang rang gi skad tha dad
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i skad kyis cig car 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do / gang gi phyir lha'i skye ba gcig pu nyi tshe bar skyes pa'i phyir dang legs par sbyar ba gcig pu nyi tshe ba smra ba'i phyir de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad des mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la rang rang gi skad tha dad
translated: There is no one else who simultaneously teaches mundane and supramundane dharmas in infinite languages to sentient beings who are infinite in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm.

original: kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston par byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston par byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: Because they are born in a limited divine birth and speak a limited Sanskrit language, they are not able to teach mundane and supramundane dharmas in various languages to sentient beings with various aspirations.

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir de dag gis legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis bstan pa glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon rabs kyi chos thams cad nyi tshe bar mngon sum du mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir de dag gis legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis bstan pa glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon rabs kyi chos thams cad nyi tshe bar mngon sum du mthong ngo //
translated: In the human world, through their well-formed speech, they directly perceive all the teachings of the Vedas, the philosophical systems, and the Jātakas.

original: rig byed bzhi po rnams kyang ste gang gi phyir bram ze dang rgyal rigs rig byed klog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed bzhi po rnams kyang ste gang gi phyir bram ze dang rgyal rigs rig byed klog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four Vedas are also studied by the brahmins and kṣatriyas because they read the Vedas.

original: 'dir bram ze dang rgyal rigs dag gis rig byed bklag par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir bram ze dang rgyal rigs dag gis rig byed bklag par bya'i /
translated: Here, the brahmins and kṣatriyas should read the Vedas.🔽They should not be read by the vaiśyas, śūdras, and so on.

original: rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa rnams kyis ma yin no zhes dang / de bzhin du glu ngang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs kyi chos rnams bram ze'i kha las bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs te rigs bzhi rnams kyis mnyan par bya'i /
analyzed: rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa rnams kyis ma yin no zhes dang / de bzhin du glu ngang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs kyi chos rnams bram ze'i kha las bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs te rigs bzhi rnams kyis mnyan par bya'i /
translated: Similarly, the teachings of the Vedas, the philosophical systems, and the Jātakas should be heard from the mouth of the brahmins. They should be heard by the brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras, the four castes.

original: rab tu byung ba 'dzin pa med pas na nya pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'dzin pa med pas na nya pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes te /
translated: They should not be heard by the unordained, such as fishermen.

original: chos dgag pa'i tshig 'di'i phyir de dag gis bstan pa'i chos rnams ni nyi tshe ba ste sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dgag pa'i tshig 'di'i phyir de dag gis bstan pa'i chos rnams ni nyi tshe ba ste sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of these words which prohibit the Dharma, the Dharma which they teach is limited and does not benefit all beings.

original: mi'i yul 'dir legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba yin pa'i rgyu gang gis mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la sna tshogs pa'i skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan par bya bar mi nus pa des na mi'i yul 'dir
analyzed: mi'i yul 'dir legs par sbyar ba'i skad nyi tshe ba yin pa'i rgyu gang gis mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la sna tshogs pa'i skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan par bya bar mi nus pa des na mi'i yul 'dir
translated: In this human realm, the language of the Sanskrit is limited. For what reason? It is not possible to teach the mundane and supramundane Dharma in various languages to beings with various inclinations. Therefore,

original: rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa skye gnas dman par skyes pa rnams kyis rig byed bklag pa dang rab tu byung ba dbyig pa 'dzin pa @141b yang mi bya'o zhes rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa dgag pa byas so //
analyzed: rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa skye gnas dman par skyes pa rnams kyis rig byed bklag pa dang rab tu byung ba dbyig pa 'dzin pa @141b yang mi bya'o zhes rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa dgag pa byas so //
translated: in this human realm, it is prohibited for those born in lower castes such as the merchant caste and the servant caste to read the Vedas and go forth as renunciants. Thus, the merchant caste, the servant caste, and so on are prohibited.

original: sgra gcig pu legs par rab tu sbyar bas mtho ris su 'dod pa 'jo'o zhes pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pa rnams kyi bsam pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra gcig pu legs par rab tu sbyar bas mtho ris su 'dod pa 'jo'o zhes pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pa rnams kyi bsam pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought of those who are overcome by false pride is that one attains heaven by the correct use of just one sound.

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gal te dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i mi thams cad kyis rig byed dang glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang rtog ge dang bstan bcos la sogs pa rig par gyur pa de lta na bram ze rnams la su zhig gus par byed par 'gyur te
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gal te dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i mi thams cad kyis rig byed dang glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang rtog ge dang bstan bcos la sogs pa rig par gyur pa de lta na bram ze rnams la su zhig gus par byed par 'gyur te
translated: If all the people of this world, even the low castes, were to know the Vedas, singing, philosophy, logic, and treatises, then who would respect the Brahmins?

original: / rig pa dang chos dang ye shes thun mong bar yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang khyim pa 'khor ba'i longs spyod la chags pa thams cad dang bram ze rnams yon tan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rig pa dang chos dang ye shes thun mong bar yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang khyim pa 'khor ba'i longs spyod la chags pa thams cad dang bram ze rnams yon tan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because knowledge, Dharma, and wisdom are known to be common to all, and because the Brahmins have no special qualities, not even those of householders attached to the enjoyments of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya bar shes nas /
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes nas /
translated: Knowing this,

original: rdzas la chags pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs la sogs pa'i chos rnams legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis glegs bam la bris shing rig byed kyang kha thon gyis bklag par bya'o zhes pa'i nges pa byas pa ni
analyzed: rdzas la chags pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs la sogs pa'i chos rnams legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis glegs bam la bris shing rig byed kyang kha thon gyis bklag par bya'o zhes pa'i nges pa byas pa ni
translated: The evil sages who are attached to material things wrote the Dharma of the Vedas, songs, tenets, and jātakas in books in the language of the Sanskrit grammar that they composed and said that the Vedas should be read aloud.

original: thams cad shes par mi ston pa'i bsam pas byis pa'i skye bo rnams rmongs pa chen po skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes par mi ston pa'i bsam pas byis pa'i skye bo rnams rmongs pa chen po skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: They did this with the intention of not teaching everything and to create great confusion for childish beings.

original: 'dir sngon gyi dus na rig byed dang glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs kyi chos rnams glegs bam la bris par ma gyur pa na sdom brtson rnams kyi kha la gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir sngon gyi dus na rig byed dang glu dang grub pa'i mtha' dang sngon gyi rabs kyi chos rnams glegs bam la bris par ma gyur pa na sdom brtson rnams kyi kha la gnas so //
translated: In the past, when the Dharma of the Vedas, songs, tenets, and jātakas was not written in books, it was kept in the mouths of the ascetics.

original: de nas snyigs ma lnga'i dus kyi dbang gis shes rab dman pa nyid kyi phyir sdom brtson rnams kyis glegs bam la bris so zhes so //
analyzed: de nas snyigs ma lnga'i dus kyi dbang gis shes rab dman pa nyid kyi phyir sdom brtson rnams kyis glegs bam la bris so zhes so //
translated: Then, because of the decline of the five degenerations, because of the decline of intelligence, the ascetics wrote it in books.

original: 'dir khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos nyi tshe ba sems can thams cad la brtse ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dir khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos nyi tshe ba sems can thams cad la brtse ba dang bral ba /
translated: Here, Buddhists should not rejoice in the limited teachings presented by Vishnu, Shiva, and so forth, which are devoid of love for all sentient beings,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ster bar byed pa log pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed pa rigs su smra ba mngon par khengs par byed pa dag la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ster bar byed pa log pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed pa rigs su smra ba mngon par khengs par byed pa dag la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o //
translated: which cause the suffering of cyclic existence, which give rise to false pride, and which are taught in a way that is arrogant and self-aggrandizing.

original: khams gsum po 'dir thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis bstan pa'i chos gang yin pa sdud par byed pa po dag gis sems can sna tshogs pa'i skad kyis glegs bam la bris pa /🔽rig byed la sogs pa 'jig @142a * //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'dir thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis bstan pa'i chos gang yin pa sdud par byed pa po dag gis sems can sna tshogs pa'i skad kyis glegs bam la bris pa / rig byed la sogs pa 'jig @142a * //
translated: The teachings that are presented in the language of omniscience by the omniscient ones in these three realms are compiled by those who are compilers and written down in books in the languages of various sentient beings.

original: rten pa'i don ston par byed pa /
analyzed: rten pa'i don ston par byed pa /
translated: They teach the worldly meaning of the Vedas and so forth.

original: theg pa gsum gyi don ston par byed pa /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi don ston par byed pa /
translated: They teach the meaning of the three vehicles.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa ni sems can thams cad kyis mnyan pa dang brjod pa'i slad du yang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa ni sems can thams cad kyis mnyan pa dang brjod pa'i slad du yang ste /
translated: The teachings on the relative truth of the world and the ultimate truth are also for all beings to listen to and express.

original: de la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ston par byed pa de dag nyan par byed klog par byed /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ston par byed pa de dag nyan par byed klog par byed /
translated: In this regard, beings who are interested in the teachings listen to the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma taught by the Omniscient One, which reveal the meaning of the mundane and the supramundane. They read them, recite them,

original: 'don par byed 'chang bar byed gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston par byed rab tu gnas par byed /
analyzed: 'don par byed 'chang bar byed gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston par byed rab tu gnas par byed /
translated: retain them, teach them extensively and perfectly to others, and establish them.

original: me tog sna tshogs dang / spos sna tshogs dang / dri sna tshogs dang / phye ma sna tshogs dang / gos sna tshogs dang / me long sna tshogs dang / dril bu sna tshogs dang / ba dan sna tshogs dang / rnga yab sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs dang / spos sna tshogs dang / dri sna tshogs dang / phye ma sna tshogs dang / gos sna tshogs dang / me long sna tshogs dang / dril bu sna tshogs dang / ba dan sna tshogs dang / rnga yab sna tshogs dang /
translated: They offer various flowers, various incense, various scents, various powders, various garments, various mirrors, various bells, various banners, various yak-tail fans,

original: gdugs sna tshogs dang / bla re sna tshogs dang / mu tshig gi do shal sna tshogs dang / mar me sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: gdugs sna tshogs dang / bla re sna tshogs dang / mu tshig gi do shal sna tshogs dang / mar me sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis mchod pa byed de /
translated: They make offerings with various parasols, various canopies, various garlands of pearls, various lamps, and various precious ornaments.

original: mchod pa byas nas de dag la yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas de dag la yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: Having made offerings, they pay homage with the five limbs.

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos gzhan la phan par byed pa de dag ni mos pa'i dbang gis gzhan la phan par byed pa'i slad du de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rigs ma yin pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig la yang bsgrubs pa dang bkag pa
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos gzhan la phan par byed pa de dag ni mos pa'i dbang gis gzhan la phan par byed pa'i slad du de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rigs ma yin pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig la yang bsgrubs pa dang bkag pa
translated: Thus, those who benefit others through the Dharma taught by the Omniscient One, by the power of their aspiration, benefit others. For that reason, the Tathagata has not established or prohibited anything for anyone by the power of lineage.

original: med de da lta yang nub par 'gyur to //
analyzed: med de da lta yang nub par 'gyur to //
translated: Even now, they will disappear.

original: re zhig yul gyi khyad par gzhan lta zhog gi de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'phags pa'i yul 'dir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa na sdud par byed pa po dag gis theg pa gsum glegs bam la
analyzed: re zhig yul gyi khyad par gzhan lta zhog gi de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'phags pa'i yul 'dir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa na sdud par byed pa po dag gis theg pa gsum glegs bam la
translated: For the time being, let alone other countries, when the Bhagavat had passed into parinirvana in this noble land where the Tathagata had fully awakened, the compilers wrote the three vehicles on

original: bris te / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pas sde snod gsum ma ga dh'a'i skad kyis bris so //
analyzed: bris te / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pas sde snod gsum ma ga dh'a'i skad kyis bris so //
translated: paper and cloth in the language of Magadha, in the Tathagata's own script, in the three baskets.

original: mdo sde ni si ndhu'i skad kyis so //
analyzed: mdo sde ni si ndhu'i skad kyis so //
translated: The sutras were written in the language of Sindhu.

original: pha rol du phyin pa'i tshul dang sngags kyi tshul ni legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis so //
analyzed: pha rol du phyin pa'i tshul dang sngags kyi tshul ni legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis so //
translated: The Perfection and Mantra systems were written in Sanskrit.

original: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan dag ni legs par sbyar pa'i skad dang tha mal ba'i skad dang zur chag gi skad dang legs par sbyar ba @142b ma yin par ri khrod pa la sogs pa kla klo'i skad kyis te /
analyzed: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan dag ni legs par sbyar pa'i skad dang tha mal ba'i skad dang zur chag gi skad dang legs par sbyar ba @142b ma yin par ri khrod pa la sogs pa kla klo'i skad kyis te /
translated: The tantras and other tantras were written in Sanskrit, common language, Prakrit, and in the languages of barbarians such as the Kiratas and so forth that are not Sanskrit.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos rnams sdud par byed pa po dag gis bris so //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos rnams sdud par byed pa po dag gis bris so //
translated: All of these and more were written down by those who compiled the teachings of the Omniscient One.

original: de bzhin du bod kyi yul du theg pa gsum bod kyi skad gyis bris te /🔽rgya nag tu rgya nag gi skad kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bod kyi yul du theg pa gsum bod kyi skad gyis bris te / rgya nag tu rgya nag gi skad kyis so //
translated: Likewise, in the land of Tibet, the three vehicles were written in the Tibetan language.🔽In China, they were written in the Chinese language.

original: rgya nag chen por rgya nag chen po'i skad kyis so //
analyzed: rgya nag chen por rgya nag chen po'i skad kyis so //
translated: In Greater China, they were written in the language of Greater China.

original: p'a ra si ka'i yul du b'ar  si ka'i skad kyis so //
analyzed: p'a ra si ka'i yul du b'ar  si ka'i skad kyis so //
translated: In the land of Pārasīka, they were written in the language of Pārasīka.

original: chu bo sh'i ta'i byang du tsam pa ka'i yul gyi skad dang / spre'u'i yul gyi skad dang / gser zhes bya ba'i yul gyi skad kyis so //
analyzed: chu bo sh'i ta'i byang du tsam pa ka'i yul gyi skad dang / spre'u'i yul gyi skad dang / gser zhes bya ba'i yul gyi skad kyis so //
translated: To the north of the Śītā River, in the land of Campakā, in the language of the land of monkeys, and in the language of the land called Suvarṇa.

original: de bzhin du chu bo sngon po'i byad du rug ma zhes bya ba'i yul gyi skad dang / su ram ma'i yul gyi skad kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu bo sngon po'i byad du rug ma zhes bya ba'i yul gyi skad dang / su ram ma'i yul gyi skad kyis so //
translated: Likewise, to the south of the Blue River, in the land called Rukma, and in the language of the land of Surāma.

original: de ltar grong bye ba bye ba'i bdag nyid yul dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams su lus dgu bcu rtsa drug gi skad kyis bris so //
analyzed: de ltar grong bye ba bye ba'i bdag nyid yul dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams su lus dgu bcu rtsa drug gi skad kyis bris so //
translated: Thus, in the ninety-six lands with ten million towns, they were written in the languages of the ninety-six bodies.

original: de bzhin du dum bu bcu gnyis dang mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og rnams su sems can sna tshogs kyi skad kyis sdud par byed pa po dag gis theg pa gsum bris te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dum bu bcu gnyis dang mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og rnams su sems can sna tshogs kyi skad kyis sdud par byed pa po dag gis theg pa gsum bris te /
translated: Likewise, in the twelve continents, in the heavens, in the human world, and in the underworld, various beings who are compilers with various languages write the three vehicles.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis theg pa chen po pha rol tu phyin pa dang / theg pa chen po gsang sngags rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis theg pa chen po pha rol tu phyin pa dang / theg pa chen po gsang sngags rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The śrāvakas write the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the pratyekabuddhas write the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the bodhisattvas write the Mahāyāna, which is the perfection vehicle and the mantra vehicle, which is the nature of cause and result.

original: sdud par byed pa po sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sdud par byed pa po sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of taming various beings by various compilers.

original: sdud par byed pa sna tshogs kyis yul sna tshogs kyi skad kyis bris pa'i lung dang rigs pa 'dis rnam par dpyad pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis chos ston pa po yin gyi khyab 'jug dang drag po
analyzed: sdud par byed pa sna tshogs kyis yul sna tshogs kyi skad kyis bris pa'i lung dang rigs pa 'dis rnam par dpyad pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis chos ston pa po yin gyi khyab 'jug dang drag po
translated: When one analyzes with this scripture and reasoning, which is written in the various languages of the various countries of the world, the Bhagavān Buddha is the teacher of the Dharma in the language of the omniscient one, and not Viṣṇu, Śiva,

original: la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: ci ste khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs pa 'ga' zhig yod na de yang bdag cag gis rnam pa thams cad du phyag bya ba dang mchod par bya ba dang bkur bar bya ba yin no
analyzed: ci ste khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs pa 'ga' zhig yod na de yang bdag cag gis rnam pa thams cad du phyag bya ba dang mchod par bya ba dang bkur bar bya ba yin no
translated: If among Viṣṇu, Śiva, and so on, there is someone who is completely endowed with these good qualities, then we should pay homage to him in every way, make offerings to him, and respect him.

original: // mkhas rnams yon tan la gus te //
analyzed: // mkhas rnams yon tan la gus te //
translated: The wise have respect for good qualities,

original: sangs rgyas dbang phyug sogs la min //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dbang phyug sogs la min //
translated: not for the Buddha, Īśvara, and so on.

original: yon tan med la'ang gus pa gang //
analyzed: yon tan med la'ang gus pa gang //
translated: What respect for someone who has no good qualities

original: de blun mi dge'i las las skyes //🔽sems can rnams la @143a * //
analyzed: de blun mi dge'i las las skyes // sems can rnams la @143a * //
translated: arises from the stupidity of nonvirtue.🔽The Dharma that benefits

original: phan pa'i chos //
analyzed: phan pa'i chos //
translated: sentient beings

original: tha mal rnams kyang ston par byed //🔽mkhas pas bdag gi dga' mi dga' sa //
analyzed: tha mal rnams kyang ston par byed // mkhas pas bdag gi dga' mi dga' sa //
translated: Even ordinary people can teach it.

original: sems can rnams la 'tshe ba ston //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe ba ston //
translated: The wise, who know what is pleasing and displeasing to sentient beings,🔽can teach them what is harmful.

original: ma yang srin mo'i 'jig rten na //
analyzed: ma yang srin mo'i 'jig rten na //
translated: Even a mother in a cannibal demon world

original: rang gi bu la bzang bar sems //🔽gang zhig bu la brtse med pa //
analyzed: rang gi bu la bzang bar sems // gang zhig bu la brtse med pa //
translated: feels good about her own child.🔽How much more so for others,

original: de la skye bo gzhan lta ci //
analyzed: de la skye bo gzhan lta ci //
translated: for those who have no love for their own children?

original: mchod sbyin la sogs chos kyi rgyu //🔽gang la pha ma gsod par ni //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs chos kyi rgyu // gang la pha ma gsod par ni //
translated: Sacrifice and so forth are the cause of Dharma.🔽A brahman who is devoted to his own interests

original: rang don lhur len bram zes brjod //
analyzed: rang don lhur len bram zes brjod //
translated: says that killing one’s parents🔽is the cause of Dharma.

original: de la gzhan don ci zhig gtam //
analyzed: de la gzhan don ci zhig gtam //
translated: What could he say about the welfare of others?

original: de'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams la thugs brtse ba can thams cad mkhyen pa skad thams cad kyis chos ston pa po yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams la thugs brtse ba can thams cad mkhyen pa skad thams cad kyis chos ston pa po yin la /
translated: Therefore, the first supreme Buddha, the omniscient Buddha Bhagavān, who has compassion for all sentient beings, who teaches the Dharma in all languages,

original: de bzhin du sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang po ni gsol ba 'debs pa po dang sdud pa po yin par rab tu grags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang po ni gsol ba 'debs pa po dang sdud pa po yin par rab tu grags so //
translated: and likewise, the lord of the tenth stage, Vajrapāṇi, Sucandra, are well known as the supplicant and compiler.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po ston pa po dang gsol ba 'debs
translated: The commentary on the king of all tantras, the Kālacakra Tantra, the Stainless Light, which is a commentary on the root tantra in twelve thousand verses, states that the one who teaches the king of all tantras is the omniscient one.🔽

original: pa po bsgrub pa'i mdor bsdus te bzhi pa'o /🔽// / da ni rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bsdu ba brjod pa rnal 'byor dpal ldan dus 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngags kyi tshul 'di la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa yang dag par brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud dang
analyzed: pa po bsgrub pa'i mdor bsdus te bzhi pa'o / // / da ni rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bsdu ba brjod pa rnal 'byor dpal ldan dus 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngags kyi tshul 'di la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa yang dag par brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud dang
translated: The fourth chapter is a summary of the teacher of the king of tantras and the supplicant, the all-knowing one, and so on, from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the king of tantras, the Wheel of Time, an explanation of the root tantra, the twelve thousand, which is the vajra yoga in summary.

original: rgyud gzhan dag tu don rnam pa gnyis nges par bstan te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag tu don rnam pa gnyis nges par bstan te /
translated: Now, the glorious Wheel of Time, and so on, is the vajra yoga in summary. In this system of mantra, the Bhagavān Buddha taught the meaning in two ways in the tantras and other tantras:

original: gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pas so //
analyzed: gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pas so //
translated: one is by means of the relative truth of the world and the second is by means of the ultimate.

original: de la gang 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis bstan pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la gang don dam pas bstan pa de ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la gang 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis bstan pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la gang don dam pas bstan pa de ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: That which is taught by the conventional of the world is the interpretable meaning; that which is taught by the ultimate is the definitive meaning.

original: don rnam pa gnyis po 'di slob ma rnams kyis bal ma'i man ngag las khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis po 'di slob ma rnams kyis bal ma'i man ngag las khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: These two kinds of meaning are to be understood by the disciples from the instructions of the guru.

original: de bzhin du rgyud dang rgyud gzhan thams cad la brjod par bya ba rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud dang rgyud gzhan thams cad la brjod par bya ba rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin la gnyis pa ni don dam pas so //
translated: Similarly, in all the tantras and other texts, there are two kinds of things to be expressed: one is by means of the conventional of the world, and the other is by means of the ultimate.

original: gang 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin pa de ni kha dog dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang dbyibs kyi @143b mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis yin pa de ni kha dog dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang dbyibs kyi @143b mtshan nyid can no //
translated: That which is by means of the conventional of the world has the character of color, hands, signs, and shape.

original: gang don dam pa'i bden pas yin pa de ni kha dog dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang dbyibs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang don dam pa'i bden pas yin pa de ni kha dog dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang dbyibs dang bral ba'o //
translated: That which is by means of the ultimate truth is free from color, hands, signs, and shape.

original: 'di dag las gang 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis bstan pa de ni phyi dang nang la 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'di dag las gang 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis bstan pa de ni phyi dang nang la 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos /
translated: Of these, whatever is taught by the conventional of the world is a phenomenon that is imagined by one's mind for the sake of accomplishing mundane powers, whether external or internal.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: It bestows the result of mundane powers.

original: gang don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa de ni 'jig rten pa las 'das pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos dang bral ba gzhon nu ma rnams
analyzed: gang don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa de ni 'jig rten pa las 'das pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos dang bral ba gzhon nu ma rnams
translated: Whatever is taught by the ultimate truth is a phenomenon that is free from being imagined by one's mind for the sake of accomplishing the supramundane, the supreme of all aspects, the power of the great seal.

original: kyis / me long la sogs pa la pra phab pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi 'od gsal mngon sum du nam mkha' la snang ba 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste 'bras bu ni 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi
analyzed: kyis / me long la sogs pa la pra phab pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi 'od gsal mngon sum du nam mkha' la snang ba 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste 'bras bu ni 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi
translated: Like the augury in a mirror and so forth by young women, the yogis and yoginis directly perceive the luminosity of their own minds appearing in the sky. It bestows the result of the desired aim. The result is the gnosis of unchanging bliss.

original: sems so sems 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rnal 'byor don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa dus kyi 'khor lo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar rgyud gzhan thams cad du
analyzed: sems so sems 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rnal 'byor don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa dus kyi 'khor lo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar rgyud gzhan thams cad du
translated: These two minds are the same. The vajra yoga of the nature of wisdom and method is the great meaning, the unchanging supreme primordial buddha, the wheel of time, the transcendent conqueror vajrasattva, renowned in all other tantras as

original: rab tu grags so //
analyzed: rab tu grags so //
translated: the one without lineage.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid rgyu'i mtshan nyid pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid rgyu'i mtshan nyid pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
translated: That transcendent conqueror, in the perfection vehicle with its causal characteristics, is called the essential body in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las mdzad pa dang bzhir nges par byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las mdzad pa dang bzhir nges par byams pas gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, Maitreya teaches in the Ornament of Clear Realization that there are four deeds:🔽The essential body, the complete enjoyment body,

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
translated: and likewise the emanation body,

original: chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
translated: the dharma body, and deeds.

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: These are correctly said to be four.

original: ces so // bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sngags kyi tshul la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes gsungs te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ces so // bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sngags kyi tshul la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes gsungs te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa /
translated: The Bhagavān himself has said that the characteristic of the result in the mantra system is coemergent joy and the coemergent body, which is free from apprehended and apprehender, transcends the reality of consciousness, and does not abide in either existence or nirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dus pa dang / lha mo rnams kyi sdom pa yang ye shes kyi sku 'di dang lhan cig ro mnyam pa nyid do zhes pa nges pa'i don @144a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dus pa dang / lha mo rnams kyi sdom pa yang ye shes kyi sku 'di dang lhan cig ro mnyam pa nyid do zhes pa nges pa'i don @144a * //
translated: The assembly of buddhas and the tantra of goddesses are of one taste with this gnosis body.

original: to ; /'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyogs su 'dzin pa thams cad nyams par bya ba'i slad du rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa rtag pa dang chad pa spangs pa /
analyzed: to ; /'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyogs su 'dzin pa thams cad nyams par bya ba'i slad du rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa rtag pa dang chad pa spangs pa /
translated: Here, in order to destroy all the positions of yogins, the vajra yoga is free of caste, free of permanence and annihilation,

original: 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa /
translated: beyond worldly examples,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i blo yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i blo yongs su spangs pa /
translated: and free of the mind of existence and nonexistence.

original: gzhon nu ma'i me long la pra phab pa bzhin rang gi sems kyis ma brtags pa mngon sum du mthong ba /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i me long la pra phab pa bzhin rang gi sems kyis ma brtags pa mngon sum du mthong ba /
translated: Like a mirror divination for a young woman, it is not examined by one’s mind, but is seen directly.

original: yid ches pa'i don can rnam pa thams cad pa /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i don can rnam pa thams cad pa /
translated: It is the meaning of confidence, in all aspects.

original: nam mkha' las byung ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung ba /
translated: It arises from space.

original: kun du bzang po /
analyzed: kun du bzang po /
translated: It is wholly positive.

original: dbang po thams cad pa /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad pa /
translated: It is endowed with all faculties.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gnas pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gnas pa /
translated: It abides as the nature of all sentient beings.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba /
translated: It is coemergent joy.

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe spangs pa 'di'i dper dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig pa nyid 'gyur te chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe spangs pa 'di'i dper dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig pa nyid 'gyur te chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of this, which is free from reasons and examples, is the sameness of things and nonthings, because they are dissimilar.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i dpe bum pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa thams cad kyis med do //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i dpe bum pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa thams cad kyis med do //
translated: For example, because the sky flower is dissimilar to the worldly example of a vase, it is nonexistent in all ways.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha'i me tog dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir bum pa ni dngos po thams cad kyis yod do zhes 'di gnyis phan tshun chos mi mthun pa'i phyir dper 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha'i me tog dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir bum pa ni dngos po thams cad kyis yod do zhes 'di gnyis phan tshun chos mi mthun pa'i phyir dper 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, because the vase is dissimilar to the sky flower, it exists in all ways. Because these two are dissimilar, they are examples.

original: de bzhin du chad pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyir srid pa ni dngos po thams cad kyis yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chad pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyir srid pa ni dngos po thams cad kyis yod do //
translated: Likewise, because of the dissimilarity of existence, existence is not nonexistent through all things.

original: srid pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir chad pa ni med pa thams cad kyis med do //
analyzed: srid pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir chad pa ni med pa thams cad kyis med do //
translated: And because of the dissimilarity of existence, nonexistence is not nonexistent through all nonexistences.

original: chad pa'i sgras ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chad pa'i sgras ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: By the word “nonexistence” is meant nirvana, which is characterized by nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dper bum pa dang nam mkha'i me tog 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid 'gyur te chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dper bum pa dang nam mkha'i me tog 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid 'gyur te chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, because of the dissimilarity of the supramundane example, the pot and the sky-flower would be the same, because of the dissimilarity of their characteristics.

original: bum pa dang nam mkha'i me tog 'di dag 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu gcig pa nyid med de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang nam mkha'i me tog 'di dag 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu gcig pa nyid med de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But these two, the pot and the sky-flower, are not the same even in the mundane superficial reality, because they are mutually contradictory.

original: gang gis gang yod pa de ni med par mi 'gyur zhing gang med pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin las so ;
analyzed: gang gis gang yod pa de ni med par mi 'gyur zhing gang med pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin las so ;
translated: That which exists by some means does not become nonexistent, and that which is nonexistent does not become existent, because of the nature of existence and nonexistence.

original: / gang gis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems su 'gyur ba des med pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gang gis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems su 'gyur ba des med pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By which there would be a mind with the characteristic of existence, by that there would not be a mind with the characteristic of non-existence.

original: gang gis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems su 'gyur ba des yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems su 'gyur ba des yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By which there would be a mind with the characteristic of non-existence, by that there would not be a mind with the characteristic of existence, because of contradiction.

original: 'dir yang stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag @144b nyid kyi gzugs rnam par dag pa'i sems gzhon nu ma'i pra phab pa lta bu ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te rdul phra rab med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag @144b nyid kyi gzugs rnam par dag pa'i sems gzhon nu ma'i pra phab pa lta bu ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te rdul phra rab med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here also, the mind of pure form, which is the nature of emptiness and compassion, is not the characteristic of form, because of the absence of atoms.

original: gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te stong pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te stong pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the characteristic of the formless, because of the existence of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can dang stong pa nyid kun rdzob kyi gzugs can te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can dang stong pa nyid kun rdzob kyi gzugs can te /
translated: Therefore, it is the form of emptiness that is conventional, and it is the conventional form of emptiness.🔽The mind that exists is a non-mind,

original: 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir sems gang yod pa'i sems de ni sems med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir sems gang yod pa'i sems de ni sems med pa /
translated: because it is beyond worldly examples.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid dang bral ba stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid dang bral ba stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is free from the characteristics of eternalism and nihilism, emptiness and compassion inseparable.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas gnyis ka'i sems dag chos mi mthun pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas gnyis ka'i sems dag chos mi mthun pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa /
translated: Since the ultimate truth is the purification of both minds, it is beyond existence and nonexistence,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa zad pa /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa zad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of things and nonthings,

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rigs med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rigs med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bde ba che //

original: phra rab rdul gyi chos nyid 'das //
analyzed: phra rab rdul gyi chos nyid 'das //

original: stong pa'i chos ni rnam par spangs //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos ni rnam par spangs //
translated: the empty phenomena are abandoned,

original: rtag dang chad las rnam par grol //
analyzed: rtag dang chad las rnam par grol //
translated: liberated from permanence and annihilation,

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rigs med pa //
translated: the vajrayoga is nonconceptual.

original: zhes so // de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dag tu yang de bzhin gshegs pas rdo rje'i rnal 'byor phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar byed pa po gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dag tu yang de bzhin gshegs pas rdo rje'i rnal 'byor phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar byed pa po gsungs so //
translated: Thus, and similarly, in other tantras, the Tathāgata is said to be the bestower of the spiritual powers of the great seal of vajra yoga.

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam par dag pa skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam par dag pa skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa /
translated: Vajra yoga is the complete buddhahood in a single moment of the utterly pure,

analyzed: dam pa'i don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur ba lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'di ni /

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa la mi gnas /🔽gzugs kyi srid pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa la mi gnas / gzugs kyi srid pa la mi gnas /
translated: It does not abide in the existence of desire,🔽it does not abide in the existence of form,

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa la mi gnas /

original: 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas /

original: gzugs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas /
translated: it does not abide in the nirvāṇa of form,

original: gzugs med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it does not abide in the nirvāṇa of the formless, because it does not abide in existence and nirvāṇa.

original: gnyis ka la yang mi gnas te phan tshun 'gal ba'i @145a * //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang mi gnas te phan tshun 'gal ba'i @145a * //
translated: It does not abide in both, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: phyir ro ; / srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te grib ma dang nyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te grib ma dang nyi ma bzhin no //
translated: Samsara and nirvana are not the same, like shade and sunlight.

analyzed: dper na me ni gtsub stan la mi gnas /
translated: For example, fire does not reside in the kindling,

translated: nor in the flint,
