analyzed: de nas rdzogs pa'i skad cig de la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: Then, in that very moment, he is fully enlightened, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: 'dir rdzogs pa'i skad cig gang la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i skad cig de nas chos thams cad skye ba med pa gnas pa med pa 'jig pa med pa ste rigs med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir skad cig gang la chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la gnas pa dang 'jig pa med do ;🔽/'dir skad cig gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la 'jig pa dang skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir rdzogs pa'i skad cig gang la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i skad cig de nas chos thams cad skye ba med pa gnas pa med pa 'jig pa med pa ste rigs med pa'i phyir ro // 'dir skad cig gang la chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la gnas pa dang 'jig pa med do ; /'dir skad cig gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la 'jig pa dang skye ba med do //
translated: Here, in the very moment in which the Tathagata is fully enlightened, all dharmas are non-arisen, non-abiding, and non-perishing, because they are without a genus.🔽Here, in the very moment in which dharmas would arise, there is no abiding and no perishing.🔽Here, in the very moment in which dharmas would abide, there is no perishing and no arising.

original: 'dir skad cig gang la chos thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la skye ba dang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir skad cig gang la chos thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de la skye ba dang gnas pa med do //
translated: Here, in the very moment in which dharmas would perish, there is no arising and no abiding.

original: de ltar na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin chos thams cad skad cig skye ba dang skad cig gnas pa dang skad cig 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin chos thams cad skad cig skye ba dang skad cig gnas pa dang skad cig 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in order, all phenomena would not arise in a moment, nor would they endure in a moment, nor would they disintegrate in a moment.

original: cig car yang mi srid de chos thams cad dus gcig tu yod pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i skad cig rnams gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car yang mi srid de chos thams cad dus gcig tu yod pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i skad cig rnams gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it possible for them to occur simultaneously, because for all phenomena that exist at the same time, the moments of arising, enduring, and disintegrating are not the same.

original: ci ste rim pa ji lta bar skye ba'i skad cig las gnas pa'i skad cig dang gnas pa'i skad cig las 'jig pa'i skad cig dang 'jig pa'i skad cig las skye ba'i skad cig 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rim pa ji lta bar skye ba'i skad cig las gnas pa'i skad cig dang gnas pa'i skad cig las 'jig pa'i skad cig dang 'jig pa'i skad cig las skye ba'i skad cig 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if the moment of enduring arises from the moment of arising, and the moment of disintegrating arises from the moment of enduring, and the moment of arising arises from the moment of disintegrating,

original: 'di nyid don dam pa'i rigs pas mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di nyid don dam pa'i rigs pas mi 'thad de /
translated: this is not tenable by the reasoning of ultimate analysis.

original: 'dir skad cig snga ma ma 'gags pa las skad cig gzhan mi 'byung zhing de bzhin du 'gags pa las @145b kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir skad cig snga ma ma 'gags pa las skad cig gzhan mi 'byung zhing de bzhin du 'gags pa las @145b kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, another moment does not arise from a previous moment that has not ceased, nor does it arise from one that has ceased.

original: dper na sa bon ma nyams pa las myu gu mi 'byung zhing nyams pa las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon ma nyams pa las myu gu mi 'byung zhing nyams pa las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout does not arise from a seed that is undamaged, nor does it arise from a seed that is damaged.

original: de ltar na don dam par yod pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skad cig gcig med de gcig dang du ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽'dir skad cig thams cad rnam par sgom pa po skad cig gcig la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes pa gang yin pa de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig sgom pa po dang por
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par yod pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skad cig gcig med de gcig dang du ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro // 'dir skad cig thams cad rnam par sgom pa po skad cig gcig la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes pa gang yin pa de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig sgom pa po dang por
translated: Thus, because there are no things that ultimately exist, there is no moment. Because one and many are mutually exclusive.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Here, the one who meditates on all moments is the one who is fully enlightened in a single moment. That is to say, the one who meditates on the twenty-one thousand and six moments of supreme unchanging bliss is fully enlightened by the moments of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de'i rjes la sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnal 'byor skad cig thams cad med pa gcig dang du ma dang bral ba mchog gi gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnal 'byor skad cig thams cad med pa gcig dang du ma dang bral ba mchog gi gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: After that, the yoga of the buddhas is the one who is free from all moments, one and many, the supreme nonduality.

original: don dam par yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba nyid phyir ro //
translated: because of being free from existence and nonexistence in the ultimate.

original: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i sems yod pa de srid du chos rnams gcig dang du mas rnam par dpyod de skad cig ma'i sems snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i sems yod pa de srid du chos rnams gcig dang du mas rnam par dpyod de skad cig ma'i sems snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as there is a worldly mind, phenomena are analyzed as one or many, because of the appearance of momentary mind.

original: gang gi tshe sems skad cig gis chos dang bral ba de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems skad cig gis chos dang bral ba de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When the mind is free from phenomena through moments, then it is called “essenceless.”

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i phyogs ni bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs med par gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i phyogs ni bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs med par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the position of essencelessness is said by the Transcendent Lord to be a nonposition.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin pa dang / gcig dang gcig ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang / srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin pa dang / gcig dang gcig ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang / srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: A “position” is a thing or a nonthing, an existent or a nonexistent, an is or an is-not, a sameness or a difference, an eternalism or an annihilationism, a life or a nirvana, a cause or an effect, a self or a world, or a real or an unreal.

original: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa dang / sgra dang sgra ma yin pa dang / skad cig dang skad cig ma yin pa dang / chags pa dang chags pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug ma yin pa zhes pa de lta bu la sogs pa rnams ni phyogs te phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa dang / sgra dang sgra ma yin pa dang / skad cig dang skad cig ma yin pa dang / chags pa dang chags pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug ma yin pa zhes pa de lta bu la sogs pa rnams ni phyogs te phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Form and non-form, sound and non-sound, momentary and non-momentary, attachment and non-attachment, anger and non-anger, delusion and non-delusion—all such things are “positions” because they are mutually dependent.

original: phyogs 'di dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'di dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The absence of such positions is the non-abiding nirvana of the buddhas, which is devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: skad cig gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ye shes ni rgyal ba rnams kyis de kho na nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ye shes ni rgyal ba rnams kyis de kho na nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The wisdom that is free from singularity and multiplicity is what the victorious ones have called “suchness.”

original: de nyid sems can rnams @146a * //
analyzed: de nyid sems can rnams @146a * //
translated: This suchness appears to sentient beings

original: kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rnam pa bzhi dang rnam pa bcu drug tu yang so sor snang ste /
analyzed: kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rnam pa bzhi dang rnam pa bcu drug tu yang so sor snang ste /
translated: in four and sixteen aspects, respectively, in accordance with the mental dispositions of individual beings.

original: dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad par gyi dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽de nas sku'i dga' ba dang gsung gi dga' ba dang thugs kyi dga' ba dang ye shes kyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i mchog gi dga' ba dang / gsung gi mchog gi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi mchog gi dga' ba dang /🔽ye shes kyi mchog gi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / gsung gi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad par gyi dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste / de nas sku'i dga' ba dang gsung gi dga' ba dang thugs kyi dga' ba dang ye shes kyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i mchog gi dga' ba dang / gsung gi mchog gi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi mchog gi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi mchog gi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / gsung gi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / de bzhin du sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang /
translated: The four joys are distinguished by the joy, supreme joy, special joy, and innate joy.

original: gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
translated: Then there is the joy of body, the joy of speech, the joy of mind, and the joy of gnosis; likewise, there is the supreme joy of body, the supreme joy of speech, the supreme joy of mind, and the supreme joy of gnosis; likewise, there is the special joy of body, the special joy of speech, the special joy of mind, and the special joy of gnosis; likewise, there is the innate joy of body, the innate joy of speech, the innate joy of mind, and the innate joy of gnosis.

original: de lta bu'i de nyid rnam pa bcu drug gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas rig pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta bu'i de nyid rnam pa bcu drug gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas rig pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the yogin knows suchness in these sixteen aspects,

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: then he knows suchness in its sixteen aspects.

original: de nyid de kho na la lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid de kho na la lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de /
translated: This suchness is called the coemergent body.

original: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku dang ; de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / de'i 'og tu sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku dang ; de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / de'i 'og tu sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: After that, there is the dharmakāya, after that the saṃbhogakāya, and after that the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i gsung dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thugs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin du chos kyi gsung dang / chos kyi thugs dang / chos kyi ye shes dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i gsung dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thugs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin du chos kyi gsung dang / chos kyi thugs dang / chos kyi ye shes dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung dang /
translated: Similarly, there is the coemergent speech, the coemergent mind, the coemergent pristine consciousness, and likewise the dharma speech, the dharma mind, the dharma pristine consciousness, the saṃbhoga speech,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes dang / sprul pa'i gsung dang / sprul pa'i thugs dang / sprul pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes dang / sprul pa'i gsung dang / sprul pa'i thugs dang / sprul pa'i ye shes te /
translated: the saṃbhoga mind, the saṃbhoga pristine consciousness, the nirmāṇa speech, the nirmāṇa mind, and the nirmāṇa pristine consciousness.

original: de ltar de nyid rnam pa bcu drug tu sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar de nyid rnam pa bcu drug tu sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang ste /
translated: Thus, that very [pristine cognition] appears in sixteen aspects through the power of the superior aspirations of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: That very [pristine cognition] is the body of innate presence, purified by the liberation of emptiness.

original: ye shes rdo rje thams cad mkhyen pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje thams cad mkhyen pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the yoga of the pure nature of wisdom and means, the omniscient vajra of pristine cognition.🔽That very [pristine cognition] is the dharmakāya, purified by the liberation of signlessness.

original: de nyid chos kyi @146b sku mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par dag pa thugs rdo rje ye shes sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi @146b sku mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par dag pa thugs rdo rje ye shes sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the yoga of the nature of phenomena, the vajra of mind, the body of pristine cognition, the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: That very [pristine cognition] is the body of perfect rapture, purified by the liberation of aspirationlessness.

original: gsung rdo rje nyin mor byed pa'i sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid sngags kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje nyin mor byed pa'i sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid sngags kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the yoga of mantra, the vajra of speech, the body of the sun, the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de nyid sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de nyid sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: That is the nirmāṇakāya, pure by means of the unconditioned door of liberation.

original: sku rdo rje padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sku rdo rje padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor zhes brjod de /
translated: The vajra body is the nature of wisdom and method, the eyes like the petals of a lotus, called the yoga of shape.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi po 'di sangs rgyas la phyag na rdo rjes zhus so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi po 'di sangs rgyas la phyag na rdo rjes zhus so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi asked the Buddha about this fourfold vajra yoga.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: Pure by means of the door of liberation of emptiness,

original: ye shes rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the vajra of pristine consciousness is the omniscience that is the nature of wisdom and method, the coemergent body, the attainment of omniscience, because of seeing everything.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: Pure by means of the door of liberation of signlessness,

original: thugs rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
translated: the vajra mind is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: chos kyi sku lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni ye shes sku ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni ye shes sku ste /
translated: The Dharma Body, which is the attainment of the knowledge of the path, is the “wisdom body,”

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: because it abides in supreme unchanging bliss.

original: / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: It is purified by the liberation of wishlessness.

original: gsung rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
translated: The Vajra Speech is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lam mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni nyin mor byed pa'i sku ste mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi skad kyis cig car 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lam mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni nyin mor byed pa'i sku ste mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi skad kyis cig car 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ston pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Enjoyment Body, which is the attainment of the knowledge of the path, is the “sun body,” because it is the teacher of the worldly and transcendent Dharma at the same time with infinite languages of infinite sentient beings.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa /
translated: It is purified by the liberation of non-composition.

original: sku rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: sku rdo rje shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid /
translated: The Vajra Body is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: sprul pa'i sku rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan te mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa'i sku dag gis cig car rnam pa thams cad pa'i sku'i bkod pa'i rdzu 'phrul spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa ni padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan te mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa'i sku dag gis cig car rnam pa thams cad pa'i sku'i bkod pa'i rdzu 'phrul spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nirmāṇakāya who has attained the state of omniscience is the eye of the fully blossomed lotus, because with infinite nirmāṇakāyas he simultaneously emanates the magical display of the array of the kāyas in all their aspects.

original: de bzhin du skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni ye shes rdo rje ste don thams cad gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni ye shes rdo rje ste don thams cad gzigs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the one who is fully enlightened in a single instant is the vajra of timeless awareness, who perceives all that is meaningful.

original: @147a * // rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni thugs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: @147a * // rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni thugs rdo rje ste /
translated: The one who is fully enlightened in five aspects is the vajra of enlightened mind,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: which is sublime unchanging bliss.

original: rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni gsung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni gsung rdo rje ste /
translated: The one who is fully enlightened in twenty aspects is the vajra of enlightened speech,

original: bden pa'i don rnam pa bcu gnyis pa sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos ston pa po'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i don rnam pa bcu gnyis pa sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos ston pa po'o //
translated: who teaches the Dharma with the languages of all beings, the twelve aspects of the truth of the noble ones.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sku rdo rje ste /
translated: The one who is fully enlightened through the magical net is the vajra of enlightened form,🔽who is the one who is fully enlightened in all aspects.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba dag gis spros pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba dag gis spros pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body is elaborated by the infinite net of illusions, which are the sixteen aspects of that reality.

original: 'dir sems kyi rdo rje rnam pa bzhi rnam par dag pa ni sku bzhi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir sems kyi rdo rje rnam pa bzhi rnam par dag pa ni sku bzhi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the four kinds of mind-vajra are the characteristics of the four bodies.

original: bzlog par dka' ba'i 'dod chags kyi dri mas kun nas bsgos pa bha ga dang dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhi pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //🔽mun pas zil gyis mnan pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: bzlog par dka' ba'i 'dod chags kyi dri mas kun nas bsgos pa bha ga dang dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhi pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o // mun pas zil gyis mnan pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The mind-vajra, which is the reality of the four, the bhaga and the organ, is the essence-body, which is the nature of the mind, the reality of the mind, which is not an entity, and which is completely suffused with the stain of passion, which is difficult to overcome. It is called the “omniscient one.”

original: ye shes sku zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sku zhes pa'o //
translated: The dharma-body, which is the reality of the mind, the nature of the mind, which is not an entity, and which is the mind of deep sleep, overcome by darkness, is called the “knowledge-body.”

original: srog gis bskyed pa yod pa dang med pa'i rmi lam gyi sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste nyin mor byed pa'i sku zhes pa'o //
analyzed: srog gis bskyed pa yod pa dang med pa'i rmi lam gyi sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste nyin mor byed pa'i sku zhes pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment-body, which is the reality of the mind, the nature of the mind, which is not an entity, and which is the mind of dream, which is produced by the life-force, and which is both existent and non-existent, is called the “body of the sun.”

original: rnam par rtog pa du ma'i dngos po'i 'du shes sad pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa du ma'i dngos po'i 'du shes sad pa'i sems kyi dngos po med pa'i sems ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: The mind that is the absence of the mind of the thing that awakens the perception of the thing of many conceptual thoughts is the Emanation Body.

original: padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa'i spyan zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the eye that is like the open lotus petal.

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor 'di ye shes kyi le'ur rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor 'di ye shes kyi le'ur rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
translated: This vajra yoga is to be described extensively in the chapter on intuition,

original: 'jig rten khams kyi le'u 'dir ni mdor bstan pa tsam zhig bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kyi le'u 'dir ni mdor bstan pa tsam zhig bstan to //
translated: but here in the chapter on world systems it is taught only in brief.🔽Thus, having requested the yoga of the nature of intuition, mind, speech, and body,

original: de ltar ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhus te dpal ldan dus 'khor rgyud kyi rgyal po la'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhus te dpal ldan dus 'khor rgyud kyi rgyal po la'o //
translated: in the glorious Wheel of Time, the king of tantras,

original: ji ltar gyur pa la zhe na /🔽ka phreng ldan pa'i aa 'dus la ste ka phreng ldan pa'i aa 'dus zhes pa ka'i phreng ba ni ka phreng ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa la zhe na / ka phreng ldan pa'i aa 'dus la ste ka phreng ldan pa'i aa 'dus zhes pa ka'i phreng ba ni ka phreng ste /
translated: how is it?🔽In the collection of the a of the garland of kas,🔽the garland of kas is the garland of ks.

original: ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi phreng ba'o //
translated: The garland of ks is the garland of the consonants beginning with k.

original: ka yig gsal byed thams cad kyi gtso bor rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ka yig gsal byed thams cad kyi gtso bor rig par bya ste /
translated: The letter k should be known as the chief of all the consonants.

original: dang por bstan pa'am rdul gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por bstan pa'am rdul gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the first to be taught or because it is the nature of the atom.

original: de bzhin du aa'i 'dus pa ni aa 'dus te dbyangs kyi tshogs pa zhes @147b brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du aa'i 'dus pa ni aa 'dus te dbyangs kyi tshogs pa zhes @147b brjod do //
translated: Similarly, the collection of vowels is called the collection of a's, because it is the collection of a's.

original: 'dir ka'i phreng ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir ka'i phreng ba ni /
translated: Here, the garland of ka is

original: ka kha ga gha nga /
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga /
translated: ka kha ga gha ṅa

original: tsa tsha dza dzha nya /
analyzed: tsa tsha dza dzha nya /
translated: ca cha ja jha ña

original: ta tha da dha na /🔽pa pha ba bha na /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na / pa pha ba bha na /
translated: ta tha da dha na

original: ta tha da dha na /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na /
translated: ta tha da dha na🔽sa sa ha kṣa.

original: sa kpa sha sha  rka zhes pa ni ka'i phreng ba ste gsal byed kyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: sa kpa sha sha  rka zhes pa ni ka'i phreng ba ste gsal byed kyi phreng ba'o //
translated: This is the garland of ka, the garland of consonants.🔽Here, the collection of a's is a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai o au aṃ aḥ ya ra la va śa ṣa sa ha kṣa.

original: 'dir aa'i 'dus pa ni aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'a li l'i ai aa: ae ae aar  a'a ra ao aoo aal  a'a la ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a zhes pa ni aa'i 'dus pa ste dbyangs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir aa'i 'dus pa ni aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'a li l'i ai aa: ae ae aar  a'a ra ao aoo aal  a'a la ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a zhes pa ni aa'i 'dus pa ste dbyangs kyi tshogs so //
translated: This is the collection of a's, the collection of vowels.

original: aa 'dus 'di la ka phreng dang ldan pa'i phyir ka phreng ldan pa ste /
analyzed: aa 'dus 'di la ka phreng dang ldan pa'i phyir ka phreng ldan pa ste /
translated: Because this collection of a's is endowed with the garland of ka, it is endowed with the garland of ka.

original: ka phreng dang ldan pa'i aa 'dus dus kyi 'khor lo'i rjod par byed pa aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa de la dus kyi 'khor lo'i brjod par bya ba rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rgyud kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang po'i sangs rgyas ni zla ba
analyzed: ka phreng dang ldan pa'i aa 'dus dus kyi 'khor lo'i rjod par byed pa aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang po'i sangs rgyas rigs med pa de la dus kyi 'khor lo'i brjod par bya ba rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rgyud kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang po'i sangs rgyas ni zla ba
translated: The primordial buddha is the moon.

original: bzang pos zhus zhes pa chos bstan pa bsdus pa'o ;
analyzed: bzang pos zhus zhes pa chos bstan pa bsdus pa'o ;
translated: The request of Sucandra is the summary of the teaching of the dharma.

original: / da ni dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa bsdus pa brjod pa /
analyzed: / da ni dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa bsdus pa brjod pa /
translated: Now, the purpose and the purpose of the purpose are summarized.

original: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: For the purpose of liberating humans.

original: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don ni dang por re zhig dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don ni dang por re zhig dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos pa ste /
translated: The purpose of liberating humans is the purpose, which is to benefit sentient beings by first entering the maṇḍala and so on.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i gzugs bsgom pa'i stobs dang / byin gyis brlab pa bsgom pa'i stobs dang / dpa' bo'i rim pa dang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i gzugs bsgom pa'i stobs dang / byin gyis brlab pa bsgom pa'i stobs dang / dpa' bo'i rim pa dang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa yang dgos pa'o //
translated: The power of the accumulation of merit and the meditation on the form of the maṇḍala wheel, the power of the meditation on the consecration, and the accomplishment of mundane feats by the stage of the hero and the stage of consecration.

original: de nas gong nas gong du dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de nas gong nas gong du dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste /
translated: Then, the purpose of the purpose is the purpose of the purpose.

original: 'dir nam mkha'i khams la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems dang du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mas phyag rgya chen po rnam pa kun sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgom pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i sgrub thabs dang ; bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gis mi rnams kyi skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de dgos pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha'i khams la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems dang du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mas phyag rgya chen po rnam pa kun sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgom pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i sgrub thabs dang ; bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gis mi rnams kyi skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de dgos pa dang /
translated: Here, the method of accomplishing the supreme unchanging bliss by meditating with the mind free from conceptuality in the space element and with the signs of smoke and so on is the purpose, and the method of accomplishing buddhahood and vajradharahood in this life of humans by means of the accumulations of merit and wisdom is the purpose of the purpose.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the purpose and the purpose of the purpose.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor 'di ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams @148a * //🔽kyis bstan to //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor 'di ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams @148a * // kyis bstan to //
translated: This yoga of the supreme primordial buddha was taught by the buddhas of the past.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams kyis ston to //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyis ston to //
translated: It is taught by the buddhas of the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis kyang ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis kyang ston par 'gyur te /
translated: It will be taught by the buddhas of the future.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshe'i 'khor rnams kyis so //🔽mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshe'i 'khor rnams kyis so // mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du yang dag par bstan to //
translated: It was taught by the retinues of the past, present and future buddhas.

original: ston to // ston par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ston to // ston par 'gyur ro ;
translated: In infinite buddhafields, infinite buddhas have taught, are teaching and will teach infinite sentient beings for the sake of buddhahood.

original: / bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las ston pa po la sogs pa bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te lnga pa'o /
analyzed: / bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las ston pa po la sogs pa bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te lnga pa'o /
translated: The Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra of the Concise King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, in twelve thousand chapters, summarizes the fifth chapter on the teacher and so forth.

original: // / da ni nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pas /
analyzed: // / da ni nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pas /
translated: Now, the request of Sūryaratha, the emanation of the Buddha Mañjuśrī, the human king Yaśas,

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa zla ba bzang pos gsol ba 'debs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa zla ba bzang pos gsol ba 'debs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa /
translated: is stated in two verses, a request to the supreme primordial buddha by the moon-like Su­vikranta­vikrāmiṇ, who was prophesied by the tathāgatas.

original: stong pa ye shes kyang ste thig le mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa sangs rgyas lha dang lha min yang //
analyzed: stong pa ye shes kyang ste thig le mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa sangs rgyas lha dang lha min yang //
translated: The emptiness, the pristine consciousness, and also the supreme bindu, the supreme vajra holder, the gods and demigods,

original: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ste rang bzhin rnams la skyes bu nyi shu lnga pa'i bdag nyid dang // lus la sna tshogs tshad dang srid pa gsum gyi bkod pa lha dang lha min rnams kyi longs spyod dang // dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste 'di dag skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma yang dag bshad du gsol //
analyzed: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ste rang bzhin rnams la skyes bu nyi shu lnga pa'i bdag nyid dang // lus la sna tshogs tshad dang srid pa gsum gyi bkod pa lha dang lha min rnams kyi longs spyod dang // dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste 'di dag skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma yang dag bshad du gsol //
translated: In the maṇḍala, and in the consecration, may you explain these three topics and the best of men.

original: 'dir gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga dang thig le stong pa yi ge drug dang / rigs drug la sogs pa'i don bsdus par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te de'i phyir 'di bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga dang thig le stong pa yi ge drug dang / rigs drug la sogs pa'i don bsdus par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te de'i phyir 'di bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the verse of supplication is spoken by the Blessed One, summarizing the meaning of the five letters of great emptiness, the six letters of the empty bindu, the six families, and so forth. Therefore, I will unravel this.

original: 'dir dang por gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi sbas pa'i don rab tu gsal bar byas na 'chad @148b par 'gyur ba byis pa'i blo can rnams kyis rtogs sla bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir dang por gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas rgyud kyi sbas pa'i don rab tu gsal bar byas na 'chad @148b par 'gyur ba byis pa'i blo can rnams kyis rtogs sla bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if the hidden meaning of the tantra is made clear by the verses of supplication beginning with “emptiness,” etc., then the explanation will be easy for those of childish intellect to understand.

original: des na dang por 'grel bshad las mdor bsdus pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na dang por 'grel bshad las mdor bsdus pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first I will express it in brief according to the commentary.

original: 'dir stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis ma mthong ba dang mthong ba'i dngos po nyi tshe ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul rnams rab tu ston to //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis ma mthong ba dang mthong ba'i dngos po nyi tshe ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul rnams rab tu ston to //
translated: Here, the names beginning with “emptiness” indicate the non-perception and perception of things that are not the domain of limited sense faculties, and the limited sense faculties themselves.

original: med pa dang yod pa dang dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po yin pa thams cad la yang ming sngon du 'gro bas tha snyad byed de nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa dang yod pa dang dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po yin pa thams cad la yang ming sngon du 'gro bas tha snyad byed de nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: All non-existents and existents, non-entities and entities are designated by names preceding them, like “sky-flower,” etc., and “pot,” etc.

original: 'dir nam mkha'i me tog gis ming gis bstan pa'i dngos po med pa ni dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha'i me tog gis ming gis bstan pa'i dngos po med pa ni dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Here, the non-entity indicated by the name “sky-flower” is not an entity.

original: de bzhin du bum pa'i ming gis bstan pa'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te rang gi ming gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa'i ming gis bstan pa'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te rang gi ming gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the entity indicated by the name “pot” is not a characteristic of non-entity, because it is expressed by its own name.

original: de bzhin du rgyud dang rgyud gzhan rnams su bstan bcos kyi ming dang yul gyi ming dang sngags kyi yi ge'i ming dang yi ge re re'i ming rnams kyis dngos po gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas nges par bstan cing sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis kyang
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud dang rgyud gzhan rnams su bstan bcos kyi ming dang yul gyi ming dang sngags kyi yi ge'i ming dang yi ge re re'i ming rnams kyis dngos po gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas nges par bstan cing sdud par byed pa po rnams kyis kyang
translated: In the same way, the entities that are indicated by the names of the treatises, the names of the countries, the names of the mantra syllables, and the names of the individual syllables in the tantras and other tantras, which were definitely taught by the Tathāgatas and compiled by the compilers,

original: bris pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bris pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: all of those should be understood by the yogins through the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: 'dir gcig dang dngos po med pa la yang ming sna tshogs ste de'i phyir dngos po gcig la yang ming sna tshogs kyis bstan pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ming gi rnam par rtog pa mi bya ste bla ma dam pas nye bar bstan pa gser bzhin
analyzed: 'dir gcig dang dngos po med pa la yang ming sna tshogs ste de'i phyir dngos po gcig la yang ming sna tshogs kyis bstan pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ming gi rnam par rtog pa mi bya ste bla ma dam pas nye bar bstan pa gser bzhin
translated: teaching of various names for one entity.

original: yongs su brtags pa ni don la rton pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa ni don la rton pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The examination is based on the reliance on the meaning, like gold.🔽Here, “emptiness” is also gnosis, the supreme bindu, and the supreme

original: 'dir stong pa ye shes kyang ste thig le mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa ye shes kyang ste thig le mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa /
translated: vajra holder.🔽With these fourteen syllables, the names “emptiness” and so on

original: zhes pa'i yi ge bcu bzhi po 'dis stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis khams drug gi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag 'di bsdus pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i yi ge bcu bzhi po 'dis stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis khams drug gi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag 'di bsdus pa 'di lta ste /
translated: include this person of the six elements.

original: ye shes kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang ye shes kyi khams dang nam mkha'i khams dang / yid dang rna ba dang sgra dang chos kyi dbyings dang mchog gi dbang po dang stag dang dri chu 'dzag pa dang khu ba 'pho ba ste /🔽'di @149a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang ye shes kyi khams dang nam mkha'i khams dang / yid dang rna ba dang sgra dang chos kyi dbyings dang mchog gi dbang po dang stag dang dri chu 'dzag pa dang khu ba 'pho ba ste / 'di @149a * //
translated: The aggregate of gnosis, the aggregate of consciousness, the element of gnosis, the element of space, the mind, the ear, sound, the realm of reality, the supreme organ, the tiger, the emission of water, and the emission of semen.

original: rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid dang  ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid la stong pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid dang  ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid la stong pa zhes brjod do //
translated: These are said to be empty in the sense of being free from obscurations, being of one taste, and being completely mixed.

original: thams cad dngos po med pa ni ma yin te rnal 'byor pas rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de nyid ni rgyal ba rnams kyis gzhom du med par gsungs te gzhom du med pa 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni lho dang byang dang shar dang nub kyi dbus su gri gug gi rnam par ri mo tsam brjod du med pa ste stong pa chen po'i yi
analyzed: thams cad dngos po med pa ni ma yin te rnal 'byor pas rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de nyid ni rgyal ba rnams kyis gzhom du med par gsungs te gzhom du med pa 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni lho dang byang dang shar dang nub kyi dbus su gri gug gi rnam par ri mo tsam brjod du med pa ste stong pa chen po'i yi
translated: It is not the case that everything is unreal, because the yogin is self-aware.

original: ge dang po'o //
analyzed: ge dang po'o //
translated: That is said by the victors to be invincible. The sign of the name of this invincible one is the mere line in the form of a curved knife in the center of south, north, east, and west. It is the syllable of great emptiness, inexpressible.

original: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyang zhes pa ste 'dir kyang yig ni sdud pa'i don du bstan te sdud pa'i don go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyang zhes pa ste 'dir kyang yig ni sdud pa'i don du bstan te sdud pa'i don go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, “wisdom” is taught. Here, the word “also” is taught to have the meaning of “collection” because it causes the meaning of “collection” to be understood.

original: ye shes zhes pa'i ming 'dis stong pa gsum pa zhes pa rtogs par bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa'i ming 'dis stong pa gsum pa zhes pa rtogs par bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: This name “wisdom” should be understood to be the third emptiness.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang me'i khams dang mig dang ro dang lag pa dang 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang me'i khams dang mig dang ro dang lag pa dang 'gro ba ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling, the fire element, the eyes, taste, the hands, and going—

original: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang  ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni ye shes te stong pa chen po yi ge gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang  ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni ye shes te stong pa chen po yi ge gsum pa'o //
translated: these are nonobstructiveness, sameness of taste, and complete mixing, which is wisdom, the third emptiness.

original: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i lho ru thig le gnyis te brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i lho ru thig le gnyis te brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Its sign is two bindus to the south of the indestructible drop in the center, which is inexpressible.

original: thig le zhes pa'i ming 'dis stong pa bzhi pa rtogs par bya ste snga ma'i kyang yig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa'i ming 'dis stong pa bzhi pa rtogs par bya ste snga ma'i kyang yig gi phyir ro //
translated: This name “bindu” should be understood to be the fourth emptiness because of the previous “also.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po dang chu'i khams dang / lce dang gzugs dang rkang pa dang len pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po dang chu'i khams dang / lce dang gzugs dang rkang pa dang len pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of perception, the water element, the tongue, form, the feet, and grasping.

original: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni thig le ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni thig le ste /
translated: These are the drop, which is the state of being free from obscuration and the state of being of one taste.

original: stong pa chen po yi ge bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the great emptiness, the four syllables.

original: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus kyi mtshan ma'i byang du thig le gcig ste brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus kyi mtshan ma'i byang du thig le gcig ste brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Its name-sign is a single drop to the north of the central sign, which is inexpressible.

original: mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa /
analyzed: mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa /
translated: Supreme of the supreme, Vajra Holder.

original: zhes pa ni mchog dang mchog dang rdo rje 'dzin pa ni mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa ste gcig zlas dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mchog dang mchog dang rdo rje 'dzin pa ni mchog mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa ste gcig zlas dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme of the supreme, Vajra Holder is supreme of the supreme Vajra Holder, because of the division of the single one.

original: sngar gyi kyang yig las gsum po 'di stong pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi kyang yig las gsum po 'di stong pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the previous also-sign, these three become the name-bearers of emptiness.

original: mchog dang po'i ming gis stong pa gnyis pa zhes brjod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchog dang po'i ming gis stong pa gnyis pa zhes brjod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The supreme of the supreme is called the second emptiness by the name of the first supreme.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rlung gi khams dang / sna dang reg bya dang ngag gi dbang po dang bshang ba 'dzag  pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rlung gi khams dang / sna dang reg bya dang ngag gi dbang po dang bshang ba 'dzag  pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of formation, the wind element, the nose, the tactile, the faculty of speech, and the emission of feces.

original: 'di rnams sgrib pa dang @149b bral ba nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni mchog ste stong pa chen po yi ge gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams sgrib pa dang @149b bral ba nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni mchog ste stong pa chen po yi ge gnyis pa'o //
translated: These are the supreme, that is, the great emptiness of two syllables, which is the absence of obscuration, the state of having the same taste, and the state of having become one taste.

original: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i shar du dbyig pa'i rnam pa ri mo tsam brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i shar du dbyig pa'i rnam pa ri mo tsam brjod du med pa'o //
translated: The sign of its name is the undefeatable middle, with a mere line in the east in the aspect of a stake, which is inexpressible.

original: mchog gnyis pa'i ming gis sdod pa lnga pa zhes brjod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchog gnyis pa'i ming gis sdod pa lnga pa zhes brjod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The second supreme is called the fifth abiding by name, which is as follows:

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang sa'i khams dang lus kyi dbang po dang dri dang bshang lam dang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang sa'i khams dang lus kyi dbang po dang dri dang bshang lam dang brjod pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of form, the earth element, the body faculty, smell, and the anus.

original: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni mchog ste stong pa yi ge lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid dang ro mnyam pa nyid dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ni mchog ste stong pa yi ge lnga pa'o //
translated: These are the supreme, that is, the emptiness of five syllables, which is the absence of obscuration, the state of having the same taste, and the state of having become one taste.

original: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i nub tu thod pa'i rnam pa brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i nub tu thod pa'i rnam pa brjod du med pa'o //
translated: The name-sign of this is the center, the indestructible, in the west, the inexpressible form of a skull.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa lnga ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga pa wam yig rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba chen po rdo rjer brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa lnga ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga pa wam yig rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba chen po rdo rjer brjod do //
translated: Thus, the five syllables that have become one through the process of expression are the great emptiness, the five-syllabled syllable VAM, the great bliss vajra of Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir dbyangs kyi ming can brjod du med pa'i yi ge lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir dbyangs kyi ming can brjod du med pa'i yi ge lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the five inexpressible syllables, which are named vowels, are as follows:

original: dbus su aa yig stong pa gri gug gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su aa yig stong pa gri gug gi rnam pa'o //
translated: In the center, the syllable A, the emptiness, is the form of a flaying knife.

original: lhor ri yig stong pa thig le gnyis so //🔽byang du au yig stong pa thig le gcig go //
analyzed: lhor ri yig stong pa thig le gnyis so // byang du au yig stong pa thig le gcig go //
translated: In the south, the syllable RI, the emptiness, is two bindus.🔽In the north, the syllable U, the emptiness, is one bindu.

original: shar du ai yig stong pa dbyug pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: shar du ai yig stong pa dbyug pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In the east, the syllable I, the emptiness, is the form of a club.

original: nub tu li yig stong pa thod pa rnam pa ste /
analyzed: nub tu li yig stong pa thod pa rnam pa ste /
translated: In the west, the syllable LI, the emptiness, is the form of a skull.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya na ra bsgyur ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya na ra bsgyur ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the transformations of the qualities, the increases, and the yanas.

original: de ltar wam yig ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar wam yig ni stong pa chen po yi ge lnga pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the letter vaṃ is the great emptiness, the five-syllabled one, the nature of non-referential compassion, beyond the reality of subtle particles, similar to the nature of a mirror divination, to be realized by the yogin.

original: 'dir ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams ni 'di lta ste /🔽ye shes kyi phung po aom /
analyzed: 'dir ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams ni 'di lta ste / ye shes kyi phung po aom /
translated: Here, the vowels of the aggregates of wisdom and consciousness, and so on, are as follows:🔽The aggregate of wisdom is oṃ.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po aa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po aa /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is a.

original: ye shes kyi khams aa:/
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams aa:/
translated: The element of wisdom is āḥ.

original: nam mkha'i khams a'a /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams a'a /
translated: The element of space is ā.

original: yid kyi dbang po aam /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po aam /
translated: The faculty of the mind is aṃ.

original: rna ba'i dbang po aa /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po aa /
translated: The faculty of the ear is a.🔽Sound is āḥ.

original: sgra aa:/ chos kyi dbyings a'a /
analyzed: sgra aa:/ chos kyi dbyings a'a /
translated: The realm of phenomena is ā.

original: bha ga ha /
analyzed: bha ga ha /
translated: The bhaga is ha.

original: dri chu 'dzag pa ha:/
analyzed: dri chu 'dzag pa ha:/
translated: The emission of urine is haḥ.

original: mchog gi dbang po ham /
analyzed: mchog gi dbang po ham /
translated: The supreme faculty is haṃ.

original: khu ba 'pho ba h'a /🔽'di dag ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ste gri gug gi rnam pa'i ming @150a * //
analyzed: khu ba 'pho ba h'a / 'di dag ni dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ste gri gug gi rnam pa'i ming @150a * //
translated: The emission of semen is ha.

original: gi mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gi mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These are the central ones, free from the indestructible obscurations, to be realized by the sign of the name in the form of a flaying knife.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ai /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ai /
translated: The aggregate of formation is ī.

original: rlung gi khams a'i /
analyzed: rlung gi khams a'i /
translated: The wind element is ai.

original: sna'i dbang po ae /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po ae /
translated: The nose sense faculty is e.

original: reg bya aee /
analyzed: reg bya aee /
translated: Tactile objects are ai.

original: ngag gi dbang po ya /
analyzed: ngag gi dbang po ya /
translated: The speech sense faculty is ya.

original: bshang ba 'dzag pa y'a /
analyzed: bshang ba 'dzag pa y'a /
translated: The emission of feces is ya.

original: 'di dag sgrib pa dang bral ba shar du dbyug pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag sgrib pa dang bral ba shar du dbyug pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These are to be realized as the sign of a club in the east, free of obscurations.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ri /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ri /
translated: The aggregate of sensation is ri.

original: me'i khams r'i /
analyzed: me'i khams r'i /
translated: The fire element is ri.

original: mig gi dbang po aar /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po aar /
translated: The eye sense faculty is ar.🔽Flavors are āri.

original: ro a'ar / lag pa'i dbang po ra /
analyzed: ro a'ar / lag pa'i dbang po ra /
translated: The hand sense faculty is ra.

original: 'gro ba r'a /
analyzed: 'gro ba r'a /
translated: Going is ra.

original: 'di dag sgrib pa dang bral ba lhor thig le gnyis kyi mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag sgrib pa dang bral ba lhor thig le gnyis kyi mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These are to be realized as the sign of two bindus in the south, free of obscurations.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po au /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po au /
translated: The aggregate of discernment is o.

original: chu'i khams a'u /🔽lce'u dbang po ao /
analyzed: chu'i khams a'u / lce'u dbang po ao /
translated: The water element is au.🔽The tongue sense faculty is aṃ.

original: yul gzugs aoo /
analyzed: yul gzugs aoo /

analyzed: lus kyi dbang po aal /

analyzed: yul dri a'al /

analyzed: 'di dag sgrib pa dang bral ba nub tu thod pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan mas rtogs par bya'o //

original: 'di dag ni sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas tha dad pa dbyangs dang yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya na ra  bsgyur ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas tha dad pa dbyangs dang yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya na ra  bsgyur ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These are the modifications of the vowels and consonants, which are differentiated by the division into thirty-six.

original: gang du phung po rnams sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas tha dad par gyur pa der phung po'i gnas su ro drug gzung par bya ste /
analyzed: gang du phung po rnams sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas tha dad par gyur pa der phung po'i gnas su ro drug gzung par bya ste /
translated: Where the aggregates are differentiated by the division into thirty-six, there, in the place of the aggregates, the six tastes are to be grasped.

original: sgyur ba dang bska ba dang kha ba dang tsha ba dang mngar ba dang  lan tshun rnams so //
analyzed: sgyur ba dang bska ba dang kha ba dang tsha ba dang mngar ba dang  lan tshun rnams so //
translated: They are sour, astringent, bitter, pungent, sweet, and salty.

analyzed: aam aa ai ri au li zhes pa ro drug ste lhag ma ni brjod pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The six tastes are a, a, i, i, u, and u. The rest is the collection of expressions.

original: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid de nyid rgyal ba rnams kyis rdo rjer brjod de de 'dzin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid de nyid rgyal ba rnams kyis rdo rjer brjod de de 'dzin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The five-syllabled great emptiness, which is of the nature of thirty-six, is called the vajra by the victors, and because he holds that, he is the vajra-holder.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni ae yig chos 'byung rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni ae yig chos 'byung rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs so //
translated: The empty bindu of six syllables is the form of emptiness of the all-aspected phenomena source, the letter E.

original: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang nam mkha'i khams dang rna ba dang chos kyi dbyings dang bha ga dang khu ba 'pho ba ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang nam mkha'i khams dang rna ba dang chos kyi dbyings dang bha ga dang khu ba 'pho ba ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: That is, the aggregate of consciousness, the space element, the ear, the dharmadhātu, the bhaga, and the emission of semen are the emptiness of all aspects free from obscuration.

original: dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i steng du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ka sde'i bdag nyid ka yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa dang po'o //
analyzed: dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i steng du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ka sde'i bdag nyid ka yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa dang po'o //

original: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rlung gi khams dang sna dang reg bya dang dgu  dang bshang ba 'dzag pa ste 'di rnams sgrib @150b pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rlung gi khams dang sna dang reg bya dang dgu  dang bshang ba 'dzag pa ste 'di rnams sgrib @150b pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of formation, the wind element, the nose, tactile objects, the ninth, and the emission of feces are the emptiness of all aspects free from obscuration.

original: shar gyi mtshan ma'i shar du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma tsa sde'i bdag nyid tsa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi mtshan ma'i shar du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma tsa sde'i bdag nyid tsa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: To the east of the eastern sign, the sign of the name of this [letter] is the lord of the ca class, the letter ca, which is inexpressible, that is, the second empty drop.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang me'i khams dang mig dang ro dang lag pa dang 'gro ba ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang me'i khams dang mig dang ro dang lag pa dang 'gro ba ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of feeling, the fire element, the eye, taste, the hand, and going are free from obscuration, the emptiness of all aspects.

original: lho'i mtshan ma'i lhor 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ta sde'i bdag nyid ta yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lho'i mtshan ma'i lhor 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ta sde'i bdag nyid ta yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa gsum pa'o //
translated: To the south of the southern sign, the sign of the name of this [letter] is the lord of the ta class, the letter ta, which is inexpressible, that is, the third empty drop.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po dang chu'i khams dang lce dang gzugs dang rkang pa'i dbang po dang len pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po dang chu'i khams dang lce dang gzugs dang rkang pa'i dbang po dang len pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of discrimination, the water element, the tongue, form, the foot sense faculty, and grasping are free from obscuration, the emptiness of all aspects.

original: byang gi mtshan ma'i byang du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma pa sde'i bdag nyid pa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi mtshan ma'i byang du 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma pa sde'i bdag nyid pa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: To the north of the northern sign, the sign of the name of this [letter] is the syllable ta, which is the nature of the ta class, and the inexpressible a, which is the fourth empty sphere.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang sa'i khams dang lus kyi dbang po dang dri dang bshang lam dang brjod pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang sa'i khams dang lus kyi dbang po dang dri dang bshang lam dang brjod pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of form, the earth element, the body faculty, smell, the anus, and speech are the emptiness of all aspects free from obscuration.

original: nub kyi mtshan ma'i nub tu 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ta sde'i bdag nyid ta yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi mtshan ma'i nub tu 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma ta sde'i bdag nyid ta yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa lnga pa'o //
translated: To the west of the western sign, the sign of the name of this [letter] is the syllable ta, which is the nature of the ta class, and the inexpressible a, which is the fifth empty sphere.

original: ye shes kyi phung po dang ye shes kyi khams dang yid dang sgra dang mchog gi dbang po dang dri chu 'dzag pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phung po dang ye shes kyi khams dang yid dang sgra dang mchog gi dbang po dang dri chu 'dzag pa ste 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom, the wisdom element, the mind, sound, the supreme faculty, and the emission of urine are the emptiness of all aspects free from obscuration.

original: dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i 'og tu 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma sa sde'i bdag nyid sa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: dbus ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i 'og tu 'di'i ming gi mtshan ma sa sde'i bdag nyid sa yig gsal byed brjod du med pa ste thig le stong pa drug pa'o //
translated: Below the indestructible drop in the center, the sign of the name of this [letter] is the syllable sa, the nature of the earth section, the inexpressible consonant, the empty bindu.

original: de ltar na thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni chos 'byung rdo rje 'dzin pa ae yig ste stong pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de ltar na thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni chos 'byung rdo rje 'dzin pa ae yig ste stong pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Thus, the six empty bindus are the source of phenomena, the vajra holder, the syllable e, emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects, the nature of a mirror divination.

translated: Here, the consonants of the aggregates, constituents, and so on are
