analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed 'di dag gi yang thung ngu dang ring po'i dbye bas phung po dang / khams la sogs pa'i dbye ba shes par bya'o //
translated: The short and long vowels of these consonants and vowels should be understood as the divisions of the aggregates, constituents, and so on.

original: lus kyi @151a * //
analyzed: lus kyi @151a * //
translated: The body

original: dbye bas phung po dang dbang po ni dbyangs dang gsal byed thung ngu'i chos rnams yin la khams dang yul ni dbyangs dang gsal byed ring po'i chos rnams so //🔽ro drug dang khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i dbye bas khams sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba dang / phung po drug dbang po drug gi dbye bas phung po sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbye bas phung po dang dbang po ni dbyangs dang gsal byed thung ngu'i chos rnams yin la khams dang yul ni dbyangs dang gsal byed ring po'i chos rnams so // ro drug dang khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i dbye bas khams sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba dang / phung po drug dbang po drug gi dbye bas phung po sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The aggregates and faculties are the phenomena of short vowels and consonants, and the elements and objects are the phenomena of long vowels and consonants.🔽The elements are divided into thirty-six by the six tastes and the transformations of the elements, and the aggregates are divided into thirty-six by the six aggregates and the six faculties.

original: ro drug dang khams drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i yul  drug ni ro drug dang khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ro drug dang khams drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i yul  drug ni ro drug dang khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The six tastes, the six elements, the six faculties, the six objects, the six action faculties, and the six objects of the action faculties are the six tastes and the transformations of the elements.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug dang / de bzhin du 'du byed drug dang tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes drug dang gzugs kyi phung po drug dang / ye shes kyi phung po drug ni phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug dang / de bzhin du 'du byed drug dang tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes drug dang gzugs kyi phung po drug dang / ye shes kyi phung po drug ni phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses beginning with the auditory consciousness, likewise the six volitions, the six feelings, the six conceptions, the six aggregates of form, and the six aggregates of pristine awareness are the transformations of the aggregates.

original: 'chad par 'gyur bar rgya cher brjod par bya ste le'u dang po 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa tsam zhig nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur bar rgya cher brjod par bya ste le'u dang po 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa tsam zhig nye bar bstan to //
translated: This will be explained extensively below. Here in the first chapter, only a brief indication is given.

original: 'dir stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs kyi tshogs te khu ba dang zla ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs kyi tshogs te khu ba dang zla ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, the five letters of great emptiness are the collection of vowels, which are called semen and moon.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed kyi tshogs te rdul dang nyi ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed kyi tshogs te rdul dang nyi ma zhes brjod do //
translated: The six letters of the empty bindu are the collection of consonants, which are called ovum and sun.

original: 'dir khu ba dang zla ba ni wam yig ste rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dir khu ba dang zla ba ni wam yig ste rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, semen and moon are the letter vaṃ, which is the vajra.

original: rdul dang nyi ma ni ae yig ste padma 'o //
analyzed: rdul dang nyi ma ni ae yig ste padma 'o //
translated: Ovum and sun are the letter e, which is the lotus.

original: rdo rje dang padma 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje ni mchog gi bde ba dang ye shes dang khu ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje ni mchog gi bde ba dang ye shes dang khu ba'o //
translated: These two, vajra and lotus, are one, Vajrasattva, the supreme bliss, the intuition, the seminal essence.

original: sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad pa dang shes rab kyi gzugs dang shes bya dang nyi ma dang ye shes dang rnam par shes pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bral ba dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa dang / de nyid dang 'gro ba'i don byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad pa dang shes rab kyi gzugs dang shes bya dang nyi ma dang ye shes dang rnam par shes pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bral ba dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa dang / de nyid dang 'gro ba'i don byed pa po yin no //
translated: The hero is consecrated by the form of wisdom, the object of knowledge, the sun, intuition, and consciousness, is free from obscuration, is of one taste with the one, and is the agent of the benefit of the world.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes gcig tu sbyor ba 'di nyid zhal bzhi'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes gcig tu sbyor ba 'di nyid zhal bzhi'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: This very union of the body, speech, mind, and intuition is the cause of the four faces.

original: ye shes ni nub kyi zhal ser po'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni nub kyi zhal ser po'o //
translated: Intuition is the yellow face in the west.

original: rnam par shes pa ni shar gyi zhal nag po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni shar gyi zhal nag po'o //
translated: Consciousness is the black face in the east.

original: zla ba dang sku ni byang gi zhal dkar po'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang sku ni byang gi zhal dkar po'o //
translated: The moon and the body are the white face in the north.

original: nyi ma dang gsung ni lho'i zhal dmar po'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang gsung ni lho'i zhal dmar po'o //
translated: The sun and the speech are the red face in the south.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma 'di dag ni gtso bo dang dpal pa'i dbye bas khams drug drug tu rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma 'di dag ni gtso bo dang dpal pa'i dbye bas khams drug drug tu rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The moon and sun should be understood as the six elements, divided into the principal and the glorious.

original: de dag kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang ro chen po'i cha shas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang ro chen po'i cha shas so //
translated: They are the parts of earth, water, fire, wind, taste, and great taste.

original: 'di @151b rnams la khu ba las byung ba gsum dang / byung ba ma yin pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di @151b rnams la khu ba las byung ba gsum dang / byung ba ma yin pa gsum ste /
translated: Among these, there are three that arise from semen and three that do not arise from semen.

original: chu'i khams dang rlung gi khams dang ro'i khams te /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang rlung gi khams dang ro'i khams te /
translated: The water element, the wind element, and the taste element.

original: khams 'di dag ni khu ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams 'di dag ni khu ba las byung ba'o //
translated: These elements arise from semen.

original: ro'i khams ni nam mkha'i khams kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: ro'i khams ni nam mkha'i khams kyi ming ngo //
translated: The taste element is a synonym for the space element.

original: rdul las byung ba gsum dang byung ba ma yin par gsum ste /
analyzed: rdul las byung ba gsum dang byung ba ma yin par gsum ste /
translated: There are three that arise from ovum and three that do not arise from ovum.

original: sa'i khams dang me'i khams dang ro chen po'i khams te /
analyzed: sa'i khams dang me'i khams dang ro chen po'i khams te /
translated: The earth element, the fire element, and the great taste element.

original: khams 'di dag ni rdul las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams 'di dag ni rdul las byung ba'o //
translated: These elements arise from ovum.

original: 'dir ro chen po ni ye shes kyi khams kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ro chen po ni ye shes kyi khams kyi ming ngo //
translated: Here, the great taste element is a synonym for the wisdom element.

original: khams lhag ma dag ni khu ba dang rdul las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams lhag ma dag ni khu ba dang rdul las byung ba'o //
translated: The remaining elements arise from both semen and ovum.

original: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma dag las byung ba'i khams gsum po rnams ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma dag las byung ba'i khams gsum po rnams ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the three constituents that arise from the moon and sun become, respectively, the body, speech, and mind of those born from a womb.

original: zla ba'i khams rnams thabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang / nyi ma'i khams rnams shes rab kyi lus dang ngag dang sems te khu ba dang rdul las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i khams rnams thabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang / nyi ma'i khams rnams shes rab kyi lus dang ngag dang sems te khu ba dang rdul las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The constituents of the moon are the body, speech, and mind of method, and the constituents of the sun are the body, speech, and mind of wisdom, because they are the cause that arises from semen and blood.

original: khams 'di dag ni dbang po drug la sogs pa rnams kyi rigs drug go //
analyzed: khams 'di dag ni dbang po drug la sogs pa rnams kyi rigs drug go //
translated: These constituents are the six types of the six sense powers and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs ni ngo bo nyid kyi rigs dang lhan cig rigs bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs ni ngo bo nyid kyi rigs dang lhan cig rigs bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the types of body, speech, and mind, together with the natural type, become four types.

original: sku gsum sku bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku gsum sku bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The three bodies become four bodies.

original: gnas skabs gsum gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The three states become four states.

original: de bzhin du khams lnga'i rigs ni ye shes kyi khams dang lhan cig rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams lnga'i rigs ni ye shes kyi khams dang lhan cig rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the five constituents become six types together with the constituent of gnosis.

original: de bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi phung po lnga'i rigs ni ye shes kyi phung po dang lhan cig rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi phung po lnga'i rigs ni ye shes kyi phung po dang lhan cig rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the five aggregates of those born from a womb become six families together with the aggregate of gnosis.

original: bu mo la lo bcu gnyis dang / skyes pa la lo bcu drug gis te /
analyzed: bu mo la lo bcu gnyis dang / skyes pa la lo bcu drug gis te /
translated: For a girl, it is from the age of twelve, and for a man, from the age of sixteen.

original: bu mo la rdul gyi dus ji srid par rigs gsum dang rigs lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bu mo la rdul gyi dus ji srid par rigs gsum dang rigs lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: For a girl, for as long as there is the time of menstruation, it should be known as the three families and the five families.

original: skyes pa la khu ba 'pho pa'i dus ji srid par rigs gsum dang rigs lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la khu ba 'pho pa'i dus ji srid par rigs gsum dang rigs lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: For a man, for as long as there is the time of emission of semen, it should be known as the three families and the five families.

original: ye shes kyi khams byung ba'i dus nas 'chi ba'i bar du gnyis ka la rigs bzhi dang rigs drug go //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams byung ba'i dus nas 'chi ba'i bar du gnyis ka la rigs bzhi dang rigs drug go //
translated: From the time of the arising of the element of gnosis until death, for both, it is the four families and the six families.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavān has said in the Root Tantra:

original: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
analyzed: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
translated: The three families and the five families,

original: rang bzhin gcig dang rigs brgya'o //🔽zhes so // da ni rigs kyi rigs can brjod pa sangs rgyas @152a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig dang rigs brgya'o // zhes so // da ni rigs kyi rigs can brjod pa sangs rgyas @152a * //
translated: The single nature and the hundred families.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to describe the families of the family-possessor, he says “buddha” and so on.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas ni ye shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po drug go //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas ni ye shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po drug go //
translated: Here, the Buddha is the six aggregates, such as intuition, consciousness, and so on.

original: lha dang lha min yang zhes pa'i yang yig gis byang chub sems dpa' yid kyi dbang po la sogs pa drug dang de bzhin du khams drug dang yul drug dang / de bzhin du khro bo drug las kyi dbang po drug dang / khro bo'i lha mo drug las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug go //
analyzed: lha dang lha min yang zhes pa'i yang yig gis byang chub sems dpa' yid kyi dbang po la sogs pa drug dang de bzhin du khams drug dang yul drug dang / de bzhin du khro bo drug las kyi dbang po drug dang / khro bo'i lha mo drug las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug go //
translated: The word also in gods and demigods includes the six, such as the mind faculty, the bodhisattvas, and likewise the six elements, the six objects, and likewise the six wrathful ones, the six action faculties, and the six wrathful goddesses, the six actions of the action faculties.

original: lha ni lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis la 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams te /
analyzed: lha ni lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis la 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams te /
translated: The gods are the twelve joints of the arms and legs, which will be explained.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: Likewise, there are eight yoginis, such as Caurisi.

original: lha min ni klu'i rgyal po rnams dang lha mo khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha min ni klu'i rgyal po rnams dang lha mo khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The demigods are the naga kings and the goddesses such as SvanamukhI.

original: da ni mu stegs pa rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rang bzhin dang skyes bu brjod do //
analyzed: da ni mu stegs pa rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rang bzhin dang skyes bu brjod do //
translated: Now, in order to engage the tirthikas, the nature and the person are described.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa /
translated: In the same way, the Lord has said in other scriptures:

original: sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
translated: The Great Illusion, the Great Fury,

original: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo //
analyzed: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo //
translated: The one who causes emergence and withdrawal,

original: rang nyid byed po rang 'phrog po //
analyzed: rang nyid byed po rang 'phrog po //
translated: The self-creator, the self-seizer,

original: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo //
analyzed: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo //
translated: The self-king, the self-lord.

original: zhes pa brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa brdzun pa ste /
translated: This is false.

original: don dam par byed pa po dang 'phrog pa po med do //
analyzed: don dam par byed pa po dang 'phrog pa po med do //
translated: Ultimately, there is no creator or seizer.

original: mu stegs byed rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa gzhan yang ngo //
translated: Other things imagined by the tīrthikas, such as intrinsic nature and puruṣa, are also like that.

original: 'dir mu stegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid dang skyes bu nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid dang skyes bu nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: Here, the tīrthikas imagine the twenty-four intrinsic natures and the twenty-five principles.

original: de la rtsa ba'i rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the fundamental intrinsic nature is not transformed.

original: sems can rnams kyi bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: The space element is the creator of the fourth state of sentient beings.

original: chen po la sogs pa bdun ni rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang yid dang blo dang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa bdun ni rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang yid dang blo dang nga rgyal lo //
translated: The seven, beginning with the Great One, are both the nature and the modifications. They are earth, water, fire, air, mind, intellect, and ego.

original: rnam pa bcu drug ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The sixteen are modifications.

original: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang mchog gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang mchog gi dbang po ste /
translated: The five sense organs, the five objects, the five action organs, and the supreme organ.

original: rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus there are twenty-four, the nature and the modifications.

original: 'dir skyes bu ni khyab byed nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin yang ma yin rnam par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir skyes bu ni khyab byed nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin yang ma yin rnam par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: Here, the person is neither the nature nor the modifications, because it is the pervader. It is free from intrinsic reality.

original: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid grub ste /
analyzed: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid grub ste /
translated: The twenty-five principles are also established in the external world and in the body.

original: phyi rol du khams lnga dang sgra gcan dang nyi ma dang zla ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgyad @152b do ;
analyzed: phyi rol du khams lnga dang sgra gcan dang nyi ma dang zla ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgyad @152b do ;
translated: In the external world, the eight are the five elements, Rāhu, the sun, and the moon.

original: / bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga ni dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang / sa la sogs pa rnams kyi ro drug ni rnam par 'gyur ba bcu drug ste /
analyzed: / bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga ni dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang / sa la sogs pa rnams kyi ro drug ni rnam par 'gyur ba bcu drug ste /
translated: The six tastes of earth, etc., are the sixteen transformations.

original: kha cig ni dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang 'tsho ba'i lus drug ces so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang 'tsho ba'i lus drug ces so //
translated: Some say that the six tastes are the six life-breaths in the body, beginning with the sense faculties.

original: de bzhin du lus la sna tshogs tshad ni nang gi le'ur brjod par bya'o //🔽srid pa gsum gyi bkod pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la sna tshogs tshad ni nang gi le'ur brjod par bya'o // srid pa gsum gyi bkod pa zhes pa la /
translated: In the same way, the various measures in the body should be explained in the chapter on the inner.

original: 'dir phyi rol du srid pa gsum ni 'jig rten gyi khams yin la nang du ni mi'i lus kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du srid pa gsum ni 'jig rten gyi khams yin la nang du ni mi'i lus kyi khams so //
translated: The arrangement of the three worlds, here the three worlds externally are the world systems, and internally they are the elements of the human body.

original: de'i bkod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bshad du gsol zhes pa bya ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bkod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bshad du gsol zhes pa bya ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The arrangement of that is explained by the sequence that will be explained.

original: lha dang lha min rnams kyi longs spyod dang zhes pa ni 'dir lha rnams nyin mo longs spyod cing lha ma yin rnams mtshan mo longs spyod de de bzhin du byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha min rnams kyi longs spyod dang zhes pa ni 'dir lha rnams nyin mo longs spyod cing lha ma yin rnams mtshan mo longs spyod de de bzhin du byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of gods and demigods, here the gods enjoy during the day and the demigods enjoy at night, and in the same way there is progress to the north and progress to the south.

original: dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste skabs gsum pa dang mi'i bla mas 'di dag yang dag bshad du gsol zhes pa la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste skabs gsum pa dang mi'i bla mas 'di dag yang dag bshad du gsol zhes pa la /
translated: The mandala and the initiation, these two, are explained in the third chapter, and the human guru should explain these.

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi bden pas tshon dang thig gdab pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor dang / don dam pa'i dben pas nam mkha'i khams la thig gdab pa dang bral zhing /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi bden pas tshon dang thig gdab pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor dang / don dam pa'i dben pas nam mkha'i khams la thig gdab pa dang bral zhing /
translated: Here, the mandala of colored powder is drawn with the colors and lines of worldly truth, and the space element is free from the lines drawn in ultimate isolation.

original: tshon dgye ba dang bral ba kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi gzugs kyi lha rnam par rtog pas bsgoms pa'i sems dang bral ba /
analyzed: tshon dgye ba dang bral ba kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi gzugs kyi lha rnam par rtog pas bsgoms pa'i sems dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from the meditation of the mind that conceives of the deities of color, hands, and form.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa me long gi pra phab pa lta bu bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa me long gi pra phab pa lta bu bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: It is explained to be all-aspects, like a mirror divination.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dbang ni chu dang cod pan dang dar dpyangs dang rdo rje dril bu dang brtul zhugs chen po dang ming dang rjes su gnang ba ste bdun no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dbang ni chu dang cod pan dang dar dpyangs dang rdo rje dril bu dang brtul zhugs chen po dang ming dang rjes su gnang ba ste bdun no //
translated: Similarly, the worldly initiations are the seven: water, crown, ribbon, vajra and bell, great vow, name, and permission.

original: de bzhin du gong ma ni bum pa dang gsang pa dang ye shes rab ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gong ma ni bum pa dang gsang pa dang ye shes rab ye shes so //
translated: Likewise, the higher ones are the vase, secret, and pristine awareness through wisdom initiations.🔽The eleventh, supramundane initiation, is the fourth.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bcu gcig pa ni bzhi pa ste thams cad yang dag par bshad du gsol lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bcu gcig pa ni bzhi pa ste thams cad yang dag par bshad du gsol lo //
translated: Please explain all of them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rdo rje slob dpon rdzas la brkam pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rdo rje slob dpon rdzas la brkam pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the future, in this holy land of India, there will appear some vajra masters who are greedy for material things.🔽Having gone to the homes of the rich who are arrogant because of their wealth, they will sell the Dharma for the sake of material things.

original: phyug po rdzas kyis mngon par khengs pa rnams kyi khyim du song nas rdzas kyi don du chos 'tshang bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / rdzas la chags pas skal pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang ster bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: phyug po rdzas kyis mngon par khengs pa rnams kyi khyim du song nas rdzas kyi don du chos 'tshang bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / rdzas la chags pas skal pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang ster bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Because of their attachment to material things, they will bestow the supramundane initiations on those who are not worthy recipients.

original: @153a * // dang po rgyal po la sogs pa'i mngag gzhug pa phyi nas bla mar 'gyur ba dang / rdzas kyis dman pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su btang zhing sems can skal pa dang ldan par gyur pa gzhan rnams la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang mi ster bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: @153a * // dang po rgyal po la sogs pa'i mngag gzhug pa phyi nas bla mar 'gyur ba dang / rdzas kyis dman pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su btang zhing sems can skal pa dang ldan par gyur pa gzhan rnams la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang mi ster bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will not give the worldly abhiṣekas to other fortunate sentient beings.🔽They will generate afflictions toward them, and by the power of substances, they will generate the vajra words in fierce sentient beings.

original: de dag rnams la nyon mongs pa skyed par 'gyur ba dang / rdzas kyi dbang gis gdug pa'i sems can rnams la rdo rje'i tshig rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang rdo rje'i tshig mi shes pa phan tshun rtsod pa byed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de dag rnams la nyon mongs pa skyed par 'gyur ba dang / rdzas kyi dbang gis gdug pa'i sems can rnams la rdo rje'i tshig rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang rdo rje'i tshig mi shes pa phan tshun rtsod pa byed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Also, not knowing the vajra words, they will argue with each other.

original: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud kyi don mi shes pa rnams kyang rgyud kyi 'grel bshad byed par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi ris rnams sems can rnams kyi bla mar gyur nas rdo rje'i tshig phyin ci log tu ston par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud kyi don mi shes pa rnams kyang rgyud kyi 'grel bshad byed par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi ris rnams sems can rnams kyi bla mar gyur nas rdo rje'i tshig phyin ci log tu ston par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The demons will become the gurus of sentient beings and will teach the vajra words in a distorted way.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dbang po gnyis las skyes pa'i bde bar byis pa'i blo can rnams la ston par 'gyur ba dang / gsum pa shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dbang po gnyis las skyes pa'i bde bar byis pa'i blo can rnams la ston par 'gyur ba dang / gsum pa shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi pa ste /
translated: The bliss that arises from the two organs will be taught to the childish as the wisdom of the buddhas.🔽The third wisdom is the fourth.

original: de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i sgra rgyu dang 'bras bu dbye ba med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes gsum pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su smra bar 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i yul gang du mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i sgra rgyu dang 'bras bu dbye ba med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes gsum pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su smra bar 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i yul gang du mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis /
translated: The word “thus” is the indivisibility of cause and effect. The Bhagavān said that the wisdom of the third is the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: glegs bam mthong nas dbang bskur med par rdo rje theg pa ston pa po byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: glegs bam mthong nas dbang bskur med par rdo rje theg pa ston pa po byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Having seen the books, they will become teachers of the Vajrayāna without having received empowerment.🔽

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi gdug pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi 'jug pa gzigs nas /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi gdug pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi 'jug pa gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that in the future there will be evil masters who, having seen the tantras, will teach the Vajrayana without empowerment,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud dang / rgyud gzhan thams cad du bzhi pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gsal por ma mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud dang / rgyud gzhan thams cad du bzhi pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gsal por ma mdzad de /
translated: the Bhagavan Buddha did not clearly explain the fourth empowerment, the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, in all the tantras and other tantras.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / bsdus pa'i rgyud rnams su bzhi pa shes rab ye shes dang / phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam shin tu sbas shing /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / bsdus pa'i rgyud rnams su bzhi pa shes rab ye shes dang / phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam shin tu sbas shing /
translated: In the root tantras and the condensed tantras, the fourth empowerment, the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, and the meditation of the great seal, the path of smoke and so forth, are very hidden.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'ga' zhig la rab tu gsal lo //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'ga' zhig la rab tu gsal lo //
translated: In some root tantras, they are very clear.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di dang / bsdus pa'i rgyud la yang bzhi pa shes rab ye shes rab tu gsal zhing phyag @153b rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam yang rab tu gsal ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas 'di dang / bsdus pa'i rgyud la yang bzhi pa shes rab ye shes rab tu gsal zhing phyag @153b rgya chen po bsgom pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam yang rab tu gsal ba /
translated: This supreme root tantra of the primordial buddha and the condensed tantra also clearly teach the fourth empowerment, the wisdom of wisdom, the meditation of the great seal, and the path of smoke and so forth.

original: rdo rje slob dpon brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not something that comes from a lineage of vajra master.

original: dper na sngags kyi lha dang / phyi rol gyi dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs dang / dpa' bo'i rim pa dang / rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pa yang /
analyzed: dper na sngags kyi lha dang / phyi rol gyi dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs dang / dpa' bo'i rim pa dang / rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pa yang /
translated: For example, the method of accomplishing the mantra deity and the external siddhis, the stage of the hero, and the stage of self-consecration

original: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: are not something that comes from a lineage of gurus.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rim pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar byed pa po 'di /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rim pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar byed pa po 'di /
translated: This stage of purity, the bestower of the siddhi of the great seal,

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rab tu gsal bar glegs bam du bris te ;
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la rab tu gsal bar glegs bam du bris te ;
translated: is clearly written in the supreme primordial buddha tantra and

original: chu bo sh'i ta'i byang du sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems kyi lhag par mos pa mkhyen nas /
analyzed: chu bo sh'i ta'i byang du sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems kyi lhag par mos pa mkhyen nas /
translated: To the north of the river Śītā, knowing the superior aspirations of fortunate sentient beings,🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan cing /
translated: To the north of the river Śītā, the Blessed One, having understood the superior aspirations of fortunate sentient beings,🔽taught the Dhāraṇī of the Essence of the Secret of the Tathāgatas.

original: phyag na rdo rjes glegs bam la bris pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes glegs bam la bris pa'o //
translated: This was written down in a book by Vajrapāṇi.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa tshad  mar byas nas /
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa tshad  mar byas nas /
translated: Taking the Praise of the Three Jewels as authoritative,

original: sems can rnams the tshom med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des na /
analyzed: sems can rnams the tshom med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des na /
translated: whatever causes sentient beings to be without doubt,

original: sngags kyi theg pa'i tshul thams cad kyi nges pa'i don /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa'i tshul thams cad kyi nges pa'i don /
translated: the definitive meaning of all the ways of the Mantra Vehicle

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la yang dag par bstan to //
translated: was taught by the Blessed One to Vajrapāṇi in the Praise of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i phyir gang gis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas mi shes pa des mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas mi shes pa des mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, whoever does not know the supreme primordial Buddha does not know the Praise of the Three Jewels.

original: gang gis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes pa des rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mi shes so //
analyzed: gang gis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes pa des rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mi shes so //
translated: Whoever does not know the Praise of the Three Jewels does not know the jñānakāya of Vajrapāṇi.

original: gang gis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mi shes pa des sngags kyi theg pa mi shes so //
analyzed: gang gis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi sku mi shes pa des sngags kyi theg pa mi shes so //
translated: Whoever does not know the gnosis body of Vajradhara does not know the Mantra Vehicle.

original: gang gis sngags kyi theg pa mi shes pa de dag thams cad ni 'khor ba pa ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lam dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sngags kyi theg pa mi shes pa de dag thams cad ni 'khor ba pa ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lam dang bral ba'o //
translated: All those who do not know the Mantra Vehicle are in cyclic existence, separated from the path of the Bhagavat Vajradhara.

original: de lta bas na mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas ni bla ma dam pa rnams kyis bstan par bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas ni bla ma dam pa rnams kyis bstan par bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, the supreme primordial Buddha should be taught by the holy Gurus.

original: thar pa don du gnyer pa'i slob ma dam pa rnams kyis mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa don du gnyer pa'i slob ma dam pa rnams kyis mnyan par bya'o //
translated: It should be heard by the holy disciples who seek liberation.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa ston phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa ston phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las /
translated: In the commentary on the root Tantra, the Stainless Light, a teaching on the Kalacakra Tantra, the king of all the condensed Tantras, in twelve thousand verses,

original: dkyil 'khor dang dbang la sogs pa bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te drug pa'o /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang dbang la sogs pa bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te drug pa'o /
translated: the sixth chapter, a summary of the mandalas, initiations, and so forth, is concluded.

original: // / @154a * //  da ni sdud par byed pa po 'jam dpal gyis zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig yang dag par bsdus pa de nyid bdag
analyzed: // / @154a * //  da ni sdud par byed pa po 'jam dpal gyis zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig yang dag par bsdus pa de nyid bdag
translated: Now, Mañjuśrī, the compiler, with three verses beginning with “O Sucandra, I am pleased with you,” summarizes the reply of the Blessed One from the Supreme Original Buddha.

original: gis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: I will now unravel that very summary.

original: zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu zhes pa la zla ba bzang po ni bod pa ste kye zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu zhes pa la zla ba bzang po ni bod pa ste kye zla ba bzang po khyod la bdag mgu'o //
translated: “O Sucandra, I am pleased with you” — Sucandra is an address, meaning “O Sucandra, I am pleased with you.”

original: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: From what? For what reason?

original: gang zhig khyod kyis dris pa dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor 'di ni rab mchog lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyis shes pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag mgu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig khyod kyis dris pa dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor 'di ni rab mchog lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyis shes pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag mgu'o //
translated: “This yoga of the Kālacakra is the supreme, not known by gods, humans, and so forth. For that reason, I am pleased.”

original: 'dir rab mchog lha rnams ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la sogs pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi mthar nye bar son pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir rab mchog lha rnams ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la sogs pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi mthar nye bar son pa rnams so //
translated: Here, the supreme gods are those who have reached the peak of existence, from the realm of the Four Great Kings up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mi ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Humans are those such as universal monarchs.

original: srin po ni bden bral la sogs pa'o //🔽lha min ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: srin po ni bden bral la sogs pa'o // lha min ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Rākṣasas are those such as Virūpākṣa.🔽Demigods are those such as Virūpākṣa.

original: / klu ni mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / klu ni mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nāgas are those such as Ananta.

original: chags bral ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those free from desire are noble ones such as Ānanda.

original: thub mchog ni drang srong mi sbyin la sogs pa ste 'di dag gi rigs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: thub mchog ni drang srong mi sbyin la sogs pa ste 'di dag gi rigs rnams kyis so //
translated: The supreme sages are sages such as Ajita.🔽This is not known by these supreme gods, humans, and so forth, the yoga of the wheel of time, which is the ultimate of the continents of the end of misery and so forth.

original: rab mchog lha dang mi la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis shes pa ma yin pa dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs 'dzin ma'i mthar thug ces pa gang gi dang po mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams dang mtha' 'dzin
analyzed: rab mchog lha dang mi la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis shes pa ma yin pa dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs 'dzin ma'i mthar thug ces pa gang gi dang po mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams dang mtha' 'dzin
translated: The end of misery is the element of gnosis, and the end is the continent of Jambu.

original: mas ste dbus su ma brjod pa nyid las nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'i khams so //
analyzed: mas ste dbus su ma brjod pa nyid las nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'i khams so //
translated: The middle one, i.e., the middle element, is not mentioned, but it is the element of air, fire, water, and space.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams 'di dag ni khyab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams 'di dag ni khyab par bya ba ste /
translated: These elements of space, etc., are the pervaded.

original: khyab par byed pa ni ye shes kyi khams so //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ni ye shes kyi khams so //
translated: The pervading is the element of intuition.

original: de ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel pas rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel pas rnal 'byor te /
translated: Thus, the yoga is the connection between the pervaded and the pervading.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
translated: The Bhagavān has said just this:

original: sa dang chu dang de bzhin me //🔽rlung dang nam mkha'i khams dang ni //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang de bzhin me // rlung dang nam mkha'i khams dang ni //
translated: Earth, water, and likewise fire,🔽Air, space, and the element of consciousness,

original: rnam shes khams drug par brjod pa //
analyzed: rnam shes khams drug par brjod pa //
translated: Are said to be the six elements.

original: skyes bu chen po'i gang zag go //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i gang zag go //
translated: They are the person of the great being.

original: zhes so // tshig gi bgrod pa dang bcas zhes pa la tshig ni rnam pa gnyis te a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes so // tshig gi bgrod pa dang bcas zhes pa la tshig ni rnam pa gnyis te a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The “along with the verbal path” is as follows: The word is of two kinds, that having the nature of ālikāli.

original: de dag gi bgrod pa ni tshig gi bgrod pa ste mgrin pa dang rkan dang spyi bo dang mchu dang so'i gnas rnams las dbyangs @154b dang gsal byed rnams brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bgrod pa ni tshig gi bgrod pa ste mgrin pa dang rkan dang spyi bo dang mchu dang so'i gnas rnams las dbyangs @154b dang gsal byed rnams brjod pa'o //
translated: Their path is the path of words, which are the vowels and consonants uttered from the places of the throat, palate, head, lips, and teeth.

original: bgrod pa de dang bcas pa ni sngags kyi brdas rab tu brdzod  pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa de dang bcas pa ni sngags kyi brdas rab tu brdzod  pa'o //
translated: The mantras are uttered with that path.

original: 'dir sngags kyi brda ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni sngags kyi brda yin la gnyis pa ni de kho na nyid kyi brda'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi brda ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni sngags kyi brda yin la gnyis pa ni de kho na nyid kyi brda'o //
translated: Here, the mantras are of two kinds: one is the mantra-sign, and the second is the sign of reality.

original: de la sngags kyi brda ni rab tu brjod pa ste 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngags kyi brda ni rab tu brjod pa ste 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: Among them, the mantra-sign is the utterance, which is mundane.

original: de kho na nyid ni dam pa'i don can tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni dam pa'i don can tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Reality is the ultimate, which is beyond verbal expression.

original: gang du rab tu brjod pa'i brda yin pa der aom a'a: h'um zhes pa la sogs pa sngags kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: gang du rab tu brjod pa'i brda yin pa der aom a'a: h'um zhes pa la sogs pa sngags kyi ming ngo //
translated: Where there is the sign of utterance, there the name of the mantra is Om, Ah, Hum, etc.

original: gang du de kho na nyid kyi brda yin pa der aa yig ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dang / de bzhin du sgyu 'phrul dra ba stong phrag bcu drug pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang du de kho na nyid kyi brda yin pa der aa yig ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dang / de bzhin du sgyu 'phrul dra ba stong phrag bcu drug pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavat taught in the Sixteen Thousand Illusion Web:

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the Buddhas, the Bhagavats,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: are perfect Buddhas arisen from A.🔽A is the best of all letters,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: is the holy letter of great meaning,

original: srog chen po ste skye ba med //
analyzed: srog chen po ste skye ba med //
translated: is the great life, is non-production,

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: is free from verbal expression,🔽is the best cause of all expressions,

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: and illuminates all words.

original: ces dang / yang de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dra ba'i le'u las /
analyzed: ces dang / yang de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dra ba'i le'u las /
translated: Also, the chapter on concentration of the Illusion Web says:

original: gsang sngags skye gnas yi ge med //
analyzed: gsang sngags skye gnas yi ge med //
translated: The source of secret mantra is the letterless.

original: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
translated: The great secret mantra is the three families.

original: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
translated: The great emptiness is the five letters.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces so //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces so //
translated: The empty drop is the six letters.

original: de kho na nyid dam pa'i don can gyi brda sngags kyi theg pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dam pa'i don can gyi brda sngags kyi theg pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavat taught the mantra vehicle, which is the symbol of the ultimate truth of thatness.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams gzhom du med cing brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams gzhom du med cing brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Thus, nirvana is the indestructible, inexpressible realm of pristine wisdom.

original: brjod du med pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi mtshan nyid can no zhes so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi mtshan nyid can no zhes so //
translated: It is characterized by inexpressible vowels and consonants.

original: nam mkha'i khams la sogs pa'i sngags kyi brda rab tu brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can mgrin pa la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la sogs pa'i sngags kyi brda rab tu brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can mgrin pa la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat taught the Dharma expressed by the mantra symbols of the realm of space, etc., which are characterized by the sounds of the throat, etc.

original: 'dir aa ku ha rnam par bcad pa ni mgrin pa las so //🔽ai tsu ya sha ni rkan las so //
analyzed: 'dir aa ku ha rnam par bcad pa ni mgrin pa las so // ai tsu ya sha ni rkan las so //
translated: Here, the vowels a, a, and a are cut off from the throat.🔽The vowels i, i, and u are from the palate.

original: ri tu ra sha ni spyi bo las so //🔽au pu wa  thpa ni mchu las so //
analyzed: ri tu ra sha ni spyi bo las so // au pu wa  thpa ni mchu las so //
translated: The vowels e, ai, o, and au are from the top of the head.🔽The vowels a, a, and a are from the lips.

original: li tu las ni  so las so //
analyzed: li tu las ni  so las so //
translated: The vowels r, r, and l are from the teeth.

original: de bzhin du gnas gnyis pa dang gnas gsum pa dang / gnas bzhi pa dang gnas lnga pa'i sngags te brtsegs pa'i sngags rnams kyang rab tu brjod pa'i brdas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas gnyis pa dang gnas gsum pa dang / gnas bzhi pa dang gnas lnga pa'i sngags te brtsegs pa'i sngags rnams kyang rab tu brjod pa'i brdas rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the mantras of the second abode, the third abode, the fourth abode, and the fifth abode, the mantras of the stacked [syllables], should be known by the symbolic expression of the utterance.

original: ming gi rang bzhin can de dag thams cad kyang @155a * //
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin can de dag thams cad kyang @155a * //
translated: All of those which have the nature of names

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du ming can gyi dngos po rnams go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du ming can gyi dngos po rnams go bar byed pa'o //
translated: are for the sake of accomplishing mundane powers, and they cause one to understand things which have names.

original: de kho na nyid kyi brda tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa dam pa'i don can las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub spangs pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las nges par bstan to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi brda tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa dam pa'i don can las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub spangs pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las nges par bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavān has taught in all the kings of tantras that the power of the mahāmudrā is for the sake of accomplishing the power of the karmamudrā and the jñānamudrā, which are abandoned as having a meaning of the ultimate, which is free from the expression of words that are symbolic of reality.

original: sbyor ba 'di mtha' dag ni lus dbus su ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di mtha' dag ni lus dbus su ste /
translated: This entire yoga is in the center of the body.

original: dkyil 'khor dag dang dbang ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa med pa'i gnas thob par bya ba'i slad du bdag gis bshad par bya yis mi'i bdag po bzang po khyod nyon cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dag dang dbang ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa med pa'i gnas thob par bya ba'i slad du bdag gis bshad par bya yis mi'i bdag po bzang po khyod nyon cig ces pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍala and empowerment will be explained by me in the sequence that will be explained, in order to attain the state without obscuration by all sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig bsdus pa'i mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig bsdus pa'i mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief summary of the Bhagavān's reply.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa sdud par byed pa po 'jam dpal gyis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las dus kyi stong pa rnams las zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas bstan pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa sdud par byed pa po 'jam dpal gyis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las dus kyi stong pa rnams las zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas bstan pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o
translated: Now, the Bhagavān's world systems will be summarized by Mañjuśrī, the compiler, in four verses beginning with from the empty times of the supreme original buddha, which I will explain.

original: // sngags kyi tshul 'di la bsngags pa ni /🔽theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung la //
analyzed: // sngags kyi tshul 'di la bsngags pa ni / theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung la //
translated: The praise of this mantra method:🔽The Bhagavān has said that the three vehicles' renunciation

original: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: Resides in the result of the single vehicle.

original: gang theg pa gsum gyi dgongs pa mi shes pa de ni dus las thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang theg pa gsum gyi dgongs pa mi shes pa de ni dus las thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever does not know the intention of the three vehicles will fall from the path of omniscience.

original: sngags kyi theg pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i skad gzhan mi shes pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang gi rdzas la nye par longs spyod pa byas pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i phyogs gzung bas phyi rol gyi yul nye bar longs spyod pa la chags par gyur na /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i skad gzhan mi shes pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang gi rdzas la nye par longs spyod pa byas pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i phyogs gzung bas phyi rol gyi yul nye bar longs spyod pa la chags par gyur na /
translated: If, not knowing the other language of the esoteric teaching of the Mantra Vehicle, he commits murder and so on, and if he enjoys the goods of the assembly hall and the temple, and if he adheres to the positions of eternalism and nihilism, and if he becomes attached to the enjoyment of external objects,

original: slob dpon gyi chas kyis dkon mchog gsum la co dris nas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi chas kyis dkon mchog gsum la co dris nas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, having mocked the Three Jewels with the guise of a master, he will go to hell.

original: 'dir 'jig rten pha rol dang 'jig rten 'di'i don du sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'i rgan pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pha rol dang 'jig rten 'di'i don du sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'i rgan pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, there are four elders whom sentient beings should please for the sake of this world and the next.

original: de dag las ye shes kyi rgan pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa'i rdo rje slob dpon dge slong ngam /
analyzed: de dag las ye shes kyi rgan pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa'i rdo rje slob dpon dge slong ngam /
translated: Among them, the one who is senior by virtue of his wisdom is the vajra master who has attained the superknowledges and the stages of joy and so forth.

original: khyim pa mchod par 'os pa dge slong bcu dang mnyam par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa mchod par 'os pa dge slong bcu dang mnyam par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One has said that he is worthy of offerings even if he is a layman, and is equal to ten fully ordained monks.

original: de @155b ming  na dka' thub kyis rgan pa ni ngur smrig 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de @155b ming  na dka' thub kyis rgan pa ni ngur smrig 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The one who is senior by virtue of his austerities is the one who wears the saffron colored robes.

original: ngur smrig 'dzin pa rnams las lo dang / sngags pa rnams dbang gis rgan pa khyim pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis thams cad du phyag bya ste /
analyzed: ngur smrig 'dzin pa rnams las lo dang / sngags pa rnams dbang gis rgan pa khyim pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis thams cad du phyag bya ste /
translated: Among those who wear the saffron colored robes, the one who is senior by virtue of his initiation is the householder master.

original: dka' thub kyis rgan pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa rnams la mngon par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dka' thub kyis rgan pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa rnams la mngon par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: He should be honored by all, because he is senior by virtue of his austerities, and because householders do not have the superknowledges.

original: / thos pas rgan pa ni mkhas pa mchod par 'os pa /
analyzed: / thos pas rgan pa ni mkhas pa mchod par 'os pa /
translated: The one who is senior by virtue of his learning is the scholar who is worthy of offerings,

original: bstan pa gsal bar byed pa phas kyi rgol ba bdud kyi rigs rnams 'dul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa gsal bar byed pa phas kyi rgol ba bdud kyi rigs rnams 'dul bar byed pa ste /
translated: who illuminates the teachings, and who subdues the opponents who are of the class of demons.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi don du sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi don du sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
translated: These are the four elders who are honored by sentient beings for the sake of the next world.

original: nor gyis rgan pa ni rgyal po ste 'jig rten 'de'i longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor gyis rgan pa ni rgyal po ste 'jig rten 'de'i longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
translated: The king is the elder in wealth, and is honored by those who seek the enjoyments of this world.

original: de ltar rgan po bzhi ni sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgan po bzhi ni sems can rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, these four elders are honored by sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir theg pa gsum shes pa po ni dka' thub kyis rgan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa gsum shes pa po ni dka' thub kyis rgan pa ste /
translated: The one who knows the three vehicles is the elder in austerity.

original: khyim pa la ni ji srid dka' thub par ma gyur par nyan thos kyi theg pa las so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i skabs med do /🔽// / de'i phyir khyim pa ni mngon shes dang ldan pa ma gtogs par rgan por mi 'gyur zhing khyim pa rab tu byung ba dang bral ba rnams tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang la nye bar longs spyod pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gang du yang
analyzed: khyim pa la ni ji srid dka' thub par ma gyur par nyan thos kyi theg pa las so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i skabs med do / // / de'i phyir khyim pa ni mngon shes dang ldan pa ma gtogs par rgan por mi 'gyur zhing khyim pa rab tu byung ba dang bral ba rnams tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang la nye bar longs spyod pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gang du yang
translated: As long as one is not an ascetic, a householder has no opportunity to listen to the Sravakayana vows of individual liberation.

original: ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One did not teach in any vehicle that householders, except for those with supernormal knowledge, would become elders, and that householders who are not renunciates would enjoy the assembly hall and monastery.

original: de bas na theg pa gsum yongs su shes par bya ba'i slad du dang por bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung la brten nas rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yod cing de bzhin du khur ba'i gang zag yod de rtag pa'am mi
analyzed: de bas na theg pa gsum yongs su shes par bya ba'i slad du dang por bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung la brten nas rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yod cing de bzhin du khur ba'i gang zag yod de rtag pa'am mi
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the three vehicles, first, based on the scriptures of the Vaibhāṣikas, one should know that the world has the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles and that the person who bears that burden exists.

original: rtag par bdag mi smra'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par bdag mi smra'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “I do not say that the self is permanent or impermanent.”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa dang / chags pa dang 'jig pa'i dus kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa dang / chags pa dang 'jig pa'i dus kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know the times of the origin, cessation, and formation of the world.🔽Therefore, formation is from the empty states that exist at the time of origin.

original: des na chags pa ni 'byung ba'i dus kyi dbang gi stong pa rnams las zhes pa la stong pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa rdul phra rab kyi ngo bos rnam par gnas pa
analyzed: des na chags pa ni 'byung ba'i dus kyi dbang gi stong pa rnams las zhes pa la stong pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa rdul phra rab kyi ngo bos rnam par gnas pa
translated: The empty states are not the domain of experience of the sense faculties such as the eyes and so on. They are the subtle particles that exist in a state of aggregation.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro'i rdzas yon tan lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi rang bzhin rnams dang / yon tan drug pa chos kyi dbyings thams cad du khyab par byed pa ni stong pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro'i rdzas yon tan lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi rang bzhin rnams dang / yon tan drug pa chos kyi dbyings thams cad du khyab par byed pa ni stong pa rnams so //
translated: The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.🔽The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.🔽The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.🔽The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.🔽The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.
