original: de bzhin du me'i rdul pra rab rnams kun du 'byar bar gyur pa rlung dang ldan pa'i glog ni me zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i rdul pra rab rnams kun du 'byar bar gyur pa rlung dang ldan pa'i glog ni me zhes brjod do //
translated: The wind is the first of those particles, due to the power of time.🔽The wind is the first of those particles

original: de bzhin du chu'i rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa kun du 'byar bar gyur pa rlung dang me dang ldan pa'i char ni chu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa kun du 'byar bar gyur pa rlung dang me dang ldan pa'i char ni chu zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, the collection of water particles, which are joined together and are endowed with wind and fire, is called water.

original: de bzhin du sa'i rdul phra rab kun du 'byar ba nam mkha' la dbang po'i gzhung snang ba ni 'dzin ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i rdul phra rab kun du 'byar ba nam mkha' la dbang po'i gzhung snang ba ni 'dzin ma zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, the collection of earth particles, which are joined together and are endowed with wind, fire and water, is called earth.

original: ro'i rdul phra rab rnams ni thams cad du khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ro'i rdul phra rab rnams ni thams cad du khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: The particles of taste are spread out everywhere.

original: de ltar stong pa lnga rnams las rlung dang 'bar byed chu dang 'dzin ma rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa lnga rnams las rlung dang 'bar byed chu dang 'dzin ma rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, from the five empty spaces, wind, fire, water and earth are formed.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa dang srub pa dang dbyibs kyi rlung gi mthu las gling dang ri bo rgya mtsho dang zhes pa la gling ni bdun no ;🔽/ ri bo ni bdun no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa dang srub pa dang dbyibs kyi rlung gi mthu las gling dang ri bo rgya mtsho dang zhes pa la gling ni bdun no ; / ri bo ni bdun no //
translated: From the power of the wind of correct grasping, churning and shaping, there are the continents, mountains, oceans,🔽seven continents,🔽seven mountains,

original: rgya mtsho ni bdun no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni bdun no //
translated: seven oceans,

original: rgyu skar dang ni nyi zla skar ma gza' yi tshogs dang drang srong zhes pa la rgyu skar ni nyi shu rtsa bdun dang de'i 'brel pa mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar dang ni nyi zla skar ma gza' yi tshogs dang drang srong zhes pa la rgyu skar ni nyi shu rtsa bdun dang de'i 'brel pa mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: The stars, the sun and moon, the planets and the constellations, and the sages. The stars are the twenty-seven lunar mansions and their infinite connections.

original: nyi zla ni zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: nyi zla ni zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The sun and moon are the round forms.

original: skar ma gza' yi tshogs zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid du skar ma'i rnam pa can bkra shis la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: skar ma gza' yi tshogs zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid du skar ma'i rnam pa can bkra shis la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The planets and constellations are the planets such as Jupiter, which have the form of stars.

original: drang srong ni skar ma bdun no //
analyzed: drang srong ni skar ma bdun no //
translated: The sages are the seven stars.🔽The gods, spirits, nagas,

original: lha dang 'byung po klu rnams dang // zhes pa la lha ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang 'byung po klu rnams dang // zhes pa la lha ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la sogs pa'o //
translated: The gods are the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings and so forth.

original: 'byung po ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang yi dags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang yi dags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The spirits are the invincible ones, the hungry ghosts and so forth.

original: klu ni mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: klu ni mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nagas are Ananta and so forth.

original: dud 'gro skye gnas rnam pa bzhi dang zhes pa la sgo nga las skyes pa ni nam mkha' lding la sogs pa ste rlung gi skye gnas so //
analyzed: dud 'gro skye gnas rnam pa bzhi dang zhes pa la sgo nga las skyes pa ni nam mkha' lding la sogs pa ste rlung gi skye gnas so //
translated: The four types of animal birth. Those born from eggs are the garudas and so forth, the wind birth.

original: mngal nas skyes pa ni glang po'i dbang po la sogs pa ste me'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa ni glang po'i dbang po la sogs pa ste me'i skye gnas so //
translated: Birth from a womb is the birth of elephants and so on, which is a fiery birth.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa ni srin bu dang phye ma leb dang grog spur la sogs pa ste chu'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa ni srin bu dang phye ma leb dang grog spur la sogs pa ste chu'i skye gnas so //
translated: Birth from heat and moisture is the birth of worms, butterflies, ants and so on, which is a watery birth.

original: rdzus te skyes pa ni ljon pa la sogs pa ste sa'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa ni ljon pa la sogs pa ste sa'i skye gnas so //
translated: Birth by transformation is the birth of trees and so on, which is an earthy birth.

original: de bzhin du rdzus te skyes pa chen po ni ro'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzus te skyes pa chen po ni ro'i skye gnas so //
translated: Similarly, a great birth by transformation is a birth from a corpse.

original: sna tshogs sa dang 'og tu zhes pa las zhes pa ni lung gi tshig go //
analyzed: sna tshogs sa dang 'og tu zhes pa las zhes pa ni lung gi tshig go //
translated: The line “and the various earths below” is a scriptural quotation.

original: sna tshogs kyang de yin las yang yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs sa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyang de yin las yang yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs sa ste /
translated: It is various and it is an earth, thus it is a various earth.

original: gling bdun gyi rang bzhin dang dum bu @156b bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gling bdun gyi rang bzhin dang dum bu @156b bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is of the nature of the seven continents and the twelve subcontinents.

original: de'i 'og ni sna tshogs sa'i 'og ste klu'i srid pa dang dmyal ba'i srid pa bdun no //
analyzed: de'i 'og ni sna tshogs sa'i 'og ste klu'i srid pa dang dmyal ba'i srid pa bdun no //
translated: Below that is below the various earths, which are the naga existences and the seven hell existences.

original: sna tshogs sa de la mi rnams dang 'og dmyal ba'i srid par dmyal ba rnams te yang yig ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs sa de la mi rnams dang 'og dmyal ba'i srid par dmyal ba rnams te yang yig ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The various places are the human realm and the hells, and the beings are humans and hell-beings. The word “also” means “in addition.”

original: stong pa'i dbus su yang dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i dbus su yang dag 'byung ste /
translated: They arise in the middle of the void.🔽Like salt in water and like an egg in the womb,

original: chu la lan tshva dang ni sgo nga'i dbus su sgong skyes bzhin zhes pa ni 'dir brtan pa rnams skyed pa la lan tshva dang g-yo ba rnams skyed pa la sgo nga dper 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu la lan tshva dang ni sgo nga'i dbus su sgong skyes bzhin zhes pa ni 'dir brtan pa rnams skyed pa la lan tshva dang g-yo ba rnams skyed pa la sgo nga dper 'gyur te /
translated: here, the stable ones are like salt, and the mobile ones are like an egg.

original: dang zhes pa ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dang zhes pa ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The word “and” means “in addition.”

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyi sbyor ba las lan tshva chu'i rdul phra rab rnams lan tshva sra ba nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du lhun po la sogs pa brtan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyi sbyor ba las lan tshva chu'i rdul phra rab rnams lan tshva sra ba nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du lhun po la sogs pa brtan pa rnams so //
translated: For example, by the combination of sunlight and water, the particles of salt become the solidity of salt. In the same way, there are the stable ones such as Mount Meru.

original: dper na khu bzhu ba'i rdul phra rab rnams sgo nga'i dbus su gdong ba'i lus la sogs pa'i cha shas nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du g-yo ba sems can rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na khu bzhu ba'i rdul phra rab rnams sgo nga'i dbus su gdong ba'i lus la sogs pa'i cha shas nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du g-yo ba sems can rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: For example, the particles of melted fluid become the parts of the body such as the face in the middle of the egg. In the same way, there are the mobile sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'byung ba ni le'u lnga par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'byung ba ni le'u lnga par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The elements of this world-system will be described in detail in chapter five.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'o //
translated: This is the great summary of the summary of the world-system.

original: da ni 'jam dpal gyis lus dang zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma'i rim pas bstan pa rdo rje'i lus bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'jam dpal gyis lus dang zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma'i rim pas bstan pa rdo rje'i lus bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the five verses that summarize the vajra body, in the order of the previous teaching, beginning with the body of Manjushri, and so on.

original: lus zhes pa ni zla ba sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lus zhes pa ni zla ba sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Body refers to the moon free from obscurations.

original: ye shes zhes pa ni nyi ma sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa ni nyi ma sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Wisdom refers to the sun free from obscurations.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa dang bral ba ste de bzhin du rlung gi khams dang me'i khams dang chu'i khams dang sa'i khams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa dang bral ba ste de bzhin du rlung gi khams dang me'i khams dang chu'i khams dang sa'i khams so //
translated: Space refers to the space element free from obscurations, and similarly, the wind element, the fire element, the water element, and the earth element.

original: brtan pa zhes pa ni khams lnga'i bdag nyid brtan pa'i khams sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes pa ni khams lnga'i bdag nyid brtan pa'i khams sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Stable refers to the stable element, the nature of the five elements, free from obscurations.

original: g-yo ba zhes pa ni khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi gang zag gi khams sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes pa ni khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi gang zag gi khams sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Moving” is the person who is the nature of the six elements, free from obscuration.

original: lha ni mthong  ba skyed min dag dang zhes pa ni lha yang de yin la mthong  bskyed min yang yin pa de ni lha ni mthong  ba skyed min te /
analyzed: lha ni mthong  ba skyed min dag dang zhes pa ni lha yang de yin la mthong  bskyed min yang yin pa de ni lha ni mthong  ba skyed min te /
translated: “The gods are not born from seeing” are the gods who are not born from seeing.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnam par shes pa'i nga rgyal tsam dang ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnam par shes pa'i nga rgyal tsam dang ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: They are the four types of formless existence, which are endowed with the mere pride of consciousness, such as the sphere of infinite space.

original: de ltar lus la sogs pa rdo rje ye shes kyi rten srid pa rnam pa bcur de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rdo rje'i lus las sngags kyi skye gnas thig le la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lus la sogs pa rdo rje ye shes kyi rten srid pa rnam pa bcur de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rdo rje'i lus las sngags kyi skye gnas thig le la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has taught that the body, etc., are the ten existences that are the basis of the vajra intuition. From the vajra body, the mantra birth, the drop, etc., will arise.

original: mi'i bdag po ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i bdag po ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the Tibetan.

original: 'dir sngags @157a * //
analyzed: 'dir sngags @157a * //
translated: Here, the mantra

original: kyi skye gnas ni zla ba las thig le dang / nyi ma las rnam par bcad pa dang / nam mkha'i khams las aa dang rlung gi khams las ai dang me'i khams las ri dang chu'i khams las au dang sa'i khams las li dang brtan pa'i khams las gsal byed ma dang g-yo ba'i khams las gsal byed ksha dang gzugs med pa'i khams las gsal byed ha
analyzed: kyi skye gnas ni zla ba las thig le dang / nyi ma las rnam par bcad pa dang / nam mkha'i khams las aa dang rlung gi khams las ai dang me'i khams las ri dang chu'i khams las au dang sa'i khams las li dang brtan pa'i khams las gsal byed ma dang g-yo ba'i khams las gsal byed ksha dang gzugs med pa'i khams las gsal byed ha
translated: The place of origin of the vowels is the moon, of the consonants the sun, of the letter a the element of space, of the letter i the element of wind, of the letter u the element of fire, of the letter e the element of water, of the letter o the element of earth, of the sibilants the stable element, of the gutturals the moving element, and of the letter h the formless element.

original: yig ste / sngags kyi tshig 'di dag g-yon skor gyis dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: yig ste / sngags kyi tshig 'di dag g-yon skor gyis dgod par bya'o //
translated: These mantra syllables should be arranged in a counterclockwise direction.

original: de ltar gsal byed snga ma gsal byed phyi ma'i steng du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsal byed snga ma gsal byed phyi ma'i steng du 'gro'o //
translated: Thus, the earlier consonants go above the later consonants.

original: li yig la sogs pa rnams ni ai ka ni aa tsa la ya na'o zhes pas ya nar  bsgyur te mtha'i aa yig gis yang dag par sbyar ro //
analyzed: li yig la sogs pa rnams ni ai ka ni aa tsa la ya na'o zhes pas ya nar  bsgyur te mtha'i aa yig gis yang dag par sbyar ro //
translated: The letters li and so forth are changed to ya by the rule “li and so forth are y,” and they are combined with the final letter a.

original: rnam par bcad pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The letter visarga has the form of a half moon.

original: thig le zlum po'o //
analyzed: thig le zlum po'o //
translated: The letter bindu is round.

original: ye shes rtse mo'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rtse mo'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The letter jñ is the form of the peak of wisdom.

original: yon tan dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams kyi sngags kyi skye gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams kyi sngags kyi skye gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The source of the mantras of qualities, increase, and so on is as follows.

original: ha ksha ma li au ri ai aa: hkshmlwr+yam zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshogs dang rdo rje'i lus te nam mkha'i khams la ya yig rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ha ksha ma li au ri ai aa: hkshmlwr+yam zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshogs dang rdo rje'i lus te nam mkha'i khams la ya yig rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Hakshamaliuryaṃ is the collection of world systems and the vajra body, the space element. The letter ya is the wind maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du ra yig me'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽de'i steng du wa yig chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du ra yig me'i dkyil 'khor ro // de'i steng du wa yig chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Above that, the letter ra is the fire maṇḍala.🔽Above that, the letter va is the water maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du la yig sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du la yig sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Above that, the letter la is the earth maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du ma yig lhun po rnam pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ma yig lhun po rnam pa lnga pa'o //
translated: Above that, the letter ma is the five-part Meru.

original: de'i steng du ksha yig padma'i tshul gyis g-yo ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de'i steng du ksha yig padma'i tshul gyis g-yo ba'i tshogs so //
translated: Above that, the letter kṣa is the moving collection in the form of a lotus.

original: de'i steng du gzugs med pa'i tshogs ha yig go //
analyzed: de'i steng du gzugs med pa'i tshogs ha yig go //
translated: Above that, the collection of the formless realms is the letter ha.

original: ha yig las rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang thig le zla ba dang n'a da rdo rje'i mtshan ma rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ha yig las rnam par bcad pa nyi ma dang thig le zla ba dang n'a da rdo rje'i mtshan ma rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: From the letter ha, the section is the sun, the drop is the moon, and the nada is the single-pronged vajra.

original: de ltar rdo rje'i lus dang 'jig rten gyi khams dang dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje'i lus dang 'jig rten gyi khams dang dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the form of the vajra body, the world, and the maṇḍala will be explained by the explanation that is to come.

original: de ltar sngags kyi skye gnas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing slar yang 'di nyid du grol te zhes pa ni slar yang sdud pa'i dus su 'di nyid la grol ba ste thim par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi skye gnas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing slar yang 'di nyid du grol te zhes pa ni slar yang sdud pa'i dus su 'di nyid la grol ba ste thim par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the origin of the birth of mantra will occur, and again, liberated in just this [world], means that again, at the time of re-absorption, liberated in just this [world], it will dissolve.

original: de ltar gang gis yang dag rig pa zhes pa ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sgrib pa dang bral ba 'dis rdo rje'i lus gang su zhig gis rig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang gis yang dag rig pa zhes pa ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sgrib pa dang bral ba 'dis rdo rje'i lus gang su zhig gis rig pa'o //
translated: Thus, he who knows reality, means that by this process of description, free from obscuration, he who knows the vajra body.

original: de ni phyugs min zhes pa phyugs de mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyugs min zhes pa phyugs de mi shes pa'o //
translated: He is not an animal, means that animal does not know.

original: sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag las grol zhes pa la kun du rtog pa ni dkyil 'khor du brtags pa'i chos te de las @157b grol ba ni sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag las grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag las grol zhes pa la kun du rtog pa ni dkyil 'khor du brtags pa'i chos te de las @157b grol ba ni sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag las grol ba'o //
translated: Liberated from the conceptual thoughts of the mind, means that conceptual thought is the dharma imagined in the maṇḍala, and liberated from that is liberated from the conceptual thoughts of the mind.

original: rnam pa bcu po 'di mdor bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la bstod pa las de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di mdor bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la bstod pa las de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: These ten aspects are taught by the Tathagata in the Praise of the Dharmadhatu's Perfect Purity:

original: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
translated: The ten aspects have ten meanings.

original: thub dbang stobs bcu khyab pa'i bdag /
analyzed: thub dbang stobs bcu khyab pa'i bdag /
translated: The Lord of Sages, the all-pervading lord of the ten powers,

original: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: Accomplishes all meanings without exception.

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //
translated: The one with ten powers is the great one,🔽The beginningless one, the one free from elaborations,🔽The one with the nature of suchness, the pure one,

original: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid bdag dag pa'i bdag / bden par smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid bdag dag pa'i bdag / bden par smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur //
translated: The one who speaks the truth, the one whose words are unchanging,

original: ji skang smras pa de bzhin byed //
analyzed: ji skang smras pa de bzhin byed //
translated: The one who acts in accordance with his words,

original: gnyis med gnyis su med par gsung //
analyzed: gnyis med gnyis su med par gsung //
translated: The one who is non-dual and teaches non-duality,

original: yang dag mtha' las  rnam par gnas //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' las  rnam par gnas //
translated: The one who abides within the limit of reality.
